Several generators, motorcycles, and foodstuffs were stolen. The police later regained control over the facility.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: Property destruction: On 9 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Morne a Tuf, Ouest, overnight, gang members occupied, looted, and vandalized the Sciences Faculty of the UEH University. A quantity of items and materials were stolen. Some windows were broken.

Looting: On 14 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - La Saline, Ouest, overnight, gang members looted and vandalized a car dealership and the Caribbean Port Services S.A. facilities. This also happened in the Bas Delmas neighbourhood.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Progres; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Loop News Haiti
notes: Property destruction: On 18 March 2024, in Cite Soleil - Hasco/Village Democratie, Ouest, armed gang members looted, vandalized, and destroyed four power stations belonging to the Haiti's Electricity (EDH) state company and the Varreux Terminal S.A. power plant. The gangsters stole documents, electrical installations, and batteries, among other items. Public power supply was interrupted and black-outs were recorded in many areas in the down town.

source: Haiti Press Network; Haiti Progres; Loop News St. Lucia; Vi Free Press
notes: Property destruction: On 16 March 2024, in Delmas - 1er Cite Saint Martin, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals looted and vandalized the Honorary Consulate of Guatemala. It happened as Haitian and Guatemalan employees were working at the building, although no one was injured. Motivation unknown. There were no casualties.

source: Gazette Haiti; Haiti Progres; Rezo Nodwes
notes: Property destruction: On 15 March 2024, in Petion Ville - Bellevue la Montagne, Ouest, overnight, gang members looted 50 properties in Bellevue 15, 16, and 17 areas. One of the houses belongs to the mother of a minister which was also set on fire. The properties were empty, as residents had left the area on 13 March after the gang members had announced their intention of entering these areas.

Looting: On 14 March 2024, in Tabarre - Cazeau/Tabarre 14, Ouest, armed individuals looted a bank's branch in Cazeau. Other businesses were also looted in other areas of the capital (coded separately).

Looting: On 15 March 2024, in Tabarre - Croix des Missions, Ouest, warehouses were looted. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship behind the incidents. This action is likely related to other lootings by armed men recorded in the metropolitan area of Port-au-Prince.

source: GardaWorld; Gazette Haiti; Loop News Haiti
notes: Property destruction: On 3 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, armed gang members 'attacked' (methods unknown) and looted the National Library building. They stole the building's generator and furniture. It was not clarified whether there were people inside when the assault took place. The building had been attacked for the first time on 1 April (coded separately).

Looting: On 27 March 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 5, Ouest, armed group members 'attacked' (method unknown) and looted the Saint-Martin health centre. The event occurred the day after another hospital in the area was looted (coded separately). It was not clarified whether the medical staff was present when the assault took place.

source: Haiti Press Network; Haiti Progres; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti)
notes: Looting: On 6 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Morne a Tuf, Ouest, gang members looted the First Baptist church (Evangelical Christian) located on Reunion street. The temple was stripped of all equipment relating to sound, projection, computers, ventilation, and electronics. It was not clarified whether there were people inside when the assault took place.
Property destruction: Around 11 April 2024 (week of), in Port-au-Prince - Cathedrale, Ouest, armed group members looted and set fire to the JB Damier Vocational School. Some items were stolen.

Property destruction: On 5 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, armed gang members looted the National Library building and set fire to some documents that were inside the institution. It was not clarified whether there were people inside when the assault took place. The building had been attacked by armed gang members on 1 April and 3 April (coded separately).

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: Looting: On 18 January 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Cathedrale, Ouest, armed gangsters (likely Belair gang) looted the Holy Trinity Episcopal Church, on Pavee street. The looting occurred amid clashes between the police and the Belair gang in Port-au-Prince center (coded separately).

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: Property destruction: On 29 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Morne a Tuf, Ouest, gangsters set fire to a part of the Peace Court building. The perpetrators suspectedly are affiliates of the Living Together gang-led coalition (Viv Ansanm gang).

Looting: On 18 April 2024, in Petion Ville - Desir-Gabriel, Ouest, overnight, an unknown number of armed individuals looted and vandalized the Presses Nationales d'Haiti headquarters (public office). Some documents were stolen and scattered on the streets.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: Property destruction: On 21 March 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 2, Ouest, overnight, gangsters vandalized the Canez Construction Company. This event occurred after clashes between police and gang members recorded earlier (coded separately).

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: Looting: On 17 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, overnight, armed gang members looted and vandalized the facilities of 'Le Nouvelliste' Newspaper, as well as a nearby commercial printing business, both located on the Centre street. The criminals took away furniture and essential materials for the newspaper's operational capacity. Looting scenes against the national news agency persisted for several days. Le Nouvelliste was able to released the information around 25 April.
Looting: On 21 May 2024, in Tabarre - Tapage, Ouest, armed gang members looted the facilities of the Kay Mr. Chacha private company.

Looting: On 22 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, gang members looted the Faculty of Law and Economic Sciences. Solar panels and other materials were stolen. Some material damages were mentioned.

Property destruction: On 22 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Grand Ravine, Ouest, overnight, members of the Living-Together gang-led initiative (a.k.a. Viv Ansanm Gang) demolished a police station after having chased several civilians who were using it as shelter.

source: Gazette Haiti; Haiti Progres; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Loop News Haiti
notes: Property destruction: On 19 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, in the morning, armed gang members assaulted the Superior Court of Account and Administrative Disputes, located on the Reunion Street. The gang members had already assaulted the building on 17 May (coded separately).

source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: Looting: On 1 June 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 75, in the morning, a group of heavily armed individuals looted and vandalized the National Old Age Insurance Office. The looters were dressed in police uniforms. Some of them were identified as former and active police officers.

Looting: Around 10 June 2024 (as reported), in Tabarre - Caradeux, Ouest, members of the Living Together gang-led initiative (a.k.a. Viv Ansanm Gang) assaulted the Parquet de la Croix-des-Bouquets, which was relocated to Tabarre 23 after its premises in Croix-des-Bouquets were set on fire in July 2022 (coded separately). According to witnesses, the Chien Mechant Gang chased residents in Tabarre 23, although it was not clarified if they carried out the parquet's assault. An unspecified number of documents were missed.

Looting: On 7 July 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 5, Ouest, three armed individuals looted and vandalized the Saint Martin of Tours Episcopal Church (Catholic group), located on the Delmas Road. According to witnesses, the perpetrators were looking for a priest that they were unable to find. They did not harm anyone. Motivation for the assault unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Rezo Nodwes
notes: Property destruction: On 7 July 2024, in Tabarre - HT Monquette, Ouest, in the morning, members of the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) assaulted, looted, and burned the facilities of the INUKA private university, located on 15 Octobre Boulevard. A nearby church was burned.

source: Haiti Press Network; Haiti Standard; Rezo Nodwes
notes: Property destruction: On 10 July 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang fired shots, knocked down the main gate of the Haiti State University Hospital (HUEH), and took control of the facility. It happened a day after authorities declared to have regained control of the building, which had been under siege since a gang attack several months prior (coded separately). The police denied this information, although the scene was recorded and shared on social media.
Looting: Around 2 March 2024 (as reported), in Delmas - Cite Numero Un, Ouest, armed group members looted the so called Kay Paste warehouse, in Delmas 18. The goods that were inside were stolen.

Looting: On 7 July 2024, in Gressier - Cite Gressier, Ouest, armed 103 Zombies Gang members took over the Gressier police station. The occupation persisted until 1 August, when police forces regained control of the facility.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Progres; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Rezo Nodwes; Vi Free Press
notes: Property destruction: On 25 March 2024, in Carrefour - Fontamara Est, Ouest, gang members set fire to the Freres Nau Mixed School.

Property destruction: On 29 August 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Solino, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang set fire to an armoured vehicle belonging to the Haitian and Kenyan police forces integrating the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS).

Looting: On 30 August 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour Feuilles, Ouest, overnight, a group of around 20 gang members looted a house on Roy street. The property was located in an area already under the control of the gangs. It was likely unoccupied. No further details were mentioned.
Looting: Around 3 September 2024 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Bas Peu de Choses, Ouest, armed gang members looted residents' houses on Nicolas Street.
Looting: On 13 September 2024, in Delmas - Pele Simon, Ouest, armed men were seen in the area and were suspected to attack a business. There is no information on the nature of the attack.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Alterpresse; BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Gazette Haiti; Jamaica Observer; Vi Free Press
notes: On 10 December 2024, in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune, Artibonite, overnight, members of the Palmiste Gang and the Lika Gang in support of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang shot and killed civilians (including children) at homes in areas between Bas Coursin II and Labady sections (2nd and 3rd Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite's communal sections, respectively). In Laverdure area (Bas Coursin II), the criminals burned farmers' houses and vehicles. Some victims were mutilated. On 10 December, gang members killed at least 70 civilians (40 men, 20 women, and 10 minors) in locations in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune in reprisal for having helped officers retake control of a police headquarters (coded separately). 20 people, including 12 men and eight women, were kidnapped during this an another attack recorded in Petite Riviere de L'Artibonite on the same day. Some of them were found executed in nearby properties the day after. The other abducted victims' whereabouts are unknown. At least 70 fatalities split across two events coded. 35 fatalities coded here.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Alterpresse; BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Jamaica Observer; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Trip Foumi; Vi Free Press
notes: On 10 December 2024, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, overnight, members of the Palmiste Gang and the Lika Gang in support of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang shot and killed at least nine civilians (including children) at homes near the Henri Christophe School (between Capois Street and the 14eme/Quatorzieme area). 10 houses and three vehicles were burned. On 10 December, gang members killed at least 70 civilians (40 men, 20 women, and 10 minors) in locations in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune in reprisal for having helped officers retake control of a police headquarters (coded separately). 20 people, including 12 men and eight women, were kidnapped during this an another attack recorded in Petite Riviere de L'Artibonite on the same day. Some of them were found executed in nearby properties the day after. The other abducted victims' whereabouts are unknown. At least 70 fatalities split across two events. 35 fatalities coded here.

actor2: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 10 December 2024, near Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, Haitian police forces supported by the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) killed several gang members (likely from the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang) during clashes in the Palmiste locality. This was part of anti-gang operations in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune that also led to the dismantling of gang bases and the removal of gang roadblocks. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

actor2: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 10 December 2024, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, overnight, police forces clashed with the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang and their affiliates of the Palmiste Gang and Lika Gang. Clashes took place for more than three hours as the criminals attacked residents in the commune (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Trip Foumi
notes: On 9 December 2024, in Deluge, Artibonite, armed gang members operating in Montrouis attacked a public transport minibus with 18 passengers onboard on the National Road 1. At least seven passengers and the driver were shot and killed, while the other 10 were injured. The attack was motivated by a longstanding land conflict in the Piatre locality, where farmers are confronting influential groups for the control of a set of properties. At least 8 fatalities, 10 injured.

Other: On 6 December 2024, between Mirebalais, Centre, and Belladere, Centre, a roadblock was set up on the Route Departementale #31. There is no information on the motives for the roadblock or who set it up.

Other: On 3 December 2024, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Carrefour Vincent (Sarthe neighborhood) and the Drouillard neighborhood. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 5 December 2024, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Sarthe. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
On 2 December 2024, around Cite Soleil - Sarthe, Ouest, there were gunfire exchanges. There is no information on the circumstances of the clashes or the perpetrators involved. Casualties unknown.

Other: On 1 December 2024, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were registered in Carrefour Aeroport. They were heard from different areas in Delmas. Some stray bullets were also registered in Delmas 19. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 4 December 2024, in Delmas, stray bullets were registered on the Airport Road. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

On 10 December 2024, in Delmas, Ouest, overnight, Haitian police forces and the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) deployed in Bas Delmas and engaged in armed clashes with gang members. This was part of anti-gang operations against the Viv Ansanm Gang. Several gang members were killed or injured. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 13 December 2024, in Delmas, Ouest, police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang in Bas Delmas. Casualties unknown.

On 10 December 2024, in Delmas - Carrefour Aeroport/Delmas 13, Ouest, police forces and agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) clashed with gang members in Carrefour Aerorport as they carried out security operations. Several gang members were killed or injured. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 28 November 2024, in Delmas - Christ-Roi, Ouest, according to residents, masked armed individuals who arrived in a vehicle with no plate fired shots as they attacked the Christ-Roi and Delmas 32 (coded separately) neighborhoods in Delmas. The perpetrators were suspect members of the Viv Ansanm Gang, who have been trying to take control of the Christ-Roi and Delmas 32 neighborhoods since they attacked and took control of the Nazon and Solino neighborhoods in mid-November (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: Amerique Info 7; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Trip Foumi
notes: On 10 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, overnight, the Viv Ansanm Gang killed and injured several residents as they attacked the Delmas 19, Delmas 17, and Carrefour Aeroport (coded separately) neighborhoods. In Delmas 19, at least one person was shot and injured. A dozen vehicles were set on fire. Security forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 11 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang fired shots as they attacked the Delmas 30 neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

On 28 November 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 32, Ouest, according to residents, masked armed individuals who arrived in a vehicle with no plate fired shots as they attacked the Delmas 32 and Christ-Roi (coded separately) neighborhoods in Delmas. The perpetrators were suspect members of the Viv Ansanm Gang, who have been trying to take control of the Christ-Roi and Delmas 32 neighborhoods since they attacked and took control of the Nazon and Solino neighborhoods in mid-November (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: PNH: National Police of Haiti; Trip Foumi
notes: Looting: On 10 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 40b, Ouest, gang members hijacked a bus in Delmas 40b neighborhood. The vehicle was recovered later that day as police forces clashed with the criminals in the Bois Verna neighborhood (coded separately).

Around 2 October 2024 (month of), in Kenscoff, Ouest, gang members attacked civilian and police officer passersby in the public market of the Morne Kajak area. There is no further information on the incident. Casualties unknown.

Other: On 1 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard on Charles Sumner Avenue and near the Sacre Coeur school (Turgeau neighborhood). There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 2 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Christ-Roi. Although there is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots, they might have been related to an attack or clash in the Nazon area (coded separately).

On 7 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Bel Air, Ouest, armed individuals (likely Viv Ansanm Gang members) fired shots as they attacked residents in the Bel Air neighborhood. The Viv Ansanm Gang also attacked residents in the Poste Marchand, Christ-Roi, and Fort-National neighborhoods (coded separately) that day. Casualties unknown.

On 10 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Bel Air, Ouest, police forces and agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) clashed with gang members in Bel Air as they carried out security operations. Several gang members were killed or injured. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Trip Foumi
notes: On 10 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Bois Verna, Ouest, police forces shot and killed a gang member during clashes in Carrefour Tifou (Bois Verna neighborhood). The police recovered a bus that had been hijacked in Delmas 40b (coded separately), and seized a firearm. A gang member was arrested. 1 fatality.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 7 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Christ-Roi, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in the Christ-Roi neighborhood. A woman vendor was shot and killed, while several other civilians were injured. Hundreds of families fled the area to take refuge elsewhere. The criminals also attacked the Fort-National, Poste Marchand, and Bel Air neighborhoods that day (coded separately). 1 fatality, several injured.

Around 7 December 2024 (between 7 - 8 December), in Port-au-Prince - Fort National, Ouest, armed group members (likely affiliates of the Viv Ansanm Gang) attacked residents in the Fort-National neighborhood. Hundreds of people were displaced. The Viv Ansanm Gang also attacked residents in nearby Poste Marchand, Bel Air, and Christ-Roi neighborhoods on 7 December (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 13 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Fort National, Ouest, police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they intervened to expel the criminals from Avenue Poupelard, in the Fort National neighborhood, which was under gang attack (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 13 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Fort National, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang fired shots and set fire to a building along the Poupelard Avenue, in Fort National neighborhood. Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). The gang members also attacked nearby Poste Marchand neighborhood (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 10 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, overnight, police forces supported by the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) clashed with gang members in the Nazon and Christ-Roi/Nan Moise (coded separately) neighborhoods. In Nazon, the officers took control of the Mega Star Radio Station and the Ephata Hospital, which had been occupied by the criminals. Several gang members were killed or injured. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 13 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang in the Nazon neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Reuters
notes: On 7 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Poste Marchand, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents, looted, and set fire to several properties in the Poste Marchand neighborhood. At least one person was killed. Some families fled the area to take refuge elsewhere. Gunshots were also fired in the Bel Air neighborhood (coded separately). At least 1 fatality.

On 13 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Poste Marchand, Ouest, police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang in the Poste Marchand neighborhood, which was under gang attack (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 13 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Poste Marchand, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang fired shots as they attacked the Poste Marchand and Fort National neighborhoods (coded separately). Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

Around 7 December 2024 (between 6 - 8 December), in Port-au-Prince - Solino, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang killed and injured several people as they attacked residents in the Solino neighborhood. Between 7 and 8 December, police forces were deployed in the area to prevent gang members from carrying out further attacks. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 10 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Solino, Ouest, police forces and agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) clashed with gang members in Solino as they carried out security operations. Several gang members were killed or injured. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
Other: On 1 December 2024, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Croix des Missions. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 1 December 2024, in Tabarre, Ouest, burning tires were erected in Cazeau on the Route Nationale #1. There is no information on the motives of the roadblocks or who set them up.
Other: On 3 December 2024, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Croix des Missions and Cazeau. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

On 2 December 2024, in Tabarre - Clercine, Ouest, armed clashes were registered near the Motorized Intervention Brigade (BIM) police station around Clercine 22-24. There is no information on the circumstances of the clashes or the actors involved. Casualties unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 18 February 2024, in the Gros-Morne commune, Artibonite, the Kokorat San Ras Gang kidnapped the 20 passengers of a bus in the Tibwadom area and asked for the payment of around 3,500 USD ransom per hostage as a condition for their release. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti)
notes: Around 18 February 2024 (as reported), near Gimballe, Centre, gang members beat up and abducted an unknown number of drivers as they hijacked goods trucks in Morne Blanc. Their whereabouts are unknown. Attackers are likely Viv Ansanm Gang members, this gang perpetrated several attacks on that day in locations of Mirebalais, causing hundreds of displaced residents. Casualties unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti)
notes: On 18 February 2024, in Grand Boucan, Centre, gang members attacked several areas in the commune. Attackers are likely Viv Ansanm Gang members, this gang perpetrated several attacks on that day in locations of Mirebalais, causing hundreds of displaced residents. Casualties unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti)
notes: On 18 February 2024, in Terre Rouge, Centre, overnight, the 400 Mawozo Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang) attacked and took control of a police station, forcing the police officers who were inside to flee. The gangsters also attacked police officers in nearby Fonds Cheval area. Seven civilians (six men and a woman) were killed. 7 fatalities.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti)
notes: On 18 February 2024, near Toutier, Centre, gang members attacked areas in the Crete Brulee communal section. Attackers are likely Viv Ansanm Gang members, this gang perpetrated several attacks on that day in locations of Mirebalais, causing hundreds of displaced residents. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Jamaica Observer; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 15 March 2024, in Delmas - Cite Numero Un, Ouest, overnight, police forces shot and killed several members of the G-9 Gang during clashes in Delmas 6 (Cite Numero Un neighborhood) and Delmas 8 (2eme Cite Saint Martin neighborhood, coded separately). The house of the G-9 Gang leader was burnt. Clashes took place amidst a security operation aiming at removing a roadblock erected by the G-9 Gang in Delmas 6 around 11 March (coded separately). Clashes continued until the early morning of the following day. Several firearms were seized. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3, split across 2 events, coded as 1.

source: Alterpresse; BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Looting: On 26 March 2024, in Delmas - Cite Numero Un, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang 'attacked' (methods unknown) and looted the Delmas 18 hospital. It was not clarified whether the medical staff was present when the assault took place.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Weapons seizure: On 5 April 2024, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, authorities seized 12 guns, 14 handguns, and 999 cartridges from a merchant ship coming from the US. Investigations confirmed that there was criminal network behind the trafficking of the mentioned weapons.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Weapons seizure: On 29 April 2024, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, authorities seized 2 handguns and 13 cartridges from a merchant ship coming from the US. The firearms had been sent by a Haitian national (who had recently settled in the US) to his wife in Haiti.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Weapons seizure: On 11 June 2024, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, authorities seized 150 cartridges and a conversion kit (used to transform a handgun into a rifle) from a merchant ship coming from the US.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Trip Foumi
notes: Non-violent activity: On 8 July 2024, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, members of the 400 Mawozo Gang set up a roadblock on the National Road 8. The criminals stored containers and then welded them to block the road. Police forces removed the roadblock following an armed clash on 6 September (coded separately).

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Le P'tit Journal Haiti; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: Around 15 July 2024, in Mirebalais, Centre, overnight, during an operation, the police supported by a self-defense group member killed one gangster who was transporting ammunitions on a motorcycle to a gang in Croix-des-Bouquets. The other gang member who was with him managed to escape. The police also seized 500 rounds of ammunition which had crossed over from the Dominican Republic. 1 fatality.

On 15 November 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents as they looted and set fire to private properties, business establishments, and health institutions in Nazon, Christ-Roi, and Solino neighborhoods (coded separately). During the attack, several residents were injured. Hundreds of families from Avenue Poupelard fled their homes. Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Several injured.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; International Crisis Group; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 21 November 2024, in Delmas, Ouest, police forces supported by Kenyan agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) shot and killed two members of the Viv Ansanm Gang during an anti-gang operation in Bas Delmas. A Kalashnikov rifle was seized. According to police, the leader of the Viv Ansanm Gang took part in armed clashes, although he managed to escape. 2 fatalities.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Press Network; International Crisis Group; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 24 November 2024, in Delmas - Cite Numero Un, Ouest, Haitian police forces and Kenyan agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) clashed with members of the Viv Ansanm Gang in Delmas 6 (Cite Numero Un neighborhood), Delmas 4, and Delmas 2 (coded separately). During clashes, 10 gang members were killed. In Delmas 6 (stronghold of the gang), several materials and properties belonging to the gang's leader were destroyed, including a pool at his house. This was part of an operation aiming at seizing the leader of the gang, who managed to escape. The criminals attacked residents' houses in Delmas 6 and Delmas 4 on that day (coded separately). 10 fatalities split across three events. 4 fatalities coded here.

source: Haiti Press Network; International Crisis Group; Metropole
notes: On 24 November 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 2, Ouest, Haitian police forces and Kenyan agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) clashed with members of the Viv Ansanm Gang in Delmas 2 (Delmas 2 neighborhood), Delmas 6, and Delmas 4 (coded separately). During clashes, 10 gang members were killed. This was part of an operation aiming at seizing the leader of the gang, who managed to escape. 10 fatalities split across three events. 3 fatalities coded here.

source: Haiti Press Network; International Crisis Group; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 24 November 2024, in Delmas - Saint-Martin, Ouest, Haitian police forces and Kenyan agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) clashed with members of the Viv Ansanm Gang in Delmas 4 (Saint-Martin neighborhood), Delmas 6, and Delmas 2 (coded separately). During clashes, 10 gang members were killed. This was part of an operation aiming at seizing the leader of the gang, who managed to escape. The criminals attacked residents' houses in Delmas 4 and Delmas 6 that day (coded separately). 10 fatalities split across three events. 3 fatalities coded here.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Vi Free Press
notes: On 7 December 2024, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang supported by the Palmiste Gang killed several civilians, including a Peace Court bailiff, and abducted a deputy judge as they attacked residents in the commune. The criminals asked for the payment of a ransom for the release of the judge. The attack was described as a reprisal against the population for resistance to the gang's presence (nature of the resistance unclarified). Following the attack, security forces entered the area and clashed with the gang members (coded separately). The whereabouts of the kidnapped victim are unknown. A year after the abduction, his whereabouts were still unknown. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

actor2: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Gazette Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Rezo Nodwes; Vi Free Press
notes: On 7 December 2024, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, Haitian police forces supported by Kenyan agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) killed four members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang and the Palmiste Gang during an anti-gang operation. The officers took control of the commune's abandoned and already destroyed police station (coded separately) and managed to expel the criminals. Before the officers' arrival, the gangsters attacked and abducted civilians in the area (coded separately). 4 fatalities.

Around 12 December 2024 (between 10 - 16 December), in Tabarre, Ouest, as they carried out security operations, police forces and agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) clashed with gang members in the commune. Security operations were carried out in the communes of Tabarre and Croix-des-Bouquets (coded separately) against members of the Kraze Barye, the 400 Mawozo Gang, Chien Mechant Gang and Canaan Gang. The clashes in Tabarre were likely against Kraze Barye Gang (whose members control the area) and the 400 Mawozo Gang (allied to the Krza Barye). Several gang members were killed or injured (affiliation unspecified). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 9 February 2024, in Carrefour - Riviere Froide, Ouest, gang members from Mariani attacked residents in the Riviere Froide area (section 11). Gunshots were heard in the area. Some families fled their homes. Casualties unknown.

Around 6 July 2024 (between 5 - 7 July), in Carrefour - Riviere Froide, Ouest, an unknown number of people were abducted in Riviere Froide. There is no information on the perpetrators and circumstances of the abduction, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 21 March 2024, in Carrefour - Riviere Froide, Ouest, gang members killed a man and a 37-year-old woman and raped their niece at a house. The criminals set fire to the property before leaving. 2 fatalities.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 5 February 2024, in Carrefour - Riviere Froide, Ouest, the Marc Arthur Gang set fire to several houses and killed at least two civilians in several areas of the Riviere Froide communal section. Among the victims, there is a 53-year-old man who was shot in the head on his way home after work. Some families fled their homes. At least 2 fatalities.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 17 February 2024, in the Gros-Morne commune, Artibonite, the Kokorat San Ras Gang kidnapped 12 people (eight women and four men) from two trucks in the Tibwadom area. The criminals asked for the payment of 3,700 USD (500,000 gourdes) per each truck as a condition for the victims' release. Their whereabouts are unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Around 18 February 2024 (as reported), in Mirebalais, Centre, rival gang members engaged in armed clashes in Mirebalais, Thomazeau, and Saut-d'Eau (coded separately). Some residents were displaced. Casualties unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Around 18 February 2024 (as reported), in Thomazeau, Ouest, rival gang members engaged in armed clashes in Thomazeau, Saut-d'Eau, and Mirebalais (coded separately). Some residents were displaced. Casualties unknown.
Looting: Around 29 February 2024 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gang members looted peace courts buildings of the Nord, Ouest, and Sud sections of the Port-au-Prince commune.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Looting: On 29 February 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, gang members (likely from the Viv Ansanm Gang who had seized control of the area after a wave of attacks) ransacked the Haiti's State University Hospital (in Champs de Mars). The hospital remained out of service for months despite police forces regained control of the facilities in July 2024.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Looting: On 18 March 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 5, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang looted the June-Anne hospital, located in the Delmas 5 neighbourhood.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 11 May 2024, in Gressier, Ouest, gang members engaged in armed clashes in the commune. The Viv Ansanm Gang took part in clashes. Some residents were displaced. Casualties unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Non-violent activity: On 26 May 2024, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, the Canaan Gang distributed gifts among mothers on the occasion of the Mothers' Day.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Looting: On 15 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour Feuilles, Ouest, the leader of the Base Pilate Gang broke in the middle of a World Food Program (WFP) food distribution center and stole around 150 sacks of rice and threatened the people present.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 26 June 2024, in Delmas, Ouest, members of the Delmas 6 Gang held a protest against the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS). Protesters claimed to be ready to fight the mission.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 20 July 2024, in Leogane, Ouest, the 103 Zombies Gang invaded (likely carrying out an armed attack) the Leogane commune. Casualties unknown.

Around 15 October 2024 (month of), in Cite Soleil - Waaf Jeremie, Ouest, unidentified individuals kidnapped two crew members of a ship at the bay of Port-au-Prince. Gunshots were heard at the Caribbean Port Services (CPS) facilities. There is no information on the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.
Around 11 November 2024 (as reported), in Cite Soleil - Hasco/Village Democratie, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked Fort Dimanche area. Casualties unknown.

Around 15 November 2024 (as reported), in Cite Soleil - Terre Noire/ Blanchard, Ouest, the Canaan Gang and members of a local gang attacked the Aral area, in Terre Noire neighborhood. The attack aimed at dislodging the police and their relatives. Casualties unknown.

On 15 November 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents as they set fire to properties in Delmas 19, among other neighborhoods (coded separately). During the attack, several residents were injured. Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Several injured.

On 15 November 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, police forces shot and killed several members of the Viv Ansanm Gang during clashes in Delmas 19, which was under gang attack (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 15 November 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, police forces shot and killed several members of the Viv Ansanm Gang during clashes in the Nazon neighborhood, which was under gang attack (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 15 November 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Poste Marchand, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents as they set fire to properties in the Poste Marchand neighborhood, among others (coded separately). During the attack, several residents were injured. Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Several injured.

On 15 November 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Poste Marchand, Ouest, police forces shot and killed several members of the Viv Ansanm Gang during clashes in the Poste Marchand neighborhood, which was under gang attack (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

Security measures: Around 19 November 2024 (as reported), in Petionville, Ouest, Haitian police forces and Kenyan agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) installed a forward operating base at the Academy Police (Academie neighborhood). Despite the installation, gang members attacked Pernier and advanced to areas very close to the Police Academy in late November and early December (coded separately).
On 2 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, police forces clashed with armed group members in Delmas 30. Casualties unknown.

On 2 December 2024, in Petion Ville - Pernier, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) attacked civilians at the 'Gwo Jan' area, in Pernier neighborhood. Police forces later intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 2 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Haut Nazon, Ouest, armed group members set fire to the 'Union Baptiste de Nazon' church, located in the Haut Nazon neighborhood. The church had been the target of armed attacks in November (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
Looting: On 6 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed gang members looted neighborhoods in Port-au-Prince. The criminals stole civilians' belongings.

Around 7 December 2024 (between 6 - 8 December), in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, gang members attacked Delmas 19. Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

Around 7 December 2024 (between 6 - 8 December), in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, police forces clashed with armed group members in Delmas 19. There were several casualties (affiliation of the victims and nature of the casualties unclarified). Casualties unknown.

Around 7 December 2024 (between 6 - 8 December), in Delmas - Delmas 32, Ouest, police forces clashed with armed group members in the Delmas 32 neighborhood. There were several casualties (affiliation of the victims and nature of the casualties unclarified). Casualties unknown.

source: Amerique Info 7; BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Non-violent activity: On 11 December 2024, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, armed members of the Micanord Gang took to the streets in the Waaf Jeremie neighborhood shouting slogans in support of the leader of the gang. The criminals forced scores of residents to join them. The rally was described as an attempt to clean the image of the gang's leader after the killing of at least 207 people between 6 and 11 December (coded separately). The criminals also distributed food kits among poor residents in the neighborhood to buy their silence in relation to the massacre.

actor2: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: On 14 December 2024, near Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, Haitian police forces supported by the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) shot and killed several members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang, the Savien Gang, and the Palmiste Gang during clashes in the Palmiste locality. Between 14 and 15 December, more than 16 members of the mentioned gangs (up to 20 according to other sources) were killed in Palmiste. At least 16 fatalities split across two events. 8 fatalities coded here.

On 14 December 2024, in Delmas, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with gang members (likely from the Viv Ansanm Gang) in Bas Delmas. Clashes also took place in the Solino, Nazon, and Poste Marchand neighborhoods (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 14 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, overnight, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Delmas 19 neighborhood. Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 14 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they attacked the Delmas 19 neighborhood (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 14 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, overnight, gunshots were heard as the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Delmas 30 neighborhood. Several people were hit by the stray bullets. Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 14 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they attacked the Delmas 30 neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

On 14 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 32, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they attacked the Delmas 32 neighborhood (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 14 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 40b, Ouest, overnight, police forces shot and killed a man and a woman who were in a vehicle in the Delmas 40b neighborhood. The man was described as a member of the Belair Gang affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang. 2 fatalities.

On 14 December 2024, in Delmas - Maguana, Ouest, overnight, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in Delmas 31 (near Delmas - Maguana). Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 14 December 2024, in Delmas - Maguana, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they attacked residents in Delmas 31 (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 14 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Canape-Vert, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with members of the Viv Ansanm Gang as they attacked the Canape-Vert neighborhood (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 14 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Canape-Vert, Ouest, overnight, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Canape-Vert neighborhood. Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; The St. Kitts Nevis Observer
notes: On 14 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang in Samida Carrefour (Nazon neighborhood), where the criminals had set traps to block police access. Clashes also took place in nearby Poste Marchand, Solino, and Bas Delmas neighborhoods (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 14 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, overnight, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in the Nazon neighborhood. Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 14 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Poste Marchand, Ouest, overnight, police forces shot and killed several members of the Viv Ansanm Gang during clashes in the Poste Marchand neighborhood, which was under gang attack (coded separately). Clashes were also reported in Nazon, Solino, and Bas Delmas (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 14 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Poste Marchand, Ouest, overnight, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in the Poste Marchand neighborhood. Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 14 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Saint Antoine/Lalue, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with members of the Viv Ansanm Gang as they attacked residents in the Lalue neighborhood (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 14 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Saint Antoine/Lalue, Ouest, overnight, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in the Lalue neighborhood. Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 14 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Solino, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with gang members (likely from the Viv Ansanm Gang) in Solino, Nazon, Poste Marchand, and Bas Delmas neighborhoods (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

actor2: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Alterpresse; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: On 15 December 2024, near Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, Haitian police forces supported by the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) shot and killed several members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang, the Savien Gang, and the Palmiste Gang during clashes in the Palmiste locality. Between 14 and 15 December, more than 16 members of the mentioned gangs (up to 20 according to other sources) were killed in Palmiste. At least 16 fatalities split across two events. 8 fatalities coded here.

Around 15 December 2024 (between 14 - 16 December), in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, as they carried out security operations, police forces and agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) clashed with gang members in the commune. Security operations were carried out in the communes of Tabarre (coded separately) and Croix-des-Bouquets against members of the Kraze Barye, the 400 Mawozo Gang, Chien Mechant Gang and Canaan Gang. The clashes in Croix-des-Bouquets were likely against Chien Mechant Gang and the Canaan Gang where both gangs operate. Casualties unknown.

On 15 December 2024, in Delmas, Ouest, police and military forces supported by the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they continued with anti-gang operations in Bas Delmas. Casualties unknown.

On 15 December 2024, in Delmas - Carrefour Aeroport/Delmas 13, Ouest, in the morning, police and military forces supported by Kenyan agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) shot and killed at least three members of the Viv Ansanm Gang during clashes in the Carrefour Aeroport neighborhood. On 15 December, at least 11 gang members were killed by security forces in Carrefour Aeroport and Poste Marchand neighborhoods. At least 11 fatalities split across two events. 3 fatalities coded here.

source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Trip Foumi
notes: On 15 December 2024, in Delmas - Cite Caraibes, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang threw Molotov cocktails at the Bernard Mevs Hospital (private property), located on Village Solidarite Avenue (near the Airport Road, at the height of Cite Caraibes neighborhood). The hospital had been recently emptied of all of its patients, although it was caring for police officers injured in the line of duty. Haitian police forces and Kenyan agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) intervened and killed five gangsters who were trying to erect a barricade. Between 15 and 16 December, gang members set fire to an ambulance, a container, and two vehicles at the hospital's compound. 5 fatalities.

source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; Juno 7
notes: On 15 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, in the morning, the Viv Ansanm Gang fired shots as they attacked and tried to invade the Delmas 19 neighborhood. Several people were hit by the stray bullets. Casualties unknown.

On 15 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Fort National, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents on Poupelard Avenue, at the height of the Fort National neighborhood, where the criminals set fire to several buildings. Several people were shot and injured by the stray bullets. The Post Marchant's Church of God on Borgella Street was also burned. Several injured.

source: Amerique Info 7; GardaWorld; Gazette Haiti; Juno 7
notes: On 15 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, the Viv Ansanm Gang fired shots as they attacked the Nazon neighborhood. Several people were injured. Several injured.

source: Amerique Info 7; Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; The St. Kitts Nevis Observer
notes: On 15 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Poste Marchand, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang shot and killed several civilians, injured several others, and set fire to several houses in the neighborhood. Dozens of residents fled their homes. The attack was a reprisal for the killing of the Viv Ansanm Gang's number two during clashes with the police earlier that day (coded separately). Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3. Several injured.

source: Amerique Info 7; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Rezo Nodwes; The St. Kitts Nevis Observer
notes: On 15 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Poste Marchand, Ouest, in the morning, police and military forces supported by Kenyan agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) shot and killed eight members of the Viv Ansanm Gang during clashes in the Poste Marchand neighborhood, which had been under gang attack since 14 December (coded separately). Among the victims, there is a high profile Viv Ansanm Gang's member who was described as the 'number two' and right hand of the gang leader. On 15 December, at least 11 gang members were killed by security forces in Carrefour Aeroport and Poste Marchand neighborhoods. At least 11 fatalities split across two events. 8 fatalities coded here.

On 15 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Saint Antoine/Lalue, Ouest, in the morning, police and military forces supported by the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) shot and killed several members of the Viv Ansanm Gang as they tried to invade the Lalue neighborhood. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Jamaica Observer; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Vi Free Press
notes: On 16 December 2024, in Delmas - Cite Caraibes, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, overnight, the Viv Ansanm Gang threw Molotov cocktails at the Bernard Mevs Hospital (private property), on Village Solidarite Avenue (near the Airport Road, at the height of Cite Caraibes neighborhood), setting fire to a part of the building including four operating rooms, among others. The accounting and part of the administration offices were looted. The hospital had been recently emptied of all of its patients, although it was caring for police officers injured in the line of duty. Haitian police forces and Kenyan agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) intervened and clashed with the criminals. Several gang members were shot and killed. Several others were injured, while the rest managed to flee. Between 15 and 16 December, gang members set fire to an ambulance, a container, and two vehicles at the hospital's compound. The hospital had been under gang attack since 15 December (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3. Several injured.

On 16 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, gunshots were heard as the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Delmas 19 neighborhood. Several people were hit by the stray bullets. Casualties unknown.
On 16 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, gunshots were heard as the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Delmas 30 neighborhood. Several people were hit by the stray bullets. Casualties unknown.

On 16 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Fort National, Ouest, gunshots were heard as the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents along the Poupelard Avenue, at the height of the Fort National neighborhood. Several people were hit by the stray bullets. Some residents fled the area and took refuge on Capois Street. Casualties unknown.

On 16 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Poste Marchand, Ouest, gunshots were heard as the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Poste Marchand neighborhood. Several people were hit by the stray bullets. Some residents fled the area and took refuge on Capois Street. Casualties unknown.

On 18 December 2024, in Delmas, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with armed group members who tried to attack an unspecified small community in the commune. The officers managed to expel de the criminals. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Juno 7; Trip Foumi
notes: Security measures: On 18 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, national authorities announced the creation of a National Security Council (CNS) and declared a state of emergency that would be in force from 22 December 2024 to 21 January 2025 in the whole national territory. The measure aimed at facilitating police forces interventions against gangs.
On 19 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Fort National, Ouest, residents held a protest in Fort National against insecurity.

source: Haiti Press Network; PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: On 20 December 2024, in Tabarre - Clercine, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Cops of Motorized Intervention Brigades (CBIM) base, in the Clercine neighborhood. Police forces managed to expel the criminals. There were no casualties among the officers, although it was not clarified if there were casualties among the gang members. Casualties unknown.

On 21 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Bel Air, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members as they carried out an anti-gang intervention in the Bel Air neighborhood. Several gang members were killed and several roadblocks were removed. Clashes were also registered in Portail Leogane and Champs de Mars neighborhoods (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 21 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members as they carried out an anti-gang intervention along the Oswald Durand and Monseigneur-Guilloux streets, in Champs de Mars neighborhood. Several gang members were killed and several roadblocks were removed. Clashes were also registered in Portail Leogane and Bel Air neighborhoods (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 21 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Portail Leogane/Cite Louverture, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members as they carried out an anti-gang intervention in the Portail Leogane neighborhood. Several gang members were killed and several roadblocks were removed. Clashes were also registered in Champs de Mars and Bel Air neighborhoods (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 22 December 2024, in Hinche, Centre, several hundreds of residents, called by the Hinche League of Pastors (LIPH) (Christian group) and other civil society organizations, held a march with banners and tree branches calling for proper governance and against rising insecurity.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Haiti Standard; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; The St. Kitts Nevis Observer; Vi Free Press
notes: On 24 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang) in support of the Viv Ansanm Gang opened fire on a crowd of journalists, police officers, doctors, employees, and patients gathering at the State University of Haiti Hospital (HUEH), a.k.a. General hospital (in Champs de Mars), to cover and secure the institution's reopening ceremony. Present police forces responded and clashed with the criminals. At least a police officer and two journalists were killed at the scene, while eight other journalists and a police officer were injured by the gunshots. One source reported more than 10 injured. The Base 5 Secondes Gang's leader shared a social media video claiming responsibility for the attack and stating that the hospital's reopening had not been authorized by the gangs. At least 3 fatalities, at least 9 injured.

On 26 December 2024, in the Artibonite department (coded to Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite), Artibonite, police forces supported by the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) carried out an anti-gang operation at the stronghold of the Dinosaur Gang. Casualties unknown.

source: Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Trip Foumi
notes: On 26 December 2024, in Cite Soleil - Sarthe, Ouest, in the morning, police forces shot and killed several gang members during anti-gang operations in the Sarthe neighborhood. Police forces seized two riffles and 58 cartridges. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 26 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Gabelliste/Grand Cimetiere, Ouest, police forces supported by agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission clashed with gang members near the cemetery of Port-au-Prince (in Gabelliste/Grand Cimetiere neighborhood). Security forces destroyed hiding places used by the gangs. Part of the cemetery fence was destroyed by security forces' heavy equipment. Casualties unknown.

source: Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: On 29 December 2024, in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune, Artibonite, police forces supported by the Multinational Security Support Mission shot and killed several members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang during clashes in the Palmiste locality, in Bas Coursin II section, and Labady section (2nd and 3rd Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite's communal sections, respectively). In Bas Coursin II, clashes took place in Laverdure area. Security forces also destroyed several properties belonging to gang members, including a house that was set on fire. Stolen animals were recovered. Between 28 and 29 December, at least 10 gang members were killed during anti-gang operations in five locations in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune (coded in three events). At least 10 fatalities split across three events, 6 fatalities coded here.
