On 10 February 2025, in the Petionville commune, Ouest, in the morning, the Kraze Barye Gang fired shots on the Freres Road, Madyowo, Doko, and Fortin areas, among other areas in the commune (coded separately), as they tried to invade Petionville. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole
notes: On 10 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Academie, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang fired shots and set fire to properties as they attacked the vicinity of the Police Academy and the 'Kajwo' area (less than 1 km away from the Police Academy). The criminals fled to their base with several kidnapped victims. Their whereabouts are unknown. This was part of an offensive aimed at invading Petionville. Casualties unknown.

On 10 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Cargo, Ouest, in the morning, gang members (likely Kraze Barye Gang as they attacked several neighborhoods in the commune on the same day) fired shots and attacked the Cargo neighborhood, among others in the commune (coded separately), as they tried to invade Petionville. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: On 10 February 2025, in Tabarre - Torcelle, Ouest, police forces shot and killed several Kraze Barye Gang members at the gang's base, in Torcelle neighborhood. Two firearms were seized. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 11 February 2025, in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune, Artibonite, the Savien and Palmiste gangs set fire to several houses and business establishments in the Anba Tisous locality and the Labady communal section (3rd Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite's communal sections). One source states that there were no fatal victims among civilians. There were no fatalities.
On 11 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in Nazon. Casualties unknown.

On 11 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bourdon, Ouest, police forces engaged in armed clashes with gang members. A male student who was on this way to the Centre for Diplomatic and International Studies (CEDI), in Bourdon, was shot and killed by a stray bullet. 1 fatality.

location: Delmas - St Louis de Gonzague- Henfrasa -Palais de l'art
notes: On 11 February 2025, in Delmas - St Louis de Gonzague- Henfrasa -Palais de l'art, Ouest, gunshots were heard. A student at the Saint-Louis de Gonzague school was shot and injured by a stray bullet. This was likely part of gang-related attack, as gang engaged in gunfights with police in several neighborhoods in Port-au-Prince on that day (coded separately). 1 injured.

source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 12 February 2025, in Montrouis, Artibonite, police forces shot and killed the leader of the Tou Sab Gang during an anti-gang operation carried out as the criminals tried to erect a roadblock on the National Road 1. Later, Tou Sab Gang members attacked the Montrouis police station in reprisal for the killing of their gang leader. During the attack against the station, a police officer and the ad hoc clerk at the Montrouis Peace Court were killed. The clerk's wife was injured, together with at least two other people. 3 fatalities, 3 injured.

Property destruction: On 12 February 2025, near Petion Ville - Academie, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang looted and set fire to several properties as they attacked the 'Kajwo' area (less than 1 km away from the Police Academy). This was part of an offensive aimed at invading Petionville.
Other: On 3 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Martissant and downtown. There is no information on the authorship and the circumstances of the gunshots.

source: Amerique Info 7; Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti)
notes: Security measures: On 29 January 2025, in Kenscoff - Obleon, Ouest, around 100 military officers were deployed at the former Teleco company headquarters (location of Teleco antenna, in Morne Tranchant area). The deployment aimed at restoring security after the Viv Ansanm Gang launched coordinated attacks against the commune on 26 January (coded separately).

On 17 February 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, thousands of farmers and residents, led by several organizations from the Artibonite, held a protest with banners and tree branches on the National Road 1 and in front of the Pat-Chwal police station against security forces' limited action against the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang. Protesters called on the gang's dismantling.
On 30 January 2025, in Belladere, Centre, a group of people protested. The reason for the protest is unknown.

On 31 January 2025, in Belladere, Centre, for the second consecutive day, residents protested by setting up a roadblock on the Route Departementale #31 in the Roy Rose neighborhood to demand land to build a hospital from the government.
Other: On 2 February 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gang members fired gunshots in Carrefour Aeroport. Unspecified gang activities were recorded in the area.
Other: On 3 February 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Delmas 28. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 7 February 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Puits Blain and Delmas 75. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 14 February 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Delmas 28. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

source: Gazette Haiti; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: On 15 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, overnight, police forces shot and killed two members of the Viv Ansanm Gang during clashes in Delmas 30. A communication radio and police uniforms were recovered. This was part of efforts by police forces to prevent the criminals from entering the area. 2 fatalities.
On 19 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, self-defense group members clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they tried to resist a gang offensive against the neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

On 18 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 40b, Ouest, a group of supporters of the former senator of Nippes held a demonstration along the Delmas Road (at the height of Delmas 40b and Delmas 49) to decry what they described as political persecution by the judicial police against the former politician over accusations of conspiracy against internal security of the State, financing criminal organizations, and criminal association. He was also accused of involvement in gang attacks against the Kenscoff commune. Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires.

On 19 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 60, Ouest, several scores of residents, as well as employees and former employees at the National Equipment Centre (CNE), held a sit-in protest with banners in front of the Villa d'Accueil building against insecurity and hunger. The CNE workers also called for the payment of due salaries.
On 12 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 75, Ouest, people burned tires in front of a bank branch in Delmas 71 to demand their money be given in USD.
On 18 February 2025, in Delmas - Sylvio Cator/Delmas 28, Ouest, overnight, gang members fired shots and set fire to houses as they attacked residents in Delmas 24. Casualties unknown.

On 7 February 2025, between Gressier and Leogane, Ouest, armed clashes were registered in the Bois Lasalle area. There is no information on the circumstances of the confrontations or actors involved. Casualties unknown.
Security measures: On 3 February 2025, in Kenscoff, Ouest, the city hall imposed a curfew starting that same day from 8PM to 5AM in response to recent attacks in the commune.

Other: On 8 February 2025, between Kenscoff and Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard between Belo and Laboule 12. A report indicates that Belo was under attack (unspecified). Gunshots were also heard in Boucan and Godet. The gunfire was heard from Pelerin, Thomassin and Fermathe. The police was present, but no specific action was mentioned on their end. There is no information on the circumstances of the gunshots.

source: Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 17 February 2025, in Kenscoff - Bois d'Avril, Ouest, in the morning, police forces engaged in armed clashes with the Base 5 Secondes Gang (affiliates of the Viv Ansanm Gang) in Bois d'Avril and Godet (coded separately). During the clashes in the commune that day, several gangsters were killed, and two police officers were injured; one died later in hospital (coded in the Godet event). Also, the criminals managed to seize two broken-down police armored vehicles and set fire to one. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 17 February 2025, in Kenscoff - Godet, Ouest, in the morning, police forces engaged in armed clashes with the Base 5 Secondes Gang (affiliates of the Viv Ansanm Gang) in Godet and Bois d'Avril (coded separately). During the clashes in the commune that day, several gangsters were killed, and two police officers were injured; one died later in hospital. Also, the criminals managed to seize two broken-down police armored vehicles and set fire to one. At least 1 fatality.

On 16 February 2025, near Petion Ville - Academie, Ouest, in the morning, the Kraze Barye Gang attacked the 'Kajwo' area (less than 1 km from the Police Academy). The criminals opened fire, occupied, and took control of a hotel. They placed heavy firearms were on the top of the hotel. Casualties unknown.

On 14 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Centre Ville (Sud), Ouest, people set up barricades of burning tires on the Saint Pierre square to demonstrate against the nomination of the director of the Vehicle Insurance Against Third Parties (OAVCT).

On 4 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Laboule, Ouest, armed individuals clashed in Grenier in Laboule 12 as they were retreating from Kenscoff. Gunshots were also heard in Bois Cochon. The police was present, although no specific activity was reported on their end. Casualties unknown.
Other: On 2 February 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard near Thomassin 32. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 3 February 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, a roadblock made of tires was set up in Thomassin 48 as an unspecified preventive measure.
Other: On 7 February 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Thomassin 48 and nearby areas. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 11 February 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Pernier as well as in Doco. Although there is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots, they are likely related to ongoing attacks and clashes in other areas of the commune (coded separately).
Other: On 13 February 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard on Rue Borno in Berthe. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 14 February 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard in several neighborhoods, such as Cargo, Diegue, Metivier, and Doco. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 16 February 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Metivier neighborhood. This was likely the authorship of the Kraze Barye Gang, whose members attacked the Petionville commune on that day (coded separately).
Other: On 2 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gang members fired gunshots in Lalue and Nazon. Unspecified gang activities were recorded in the area.
Other: On 4 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Champs de Mars and downtown. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 5 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Salomon market (Bas Peu de Choses neighborhood). There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Non-violent activity: On 14 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed individuals ordered residents of the Impasse Eddy area in the Carrefour-Feuilles to abandon the area, causing people to flee the neighborhood. There is no further information on the circumstances or motives of the incident.
Other: On 14 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard on Magloire Ambroise street. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 19 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Pacot neighborhood. This was likely the authorship of gangs, who attacked several neighborhoods in Port-au-Prince on that day.

On 31 January 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bas Peu de Choses, Ouest, the police clashed with members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang and the Grand-Ravine Gang on Rue Chavannes. Seven civilians were killed by stray bullets. 7 fatalities.

Property destruction: On 13 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bas Peu de Choses, Ouest, the Viv Ansamn Gang set fire to the 7th Church of God from New Jerusalem, located between Lota-Jeremie Street and Alerte Street (Bas Peu de Choses). The building collapsed despite effort by firefighters. Residents from nearby areas fled.

source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 20 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bourdon, Ouest, in the morning, scores of displaced residents from Solino and Carrefour Feuilles took to the streets of Bourdon to decry gang violence and lack of action by national authorities in the face of gangs. Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires and stones on John Brown Avenue (a.k.a. Lalue). Rioters threw stones against drivers trying to circulate through the neighborhood, and poured oil on the roadway on Macadieu Street. Roadblocks also affected activity in nearby Christ Roi and Lalue neighborhoods.

On 12 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour Feuilles, Ouest, the Grand-Ravine Gang killed and burned a man in reprisal for his resistance to the gang's presence in the neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 14 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour Feuilles, Ouest, the Grand-Ravine Gang attacked residents in the neighborhood as they tried to invade the area. Civilians fled their homes. Gang attacks persisted during the weekend (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

Around 16 February 2025 (weekend of), in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour Feuilles, Ouest, police forces clashed with the Grand-Ravine Gang as they tried to expel them from 'Saye', 'Bo kazek', and 'Impasse Eddy' localities, which were under gang attack since 14 February (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

Around 16 February 2025 (weekend of), in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour Feuilles, Ouest, the Grand-Ravine Gang attacked residents in 'Saye', 'Bo kazek', and 'Impasse Eddy' localities as part of efforts to invade the Carrefour Feuilles neighborhood. Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Scores of residents fled their homes. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti)
notes: On 18 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour Feuilles, Ouest, gang members attacked residents in Carrefour Feuilles, Boutilier, and Ti Savanne (coded separately), forcing the displacement of civilians. Gunshots were heard. Casualties unknown.

On 19 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour Feuilles, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, gang members shot and injured several civilians as they attacked the Carrefour Feuilles neighborhood, forcing the displacement of residents. Several injured.

Around 17 February 2025 (between 16 - 18 February), in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, police agents from the General Security Unit of the National Palace (USGPN) held a protest demanding better working conditions. They blocked access to the National Palace.

Around 19 February 2025 (between 17 - 21 February), in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, students from the Faculty of Medicine and Pharmacy of the State University held a march demanding a new headquarters for the General Hospital for them to continue their studies.

On 19 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Christ Roi - Lalue, Ouest, self-defense group members clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they tried to resist a gang offensive against the Christ Roi neighborhood. Casualties unknown.
On 18 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Debussy/Haut-Turgeau, Ouest, gang members opened fire as they attacked the Debussy neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

On 18 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Desire/Boutilier, Ouest, gang members attacked residents in Boutilier, Carrefour Feuilles, and Ti Savanne (coded separately), forcing the displacement of civilians. Casualties unknown.

On 18 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Fort National, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in Fort National. Gunfight erupted as security forces tried to resist an offensive by the Viv Ansanm Gang against the neighborhood. Clashes persisted for several days (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 19 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Fort National, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang in Fort National. A police officer and a self-defense group member were killed, while a second self-defense group member was injured. Clashes erupted as the now deceased tried to resist a gang offensive in the neighborhood. 2 fatalities, 1 injured.

On 18 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in the Nazon neighborhood. The criminals were likely from the Viv Ansanm Gang, as members of this gang clashed with the police in the neighborhood on 19 February (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 18 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, overnight, gang members fired shots and set fire to houses as they attacked residents in the neighborhood. Police forces intervened and clashed with them (coded separately). The criminals were likely members of the Viv Ansanm Gang, as members of this gang engaged in clashes with the police in the neighborhood on 19 February (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 19 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang in the Nazon neighborhood. Casualties unknown.
On 18 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Pacot, Ouest, gang members opened fire on Avenue N (Pacot) as they attacked neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

On 14 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Solino, Ouest, displaced residents held a protest with banners in the Solino neighborhood demanding authorities to take action against gang violence to allow them a safe return to their communities. Protesters also made tribute to killed security forces.

On 18 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Ti Savanne-Trantin, Ouest, gang members attacked residents in Ti Savanne, Carrefour Feuilles, and Boutilier (coded separately), forcing the displacement of civilians. Casualties unknown.
Other: On 31 January 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Cazeau. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

On 2 February 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, the police killed approximately 12 members of the Kraze Barye Gang in Lepal in Tabarre 70 while the gangsters attempted to steal power cables. Around 12 fatalities.
Other: On 11 February 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Torcelle. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 12 February 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Tabarre 27. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 20 February 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Delmas 30, Carrefour Aeroport, Delmas 41, and Delmas 43 neighborhoods. There is no information on the circumstances and the authorship of the gunshots.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Press Network; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); SG Alert (Whatsapp); Trip Foumi
notes: On 20 February 2025, between Delmas 34, Delmas 32, and Delmas 40b (coded to Delmas - Delmas 34), Ouest, in the morning, scores of displaced residents from Solino and Carrefour Feuilles took to the streets to decry gang violence and lack of action by national authorities in the face of gangs. Demonstrators blocked roads in Delmas 34, Delmas 40b, Delmas 45, and Delmas 32. In Delmas 40 b, police forces fired tear gas to disperse the crowd. Stones were also thrown in Delmas 40b during the demonstration.

source: Amerique Info 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: Other: On 20 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Nazon, Bourdon, Christ Roi, Fort National, and Lalue neighborhoods, as well as several areas of Carrefour Feuilles. Gunshots were also heard on Avenue Poupelard, Rue Chretienne, and Rue Sylvia. There is no information on the circumstances and the authorship of the gunshots. Stray bullets were registered in Christ Roi and Turgeau.

On 21 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Fort National, Ouest, for a fourth consecutive day, police forces and self-defense group members clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they attacked the Avenue Poupelard in Fort National neighborhood. Between 21 and 23 February, the Viv Ansanm Gang's attacks against Fort National resulted in fatalities and injured among civilians and armed members of the population (self-defense groups). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

Around 16 February 2025 (as reported), in Maissade, Centre, members of the population killed two suspected gangsters as insecurity rose in the area. They blocked two roads and moved a motorcycle station for protection while residents avoiding moving around. 2 fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces of Haiti (2024-) Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP)
notes: On 27 February 2025, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, unidentified armed men on a motorcycle shot and injured the head of the National Agency of Protected Areas (ANAP) (a.k.a. BSAP) in the North department while he was driving along the Madelaine area. The ANAP/BSAP agent managed to fire back and drive himself to hospital for treatment, although he died moments later. 1 fatality.
Other: On 15 February 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Carrefour Aeroport. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 19 February 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Pele Simon. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 21 February 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, burning tires were erected in Delmas 32 and 45 (Delmas 41 neighborhood). There is no information on the motives for the roadblocks or who set them up.

Other: On 24 February 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, overnight, gunshots were heard in the Delmas 19 neighborhood. This was likely the authorship of the Viv Ansanm Gang, as members of this gang attacked nearby Delmas 30 and Delmas 17 neighborhoods that night (coded separately).

Other: Around 26 February 2025 (as reported), in Delmas, Ouest, unidentified individuals dressed in civilian clothes were seen taking materials from a police armored vehicle at Carrefour Aeroport. It is suspected that they were delivering ammunition and firearms to gangs.
Other: On 28 February 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, in the morning, residents set up roadblocks in Delmas 40b to prevent gang members from attacking their communities.
On 24 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 17, Ouest, overnight, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in the Delmas 17 neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

On 26 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 17, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, the Viv Ansanm attacked residents at their homes in Delmas 17, prompting the displacement of civilians as some fled their houses. Casualties unknown.

On 28 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Joseph Janvier, Ouest, police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang on Leonard Street (Delmas 19) as they intervened to expel the criminals from the area. Clashes erupted after the gangsters attacked residents in the area earlier that day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 26 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm attacked residents at their homes in Delmas 19, prompting the displacement of civilians as some fled their houses. Casualties unknown.
On 18 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, overnight, gang members fired shots and set fire to houses as they attacked residents. Casualties unknown.

On 26 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, the Viv Ansanm attacked residents and set fire to their houses in Delmas 30, killing an unknown number of civilians. The neighborhood was under gang attack since 24 February, when the criminals targeted the positions of a self-defense group brigade and residents (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 18 February 2025, in Delmas - Nazon, Ouest, overnight, gang members fired shots and set fire to houses as they attacked residents. Casualties unknown.

source: Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Trip Foumi
notes: On 24 February 2025, in Gressier - La Salle Pte Place, Ouest, police forces shot and killed five gang members during clashes in La Salle Pte Place and Lafferonay areas, close to the Don Bosco Salesians School. Three firearms were seized by the police. Clashes were also registered in nearby La Colline area (Gressier) and Flon (Leogane) (coded separately). 5 fatalities.

On 25 February 2025, near Gressier - La Salle Pte Place, Ouest, citizens held a sit-in protest demanding that military officers who operate at an Armed Forces' base located between Gressier and Leogane communes actively take part in anti-gang operations.

On 24 February 2025, in Gressier - Nan Reserve, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in La Colline area (Southern extreme of the commune). Clashes were also registered in nearby La Salle Pte Place and Lafferonay areas of Gressier (coded separately) and in Flon (Leogane) (coded separately). A 11-year-old boy was shot and injured to the head by a stray bullet. He died in hospital. Some residents fled their homes. 1 fatality.
Around 24 February 2025 (as reported), near Gressier - Nan Reserve, Ouest, mobs of residents lynched two gang members in an area between the Gressier and Leogane communes. 2 fatalities.

On 26 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Academie, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang fired shots as they attacked residents in the Kajwo area (less than 1 km from the Police Academy). This was part of an armed offensive aimed at taking control of several areas in the Petionville commune, including Meyotte, Morette, Tunnel, Doco, and Impasse Gracien (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 26 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Freres, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang fired shots as they attacked residents in the Impasse Gracien area (Freres neighborhood). This was part of an armed offensive aimed at taking control of several areas in the Petionville commune, including Meyotte, Morette, Tunnel, Doco, and Kajwo (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 24 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Juvenat, Ouest, residents took to the streets calling for security measures in the face of gang violence. They set up barricades of burning tires. Mobilizations on these claims were held on the same day in Delmas and Port-au-Prince (coded separately).

source: Amerique Info 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 26 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Meyotte, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang fired shots as they attacked residents in the neighborhood. This was part of an armed offensive aimed at taking control of several areas in the Petionville commune, including Morette, Kajwo, Tunnel, Doco, and Impasse Gracien (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 26 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Morette, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang fired shots as they attacked residents in the neighborhood. This was part of an armed offensive aimed at taking control of several areas in the Petionville commune, including Meyotte, Kajwo, Tunnel, Doco, and Impasse Gracien (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
Other: On 15 February 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard on Freres Road. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 19 February 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard near Tara's (Laboule neighborhood) and Makako.
Other: On 20 February 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the area. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of he gunshots.

On 26 February 2025, in the Petionville commune, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang fired shots as they attacked residents in the Doco and Nan Tunnel areas. This was part of an armed offensive aimed at taking control of several areas in the Petionville commune, including Meyotte, Morette, Impasse Gracien, and Kajwo (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
Property destruction: On 18 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm gang destroyed one side of the Alerte street.
Other: On 21 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a roadblock was set up on the Canape Vert road. There is no information on the motives of the roadblock or who set it up.

Other: On 28 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, in the morning, residents set up roadblocks in Lalue, Bois Verna, Turgeau, and Canape-Vert neighborhoods to prevent gang members from attacking their communities.

On 27 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bas Peu de Choses, Ouest, the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang) occupied the Radio Energie building, on Chavannes Street, and clashed with police forces in the area. Clashes were also registered in Centre Ville and Champs de Mars neighborhoods (coded separately). The gang attack was part of a coordinated offensive by affiliates of the Viv Ansanm Gang. Casualties unknown.
On 28 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bois Verna, Ouest, gang members attacked surrounding areas of Radio Vision 2000 (Bois Verna). Casualties unknown.

On 26 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bourdon, Ouest, police forces clashed with displaced residents to prevent them from occupying the building of the Ministry of Planification. It happened when the displaced residents tried to take refuge at the ministry after having fled their homes due to gang attacks. No further details were mentioned.

source: Haiti Standard; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Trip Foumi
notes: On 24 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Canape-Vert, Ouest, residents took to the streets to protest against the decision of the interim executive police agent of removing two barricades recently erected in the area (coded separately) to prevent gang members from entering residential communities, and against the attempted arrest of a self-defense group member from the area. Protesters set up barricades (nature unknown), blocked roads, and accused the officer of weakening the resistance of Canape-Vert residents to the threat of gangs. Gunshots of unclarified authorship were heard.

source: Amerique Info 7; Gazette Haiti; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 27 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang) attacked the Port-au-Prince Police Substation (Centre Ville neighborhood), prompting clashes with police forces, who intervened to prevent the criminals from advancing towards nearby areas. During clashes, the Police Inspector General (head of the National Palace security) was shot and injured in a leg. Clashes were also registered in Champs de Mars and Bas Peu de Choses neighborhoods (coded separately). The gang attack was part of a coordinated offensive by affiliates of the Viv Ansanm Gang. 1 injured.
On 28 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, police forces clashed with affiliates of the Viv Ansanm Gang in Champs de Mars. Casualties unknown.

On 24 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Christ Roi - Lalue, Ouest, residents held a demonstration and erected burning barricades on the streets of the neighborhood against the violence of gangs and to prevent them from entering their communities.

On 24 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Christ-Roi, Ouest, overnight, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the positions of a self-defense group brigade and residents at their homes, killing several people. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 24 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Debussy/Haut-Turgeau, Ouest, overnight, gang members attacked residents at their homes in the Debussy neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

On 22 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Fort National, Ouest, for a fifth consecutive day, police forces and self-defense group members clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they attacked the Fort National neighborhood. Between 21 and 23 February, the Viv Ansanm Gang's attacks against Fort National resulted in fatalities and injured among civilians and armed members of the population (self-defense groups). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 23 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Fort National, Ouest, for a sixth consecutive day, police forces and self-defense group members clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they attacked the Fort National neighborhood. At least three people were killed. Others were injured. Between 21 and 23 February, the Viv Ansanm Gang's attacks against Fort National resulted in several fatalities and injured among civilians and armed members of the population (self-defense groups). At least 3 fatalities.
On 22 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Poste Marchand, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang as the criminals set fire to residents' houses. Casualties unknown.

On 28 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Ravine Pintade, Ouest, gang members attacked residents and set fire to several homes along the Vaillant street and Mon Dede zone in Avenue Poupelard (at the height of Ravine Pintade neighborhood). After the attack, police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Many families fled their homes. Casualties unknown.

On 28 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Ravine Pintade, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members (likely from the Viv Ansanm Gang, whose members attacked multiple neighborhoods in Port-au-Prince since 24 February) on Vaillant street and Avenue Poupelard (at the height of Ravine Pintade neighborhood). Clashes erupted after the criminals set fire to residents' houses in the area (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 26 February 2025, in Tabarre - Tabarre 27, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, the Kraze Barye Gang attacked residents at their houses in Tabarre 27 and nearby Tabarre 25. The neighborhoods were under gang attack since 24 February, when the criminals targeted the positions of a self-defense group brigade (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 9 December 2024, in Cite Soleil - Waaf Jeremie, Ouest, the Micanord Gang killed three men and two women whom they intercepted trying to flee the Waaf Jeremie neighborhood. The victims were taken to an area known as 'Nan Mangue', where they were executed. They were identified as close people to some victims of the Micanord Gang's massacre of 6 December (coded separately). Between 6 and 11 December, ACLED recorded 242 fatalities as a result of the attacks by the Micanord Gang. Other sources estimate that the attacks resulted in 222 fatalities. At least 242 fatalities split across six events. 5 fatalities coded here.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network; Trip Foumi; Vi Free Press
notes: On 10 December 2024, in Cite Soleil - Waaf Jeremie, Ouest, according to witnesses, armed members of the Micanord Gang chased and attacked residents in the Waaf Jeremie neighborhood. According to BINUH, eight men and five women were taken to the gang's stronghold, where they were tortured before being killed and burned. Between 10 and 11 December, at least 50 people were killed by the Micanord Gang after being accused of having informed the press of the ongoing violence in Waaf Jeremie, following the massive killing of residents and voodoo practitioners (coded separately). On 11 December, 60 people who had been kidnapped on 8 December (coded separately) were released. This was part of an ongoing gang offensive against elderly people and voodoo practitioners that led to the killing of hundreds of civilians between 6 and 11 December (coded separately). ACLED recorded 242 fatalities, while other sources estimate that the attacks resulted in 222 fatalities. 242 fatalities split across six events. 25 fatalities coded here.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network; Trip Foumi
notes: On 11 December 2024, in Cite Soleil - Waaf Jeremie, Ouest, according to witnesses, armed members of the Micanord Gang chased and attacked residents in the Waaf Jeremie neighborhood. According to BINUH, five women who denounced their relatives' disappearance on TikTok were taken to the gang's stronghold, where they were executed. Between 10 and 11 December, at least 50 people were killed by the Micanord Gang after being accused of having informed the press of the ongoing violence in Waaf Jeremie, following the massive killing of residents and voodoo practitioners (coded separately). On 11 December, 60 people who had been kidnapped on 8 December (coded separately) were released. This was part of an ongoing gang offensive against elderly people and voodoo practitioners that led to the killing of hundreds of civilians between 6 and 11 December (coded separately). ACLED recorded 242 fatalities, while other sources estimate that the attacks resulted in 222 fatalities. 242 fatalities split across six events. 25 fatalities coded here.

On 13 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bourdon, Ouest, thousands of displaced residents from Nazon and Solino took to the streets in the Bourdon neighborhood demanding authorities to take action against gang violence for them to safely return to their communities. Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires, blocking the roadway.

source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network; Trip Foumi
notes: On 16 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Soissons, Ouest, overnight, the Kraze Barye Gang killed at least 20 civilians (up to 23 according to sources on the ground) as they attacked the Chateau blond street (Soissons neighborhood) and the close Petit-Troupeau area, near Freres Road and the Police Academy. Among the fatal victims, 14 were identified. There were five members of the same family (four of them identified as sibling children), and up to seven church members (one from the 7th Day Adventist Church of Freres, and three from the 7th Day Adventist Church of Pernier). Some victims were killed or burned at homes and others on the streets. Some residents fled the area. The attack was a reprisal for the killing of a Kraze Barye Gang member by police forces between 14 and 15 February (coded separately). The victims were accused of being police snitches. Other versions stated revenge over the lynching of a close relative of a gang member. At least 20 fatalities.

source: Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); SG Alert (Whatsapp); Trip Foumi
notes: Property destruction: On 22 February 2025, in Gressier - Nan Reserve, Ouest, gang members from the Viv Ansanm Gang set fire to a police tank in La Colline area (in Nan Reserve, Southern extreme of the commune). The scene was recorded on video and shared on social media. There was a boy among the gang members.

On 23 February 2025, in Delmas - Musseau, Ouest, armed men shot and killed two men in Delmas 63, near the Our Lady of Altagrace Church. Motivation unknown. The perpetrators fled the scene. 2 fatalities.

On 23 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bourdon, Ouest, between 40-50 residents held a demonstration against the violence of gangs. They erected burning barricades on the streets of Bourdon and along those axes leading to nearby Canape-Vert neighborhood. Gunshots were heard.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vi Free Press
notes: On 24 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Fort National, Ouest, overnight, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents at their homes in the Fort National neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

Other: On 24 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, residents erected barricades of burning tires on Bois Patate street and on the Pomphile bridge zone (Canape-Vert neighborhood) to prevent gang members from entering residential communities. Also in Port-au-Prince, a roadblock was set up in Bolosse Avenue cutting circulation toward the downtown area. There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblock or who set it up.

On 25 February 2025, in Tabarre - Tabarre 27, Ouest, overnight, the Kraze Barye Gang attacked residents and set fire to their houses in Tabarre 27 and nearby Tabarre 25. Dead bodies were seen on the streets. The neighborhoods were under gang attack since 24 February, when the criminals targeted the positions of a self-defense group brigade and residents (coded separately). Gunshots were heard in several surrounding areas, including Tabarre 39, Tabarre 41, Carrefour Fleuriot, Carrefour Gerald, the lower section of Delmas 33, and the road of Gerald Bataille toward Petite Place Cazeau and Carradeux. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Gazette Haiti; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 27 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang) clashed with police forces on the Romain Street, in the vicinity of the Gymnasium Vincent building (hosting displaced residents), and in the vicinity of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry's building, that was hit by the bullets (located on Legitime Street). Clashes were also registered in Centre Ville and Bas Peu de Choses neighborhoods (coded separately). The gang attack was part of a coordinated offensive by affiliates of the Viv Ansanm Gang. Casualties unknown.

On 28 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Joseph Janvier, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang tore down fences on the Leonard Street (Delmas 19) and attacked residents' properties. Following the attack, police forces arrived and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Overnight, several vehicles were set on fire by the criminals. Casualties unknown.
On 4 September 2024, in Balan, Ouest, armed individuals attacked residents, prompting the displacement of civilians. Casualties unknown.

On 10 September 2024, in Delmas - Saint-Martin, Ouest, Nan Boston and Simon-Pele gang members clashed in 2nd Cite Saint-Martin neighborhood (Bas Delmas). The clashes were the result of a football match where one of the two teams from Boston and Pele Simon refused to admit they lost (coded separately). Residents have had to flee their homes. Casualties unknown.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 11 September 2024, in Cite Soleil - Boston, Ouest, Nan Boston and Simon-Pele gang members clashed. The clashes started on 11 September as a result of a football match where one of the two teams from Boston and Pele Simon refused to admit they lost (coded separately). Residents have had to flee their homes. Casualties unknown.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 22 December 2024, in Cite Soleil - Waaf Jeremie, Ouest, two members of the Micanord Gang shot and injured a 32-year-old resident on his hand as they attacked him at his home. The victim was the nephew of a man who was killed by the Micanord Gang in Waaf Jeremie on 7 December (coded separately). The attack had been ordered by the Micanord Gang's leader after the man had claimed that his uncle's death would not be in vain. He was only shot to a hand because the two gang members who perpetrated the shooting knew him personally. 1 injured.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: Around 15 February 2025 (between 14 - 15 February), near Petion Ville - Soissons, Ouest, police forces shot and killed a member of the Kraze Barye Gang during a security operation between Chateau blond street and Petit-Troupeau (both close to the Freres Road). On 16 February, the son of the deceased's gang member launched a reprisal attack against residents from Chateau blond street (Soissons neighborhood) over accusations of being police snitched (coded separately). 1 fatality.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 16 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Soissons, Ouest, overnight, a member of the Kraze Barye Gang intercepted a 10-year-old girl on Chateau blond street (Soissons neighborhood) and raped her at a nearby abandoned house. The sexual assault happened as members of that gang carried out a reprisal attack against residents after the killing of a Kraze Barye Gang member by police forces between 14 and 15 February (coded separately). The victims were accused of being police snitches.

On 22 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 17, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Delmas 17, this action is likely related to gang attacks against residents as similar actions were recorded in the following days (coded separately). Houses were also set on fire. Casualties unknown.
On 23 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, in the early morning, the Viv Ansanm attacked residents in Delmas 30. Gunshots were heard. Casualties unknown.
Other: On 23 February 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Carrefour Aeroport and Bas Delmas. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Around 23 February 2025, overnight, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour Feuilles, Ouest, armed clashes were registered until early morning the following day. Gunshots were heard throughout the night until 4 AM. There is no information on the circumstances or actors involved in the clashes. Neighborhood self-defense brigades installed barricades for protection. Casualties unknown.

Around 23 February 2025, overnight, in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, armed clashes were registered until early morning the following day. Gunshots were heard throughout the night until 4 AM. There is no information on the circumstances or actors involved in the clashes. Casualties unknown.

Around 23 February 2025, overnight, in Port-au-Prince - Poste Marchand, Ouest, armed clashes were registered until early morning the following day. There is no information on the circumstances or actors involved in the clashes. Casualties unknown.
Other: On 23 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Nazon, Christ Roi, and Carrefour Feuilles. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

On 23 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Christ Roi - Lalue, Ouest, people erected barricades of burning tires in the area likely related to ongoing demonstrations in nearby areas, including Bourdon (coded separately).

On 25 February 2025, in Cite Soleil - Sarthe, Ouest, the police clashed with armed individuals in Carrefour Vincent. Barricades of burning tires were also set up in the area. Gunshots were also heard in Drouillard. Casualties unknown.
On 25 February 2025, between Delmas - Carrefour Aeroport/Delmas 13, and Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang clashed with the police. Casualties unknown.

On 25 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm attacked residents at their homes in Delmas 19, prompting the displacement of civilians as some fled their houses. Casualties unknown.
On 25 February 2025, in Delmas - Musseau, Ouest, people protested. There is no information on the motives of the protest.
Other: On 25 February 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Delmas 83 and Fragneau Ville. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 25 February 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Laboule 12. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Around 25 February 2025 (between 25 - 27 February), in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour Feuilles, Ouest, unidentified armed men attacked residents. There is no information on the circumstances or perpetrators of the attack(s). Casualties unknown.

Around 25 February 2025 (between 25 - 27 February), in Port-au-Prince - Debussy/Haut-Turgeau, Ouest, unidentified armed men attacked residents in Debussy. There is no information on the circumstances or perpetrators of the attack(s). Casualties unknown.

Around 25 February 2025 (between 25 - 27 February), in Port-au-Prince - Fort National, Ouest, unidentified armed men attacked residents. There is no information on the circumstances or perpetrators of the attack(s). Casualties unknown.

Around 25 February 2025 (between 25 - 27 February), in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, unidentified armed men attacked residents. There is no information on the circumstances or perpetrators of the attack(s). Casualties unknown.

Around 25 February 2025 (between 25 - 27 February), in Port-au-Prince - Solino, Ouest, unidentified armed men attacked residents. There is no information on the circumstances or perpetrators of the attack(s). Casualties unknown.

Other: On 26 February 2025, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Carrefour Vincent (Sarthe neighborhood). The police were present, but no specific activities were reported. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 26 February 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, a burning barricade was set up in Delmas 48, restricting circulation in the area. There is no information on the circumstances of the barricade or who set it up.

Other: On 26 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, burning tires were registered in 1ere Impasse Lavaud (Bois Verna neighborhood) restricting circulation. Burning barricades were also set up in Lalue. There is no information on the circumstances of the barricades or who set them up.
Non-violent activity: Around 28 February 2025 (as reported), in Delmas, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang set up roadblocks to prevent police forces from accessing the Delmas 19 neighborhood.

On 28 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, armed clashes were registered near the police station. There is no further information on the circumstances or actors involved in the confrontations. Casualties unknown.
Other: On 28 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Nazon and Christ Roi. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 1 March 2025, in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune, Artibonite, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang kidnapped at least five farmers in the Moreau-Douet area. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Juno 7; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 1 March 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 40b, Ouest, citizens, called by the Committed to Development Party (EDE), held a march with banners between Delmas 19, Delmas 30, and Delmas 40b neighborhoods to decry insecurity and to demand specific actions by national authorities in the face of gangs. As the protesting crowd arrived to Delmas 40b, police forces used tear gas to disperse them. The mobilization was joined by the EDE party leader.

Non-violent activity: Around 2 March 2025 (as reported), in Carrefour, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang erected a musical stand in the Cote Plage neighborhood as part of gang-organized carnival festivities. This was part of the gangs' efforts aimed at bringing them closer to local population.

Non-violent activity: Around 2 March 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang) ordered cleaning operations on Martissaint Road and led a musical float stamped with 'UVD' (Village-de-Dieu Unit). This was part of gang-organized carnival festivities (scheduled for 3, 4, and 5 March), and of the gangs' efforts aimed at bringing them closer to local population.

Other: On 3 March 2025, in Carrefour, Ouest, the Base 5 Secondes Gang led a carnival float through the streets of the commune as part of gang-organized carnival festivities. Thousands of residents joined the activity. This was part of the gangs' efforts aimed at bringing them closer to local population.

Security measures: On 5 March 2025, in Leogane, Ouest, local authorities imposed a ban on the exit of all rara bands to the streets of the communal territory. The decision was taken over security concerns due to the presence of the Viv Ansanm Gang in nearby Gressier commune.
On 6 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members between Magloire Ambroise and Christophe avenues. Casualties unknown.

Around 6 March 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Pacot, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in Pacot. The criminals managed to take control of the neighborhood, based on the Port-au-Prince's mayor statements. Casualties unknown.

Around 6 March 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Turgeau, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in Turgeau. The criminals managed to take control of the neighborhood, based on the Port-au-Prince's mayor statements. Casualties unknown.
On 7 March 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in Bas Delmas. Gunshots were heard. Casualties unknown.

source: Amerique Info 7; Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Trip Foumi
notes: On 4 March 2025, near Kenscoff - Fond Ferier, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in Carrefour Badio and kidnapped several civilians. They also made an incursion into the nearby Kay Jacques Road. They also cut off the road towards Seguin (Sud-Est) at several points in that same area by digging holes in the floor, which prevented the police from directly confronting the gang. Another version states that members of the population were responsible for the roadblocks and were able to detain six gang members. Gunshots were heard. The victims' whereabouts are unknown. Casualties unknown.

Other: On 20 February 2024, in Duchity, Grande-Anse, roadblocks were registered preventing maintenance works on a communication line. There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblocks or who set them up.

source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: On 26 June 2024, in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, gang members killed a coordinator of the Board of Directors of the Municipal Section (CASEC) and burned his body. The mastermind of the attack was killed by police forces in February 2025 (coded separately). 1 fatality.

Around 23 July 2024 (between 22 - 23 July), in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, armed gang members kidnapped three young women in the Michaud village (in the Morne-Terrible communal section) and took them to an unknown location in Titanyen. Their whereabouts are unknown.

Security measures: On 25 September 2024, in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, a curfew was imposed to reestablish order in the area starting on 25 September 2024 from 8pm to 6am. There is no information on when the curfew will end.

On 27 September 2024, in the commune of Saut-d'Eau, Centre, the police clashed with gang members to repel them from different localities of Mirebalais (coded separately) and Saut-d'Eau such as Ka Micho, Ka Michel, Ka Ti Ben and Grosse Pierre among other. Casualties unknown.

On 22 September 2024, in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, gang members attacked residents, killing more than 10 people. The report indicates that around 150 armed gangsters were registered in the area and the police tried to resist the attack. The gangsters are using churches to establish their base in the area. Residents have had to hide while others have fled their homes. At least 10 fatalities.
Property destruction: Around 25 September 2024 (as reported), in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, police forces demolished a property used as shelter by gang members.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Around 18 February 2024 (as reported), in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, rival gang members engaged in armed clashes in Saut-d'Eau, Mirebalais, and Thomazeau (coded separately). Some residents were displaced. Casualties unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 18 February 2024, in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked areas in Saut-d'Eau and the Mirebalais commune (coded separately). Attacks by the Viv Ansanm Gang on that day in locations of Mirebalais and Saut-d'Eau caused hundreds of displaced residents. Casualties unknown.

source: PNH: National Police of Haiti; Trip Foumi
notes: On 26 December 2024, in the Saut-d'Eau commune, Centre, overnight, police forces shot and killed at least two gang members during clashes in the Grosse Pierre zone. A firearm and ammunition were seized. At least 2 fatalities.

On 14 February 2025, in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, overnight, police forces shot and killed an armed gang member during a clash in the 'Lekete' locality. Three other gangsters were arrested and several firearms were seized. The now deceased was the main suspect in the killing of a coordinator of the Board of Directors of the Municipal Section (CASEC), in June 2024 (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 24 February 2025, in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, residents held a demonstration and set up barricades of burning tires to oppose the potential retirement of police forces agents and a police armored vehicle from the area.

On 27 February 2025, in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, an attack was carried out against the Lakou Madigra locality. Residents were forced to flee the area. There is no information on the circumstances or perpetrators of the attack. Casualties unknown.

On 4 March 2025, in the Saut-d'Eau commune, Centre, a mob of residents lynched to death two members of the Taliban Gang (a.k.a. Canaan Gang) whom the police had arrested earlier that day (coded separately) in the Coupe Mardi Gras locality (3rd communal sections of Saut-d'Eau). 2 fatalities.

On 4 March 2025, in the Saut-d'Eau commune, Centre, in the morning, police forces clashed with members of the Taliban Gang (a.k.a. Canaan Gang) during a security operation in the Coupe Mardi Gras locality (3rd communal sections of Saut-d'Eau), killing two. Two other gangsters who were arrested by the police were later lynched by a mob of residents (coded separately). The police seized ammunition and managed to recover control of several areas. 2 fatalities.

On 17 February 2025, in Delmas - Terrain Accra, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang set fire to the Camp Acra, located in Terrain Acra neighborhood, killing dozens of displaced civilians who were taking refuge at the facilities, and prompting the displacement of others. At least 10 fatalities.

Other: On 1 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in different parts of the city, including Avenue Christophe, Chavannes and Capois streets, as well as Champs de Mars. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 1 March 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Nazon and Delmas 30. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 1 March 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Damien, Cazeau, and Croix des Missions. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

On 2 March 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, clashes were registered. There is no information on the circumstances or actors involved in the clashes. Gunshots were also heard in Carrefour Aeroport. Casualties unknown.

On 2 March 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, clashes were registered in Delmas 19. There is no information on the circumstances or actors involved in the clashes. Gunshots were also heard in Carrefour Aeroport. Casualties unknown.

On 2 March 2025, in La Coupe, Centre, armed individuals set fire to the CASEC (Councils of Administration of the Communal Sections) premises, businesses, and the hospital of the area. During the attack, two CASEC employees were killed. They also burned a person (it is unclear whether the person died or survived the burning). At least 2 fatalities.
On 2 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Ravine Pintade, Ouest, armed men fired at residents who were trying to abandon the area. Casualties unknown.

Other: On 2 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Nazon and Solino. Gunshots were also heard downtown after two explosions were heard. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots, or the nature of the explosions.
Around 3 March 2025 (as reported), in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, gang members attacked residents. There is no information on the circumstances of the attack. Casualties unknown.

Other: On 3 March 2025, in Cite Soleil - Sarthe, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Carrefour Vincent (Sarthe neighborhood) and Drouillard. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 3 March 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Delmas 19, Delmas 30, and the airport road. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 3 March 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard near the airport. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 3 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Nazon, Bois Verna, Champs de Mars, as well as Capois street. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

On 6 March 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, a person was abducted on the Airport road near the Salomon Varreux street. Although there is no information on the circumstances or perpetrators of the abduction, latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

On 6 March 2025, in Delmas - Barbancourt, Ouest, armed individuals opened fire on a car where two people were traveling during a kidnapping attempt near Sogeplast, injuring one person who was taken to the hospital. The other victim was unharmed. Police presence was registered, but no specific activities were reported. 1 injured.

source: Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: On 6 March 2025, in Seguin, Sud-Est, a mob of residents lynched to death two men on a motorcycle whom the police had stopped from transporting something similar to marijuana. 2 fatalities.

On 6 March 2025, on the road to Jacmel, Sud-Est, members of the population killed two gang members. They also detained another suspicious person they handed over to the police. Using barricades they have installed in the area, they were also able to stop a man who was delivering drugs to the armed group. 2 fatalities.

Non-violent activity: On 6 March 2025, in Kenscoff, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals took over the Kajak area at the height of Madan Fleurant, cutting access between the Ouest and Sud-Est departments. The individuals claimed to be installing a toll system on the road.
On 7 March 2025, in Marigot, Sud-Est, the police arrested 30 gang members and put them in prison.
Other: On 7 March 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard from Bas Delmas to Delmas 33. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
On 7 March 2025, in Delmas - Musseau, Ouest, people protested near Villa d'Accueil. There is no information on the circumstances or motives of the protest.
On 7 March 2025, in Belladere, Centre, people protested by setting up a roadblock on Route Departementale 31. There is no information on the motives for the protest.

Around 9 March 2025 (as reported), in the Croix-des-Bouquets commune, Ouest, the leader of the Chien Mechant Gang opened fire on some of his soldiers who refused to obey and stay at the gang's base. Dissident gangsters refused to obey over fears that police forces would target the gang's stronghold with drone strikes. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 9 March 2025, in Trianon, Centre, a mob of residents and members of a vigilance brigade (self-defense group), armed with machetes, stones, and sticks, lynched to death two out of four individuals transporting firearms and ammunition in a mini-bus for gang members in Delmas 75. One of the victims was the mini-bus driver. The police seized the weapons and ammunition from the vehicle. 2 fatalities.

Around 11 March 2025 (as reported), near Bois d'Orme, Ouest, the 400 Mawozo Gang hijacked several public transport vehicles at Morne a Cabrit peaks area and kidnapped the passengers. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Gazette Haiti; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole
notes: On 11 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour Feuilles, Ouest, the Grand-Ravine Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) attacked the positions of the police and a vigilance brigade (self-defense group), and set fire to a shelter used by the last ones. Several police vehicles were also attacked. During the gang assault, several residents' houses and vehicles were burned. Gunshots were heard. According to witnesses, there were casualties among the police and the self-defense group members (nature of casualties unclarified). Many residents fled their homes to take refuge elsewhere. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 11 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bas Peu de Choses, Ouest, the Grand-Ravine Gang and the Base 5 Secondes Gang (in support of the Viv Ansanm Gang) clashed with police forces in Place Jeremie as the criminals attacked residential areas between Place Jeremie, Jean Jacques Dessalines School, and close areas to the Oloffson hotel. Several residents' houses and vehicles were set on fire on Capois, Romain, Chavannes, and Magloire Ambroise streets. Gunshots were heard at the height of Christophe and N Avenues. Many residents fled their homes to take refuge elsewhere. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole
notes: On 11 March 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, overnight, the police and self-defense group members engaged in armed clashes with gang members in Delmas 30. Clashes were also registered in Delmas 29, 31, 32 and Christ Roi neighborhoods (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 11 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Christ-Roi, Ouest, overnight, the police and self-defense group members engaged in armed clashes with gang members in Christ-Roi. Clashes were also registered in Delmas 30, 31, 32, and 29 (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 11 March 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 32, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with gang members in Delmas 32. Clashes were also registered in Delmas 29, 31, 30, and Christ Roi (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 11 March 2025, in Delmas - Village W. Lamothe, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with gang members in Delmas 29. Clashes were also registered in Delmas 32, 31, 30, and Christ Roi neighborhoods (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 11 March 2025, in Delmas - Maguana, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with gang members in Delmas 31. Clashes were also registered in Delmas 32, 29, 30, and Christ Roi neighborhoods (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 11 March 2025, in Delmas - Maguana, Ouest, armed individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed the former Secretary of State for Population and Human Development as he tried to resist a kidnapping attempt near his home in Delmas 31 (Maguana neighborhood). The victim was on board a vehicle when he was ambushed. 1 fatality.

On 11 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Campeche, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang set fire to houses as they attacked residents in the neighborhood. Gunshots were heard. Many residents fled their homes to take refuge elsewhere. Casualties unknown.
On 11 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Pacot, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents on Pacot Street. Gunshots were heard. Casualties unknown.
On 11 March 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 60, Ouest, a group of textile workers held a sit-in protest in front of the Villa D'Accueil building demanding higher wages.

On 12 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bas Peu de Choses, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, police forces clashed with the Grand-Ravine Gang and the Base 5 Secondes Gang (affiliates of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) in the neighborhood, this time on Capois Street. Clashes took place as the gangs attacked residents in the area since 11 March (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Press Network; Haiti Standard; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 12 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bas Peu de Choses, Ouest, overnight, the Grand-Ravine Gang and the Base 5 Secondes Gang (both affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) attacked residents from Capois, Magloire Ambroise, Chavannes, and Romain streets, among others in the neighborhood. During the attack, the criminals set fire to the Radio-Tele Caraibes headquarters (Chavannes street), and looted the facilities of the Radio Melodie FM (Capois street). They made holes in the walls to gain access. Both radio stations were empty when the attacks took place. Earlier that day, police forces had clashed with the gang members on Capois street (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 12 March 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 60, Ouest, several scores of citizens called by the Patriotic Emergency Party (PEP) held a sit-in protest in front of the Villa D'Accueil building demanding that authorities take action in the face of insecurity and the violence of gangs.
Around 13 March 2025 (as reported), in Delmas - Delmas 17, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in Delmas 19. Casualties unknown.
On 13 March 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 32, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members during anti-gang operations in Delmas 32. Casualties unknown.
On 13 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Christ-Roi, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members during anti-gang operations in the Christ-Roi neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

source: Amerique Info 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Scholars at Risk
notes: On 13 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, gang members coming from the Carrefour Feuilles neighborhood invaded and attacked the State University of Haiti (UEH), as well as Avenue Christophe at the height of Champs de Mars, prompting the interruption of academic activities, which were suspended until 31 March following the attack. The criminals were likely members of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition, whose affiliates clashed with the police and attacked residents in Carrefour Feuilles since 11 March (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 13 March 2025, in Leogane, Ouest, thousands of residents called by several civil society organizations held a protest demanding that police forces be provided with proper equipment to face the threat of gangs in the Gressier commune.

Around 12 March 2025 (as reported), in Delmas - Delmas 19/Joseph Janvier, Ouest, police forces clashed with members of the Viv Ansanm Gang in Delmas 19 after the criminals attacked residents in the neighborhood (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 13 March 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang shot and killed a vigilance brigade member (self-defense group) during clashes to resist the gang's invasion of the neighborhood. Gunshots were heard as residents fled the area. 1 fatality.

source: Amerique Info 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 10 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bas Peu de Choses, Ouest, the Grand-Ravine Gang and the Base 5 Secondes Gang (affiliates of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) deployed along the Chavannes street and opened fire on the temporary shelter at a Girl's High School, killing a civilian and injuring two others. The victims were part of a group of displaced residents taking shelter at the mentioned institution. Viv Ansanm Gang members also set fire to buildings along the Capois and Alerte streets, and on the Christophe Avenue, killing and injuring several civilians. At least 1 fatality, at least 2 injured.

On 14 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Avenue Christophe, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents along the Christophe Avenue, including Lafleur Ducheine street. They looted and set fire to several buildings. They fired shots, causing people to flee the area. The criminals also targeted nearby areas of the close Bas Peu de Choses neighborhood (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

Other: On 12 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Pacot neighborhood and downtown. This was likely the authorship of gang members who attacked residents in the mentioned areas the day prior (coded separately).

source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Haiti Press Network; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Trip Foumi
notes: Property destruction: Around 2 July 2024 (between 1 - 2 July), in Carrefour - Brochette, Ouest, several dozen members of the Viv Ansanm Gang looted and set fire to a part of the Saint Charles sub-police station, in Brochette neighbourhood. The police facility had been abandoned several months prior due to gang violence in the area. Security forces intervened and prevented the building from being entirely burned.

Around 11 March 2025 (as reported), in Delmas - Maguana, Ouest, an unspecified number of abductions were carried out in Delmas 31. The number of abducted victims is unknown. There is no information on the circumstances and the perpetrators of these abductions, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Radio Metropole; Vi Free Press
notes: On 18 March 2025, in Kenscoff - Belo, Ouest, police forces and Kenyan agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission clashed with Viv Ansanm gang members during a security operation in the Belo neighborhood. A Kenyan officer was shot and injured. 1 injured.

On 16 March 2025, in Gressier, Ouest, overnight, police forces supported by armed members of the population killed at least 10 members of the 103 Zombies Gang who planned to attack the nearby commune of Leogane. At least 10 fatalities.

source: Gazette Haiti; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; PNH: National Police of Haiti; Trip Foumi
notes: On 15 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bicentenaire, Ouest, police forces carried out a security operation against a base of the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang) located between Fort St. Clair and the EDH company headquarters, in Bicentenaire neighborhood. The police used armored vehicles to reach the gang positions and destroyed a number of houses. According to the head of the RNDDH, around 20 gang members were killed and several were injured during clashes with the police. Witnesses confirmed fatalities among the criminals. A number of others managed to flee. The Base 5 Secondes Gang had moved his base from their stronghold in Cite de Dieu to Bicentenaire after the police carried out drone strikes on 2 March (coded separately). At least 20 fatalities, several injured.
On 12 March 2025, in Kenscoff - Furcy, Ouest, the police clashed with armed individuals in Carrefour Badio. There is no information on the circumstances of the confrontations. Casualties unknown.
On 13 March 2025, in Delmas - Gerald Bataille, Ouest, the police clashed with armed individuals who were trying to attack the neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

On 13 March 2025, in Tabarre - Aeroport Toussaint Louverture, Ouest, the police prevented armed men using a military vehicle from attacking the airport. The police killed all the attackers and seized weapons and the vehicle. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 14 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the police clashed with gang members on Lamartiniere Avenue. There is no information on the circumstances of the confrontations. Casualties unknown.

On 14 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bois Verna, Ouest, overnight, police forces engaged in armed clashes with gang members near a MSF center known as 'Physicians Sans Frontieres-Centre D'urgence Turgeau', in Bois Verna. Casualties unknown.

Around 17 March 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Christ-Roi, Ouest, police forces engaged in armed clashes with the Viv Ansanm Gang at the mini-bus station area, along Senghor, Acacia, and Brutus streets, near the Best-Inn hotel, and near the Sinai church. The criminals managed to take control of these zones. Casualties unknown.

On 13 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Saint Antoine/Lalue, Ouest, armed clashes were registered in Lalue. There is no information on the circumstances or actors involved in the confrontations. Casualties unknown.
On 13 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bourdon, Ouest, armed clashes were registered. There is no information on the circumstances or actors involved in the confrontations. Casualties unknown.
On 15 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Morne Marie, Ouest, armed clashes were registered. There is no information on the circumstances or actors involved in the confrontations. Casualties unknown.

On 16 March 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, armed clashed were registered in the area. There is no information on the circumstances or specific actors involved in the confrontations. Casualties unknown.

On 16 March 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 32, Ouest, armed clashed were registered in the area. There is no information on the circumstances or specific actors involved in the confrontations. Casualties unknown.

On 16 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Avenue Christophe, Ouest, armed clashed were registered in the area. There is no information on the circumstances or specific actors involved in the confrontations. Casualties unknown.

Around 11 March 2025 (as reported), between Rode and Port-au-Prince (coded to Rode), Centre, members of the 400 Mawozo Gang killed people travelling from the Plateau Central to the capital and vice versa. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Gazette Haiti; Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 15 March 2025, in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune, Artibonite, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang killed six people who tried to resist a collective kidnapping attempt in Bas Coursin II (Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite's 2nd communal section). One of the victims was shot dead and his body was thrown into the canal. One source located the attack in the Haut-Fourneau locality, while another one reported it in 'Wo Kanal'. The attack motivated a protest by residents who demanded the police to take action in the face of insecurity (coded separately). 6 fatalities.
