The woman was located after the police seized her partner's phone in Mirebalais with messages that clarified that she was receiving money from other gang members. 1 fatality.

source: Le Facteur Haiti; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 29 May 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 65, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed a police officer along the Rue Faustin 1er Street, Delmas 65 (drive-by). The victim was a presidential guard police agent. 1 fatality.

On 28 April 2025, in Petion Ville - Academie, Ouest, overnight, there was an exchange of gunfire likely related to an armed clash near the Police Academy. The circumstances and the armed actors involved in the armed clash are unknown. Casualties unknown.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: RLN: RL News Haiti; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 27 April 2025, in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune, Artibonite, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang attacked residents in Beaufort, an area located in the Laverdure zone (in the Bas Coursin II communal section). Casualties unknown.

On 12 May 2025, in Delmas - Chancerelles, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man at the Superior Housing Development Corporation (SHODECOSA) deposit facilities (in Chancerelles) as he tried to resist a kidnapping attempt. The victim was the owner of the SHODECOSA deposit. 1 fatality.

On 12 May 2025, in Cite Soleil - Sarthe, Ouest, armed individuals opened fire on a helicopter when it was flying over Carrefour Vincent. Gunshots were also heard near the National Road 1. Casualties unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 30 April 2025, in Delmas - Catalpa/Delmas 75, Ouest, self-defense group members shot and killed three suspected members of the 400 Mawozo Gang. During the shooting, seven family members were killed (including two teenagers), and two others were wounded by the stray bullets. The victims were attending a mortuary vigil held in the courtyard of their residence at 29, Cassagnol Street (Delmas 75). 10 fatalities, 2 injured.

source: Radio Tele Pacific; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 28 August 2024, in Delmas - Catalpa/Delmas 75, Ouest, in the morning, gang members killed a police officer woman on Cassagnol Street. She was on her way to work. 1 fatality.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 15 August 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Fort National, Ouest, armed members of the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Fort National neighborhood. Simultaneous attacks that led to clashes with police were recorded in Solino, and Delmas 24 neighbourhoods (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
Looting: On 30 April 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 17, Ouest, unidentified individuals looted the facilities of the EuroCeram Plus S.A. Company, located on the Delmas 19 Road (Delmas 17 neighborhood).
Property destruction: On 5 May 2025, in Kenscoff - Furcy, Ouest, unidentified individuals set fire to the Lodge Hotel. The attack was announced, but there was no response from the police.

Property destruction: On 11 May 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bas Peu de Choses, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang destroyed the Computerized Scanner Centre (a.k.a. Imaging Centre), located on Marcelin Street. No further details were mentioned.
Other: On 29 April 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a roadblock was set up in Canape-Vert. There is no information on the circumstances or who set it up.
Other: On 13 May 2025, near Plaisance, Nord, a roadblock was set up along the National Road 1 at the height of Morne Puilboreau. There is no information on the circumstances or who set it up.
Other: On 27 April 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Turgeau, Pacot, and Debussy. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 29 April 2025, in Marin, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Shada and Marin areas. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 29 April 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Turgeau (near the Sacred Heart Church), in Pacot, and Debussy neighborhoods. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 29 April 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Torcelle neighborhood. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 1 May 2025, in Kenscoff, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Fermathe. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 1 May 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, overnight, gunshots were heard in Pernier and the Freres Road. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 1 May 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, overnight, gunshots were heard in Turgeau and Debussy neighborhoods. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 4 May 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, overnight, gunshots were heard near the Police Academy (Academie) and the Impasse Gracien area (Freres). There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

Non-violent activity: On 5 May 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified armed men set up a roadblock in Martissant 7 along the road connecting Carrefour and Port-au-Prince. Road traffic was blocked.

Other: On 8 May 2025, in Kenscoff, Ouest, gunshots were heard around Fermathe. The gunshots were described as the authorship of armed individuals from Lazontiere area. They were suspected of shooting at anyone trying to cross St-Jacques crossroad.
Other: On 8 May 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, detonations were heard in the lower part of the capital. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the detonations.
Other: On 9 May 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Delmas 30. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 12 May 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Delmas 19. One source stated that the gunshots were directed at a vehicle, although no further information was mentioned.
Other: On 12 May 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Pacot neighborhood. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the detonations.

Other: On 13 May 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, gunshots were heard in Delmas 19, and in Simon Pele near the Airport Road. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 14 May 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, for a third consecutive day, gunshots were heard in Delmas 19, and in Delmas 30. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

Non-violent activity: On 27 April 2025, in Kenscoff, Ouest, it is suspected that gang members dug a ditch and blocked the roadway at the entrance of the Furcy neighborhood. It is also suspected that the gang members stopped their actions as a police patrol crossed the area. No interaction between the officers and the gang members was mentioned.
On 4 May 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 44, Ouest, a group of people held a protest in Delmas 42 over unclarified claims.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 28 April 2025, in Terre Noire, Artibonite, in the early morning, armed individuals attacked residents in Terre Noire. The attack was likely the authorship of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang, whose members carried out attacks against several locations in the Artibonite on that day (coded separately). Nearby areas known as 'Dipi' and 'Dofono' were also attacked. Casualties unknown.

On 5 March 2024, in Frecineau, Artibonite, dozens of armed men, described as affiliates of the Jean-Denis Gang, opened fire on residents following an altercation between two individuals over the funeral of a voodoo priest's relative. At least four people were injured. Two others were arrested and beaten up. Witnesses claimed that the armed men entered a hospital with their heavy weapons. The gangsters established a curfew in the village. At least 4 injured.

Around 1 January 2025 (between 30 December - 2 January), in Pierre Payen, Artibonite, hospital employees, including nurses, held a demonstration to decry administrative changes that would reduce their monthly wages. During the mobilization, demonstrators set tires on fire and threw stones. This was part of a labor strike started on 30 December.
On 23 June 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, residents blocked the National Road 1 to demand the intervention of the authorities in the handling of gang violence in the area.

On 24 June 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, for a second consecutive day, residents blocked the National Road 1 to demand the intervention of the authorities in the handling of gang violence in the area.
On 11 April 2025, in Mirebalais, Centre, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang killed an aid worker at an International Non-Governmental Organization. 1 fatality.

Non-violent activity: On 17 June 2025, in Mirebalais, Centre, gang members set up barricades in Carrefour Peligre to prevent police officers from accessing the area and carrying out anti-gang operations.

On 26 June 2025, in Petion Ville - Centre Ville (Ouest), Ouest, in the morning, a group of around 12 individuals, some of them masked and armed with weapons, sticks, and stones, assaulted the facilities of the National Old-Age Insurance Office (ONA) and tried to break into the premises, damaging vehicles and injuring a security guard (nature of injuries unclarified). The attackers claimed to be demanding work. 1 injured.

Property destruction: Around 26 May 2025 (as reported), in Petion Ville - Vivy Mitchell, Ouest, the police destroyed a building associated with the Kraze Barye Gang as part of an operation to regain control over the area.

Around 1 May 2025 (as reported), in Kenscoff, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched a drone airstrike against houses occupied by gangs in the Morne Lazontye area. Some criminals were seen fleeing the properties. Casualties unknown.
Other: On 16 May 2025, in Deluge, Artibonite, in the morning, a roadblock was set up along the National Road 1. There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblock or who set it up.
On 16 May 2025, in Cite Soleil - Sarthe, Ouest, police forces engaged in armed clashes with unidentified armed group members. Casualties unknown.
Other: On 16 May 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard on the Airport Road near Delmas 19. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

On 16 May 2025, in Petion Ville - Centre Ville (Nord), Ouest, overnight, unidentified armed individuals shot and injured a driver during a kidnapping attempt in the Boyer square. The driver managed to escape. 1 injured.
Other: On 16 May 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Poste Marchand. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

Around 17 May 2025 (as reported), in Petion Ville - Soissons, Ouest, a man who had been kidnapped by unidentified armed men (date unknown) was shot and killed, and his body was found on the streets of Soissons near the kidnapping location. He had his hands tied up with the t-shirt he was wearing. 1 fatality.

source: Amerique Info 7; Satellite 509; SG Alert (Whatsapp); Trip Foumi
notes: Around 19 May 2025 (between 18 - 20 May), in the Limbe commune, Nord, a 17-year-old young woman who had gone missing on 18 May was killed (methods unknown) and her body was found with the heart and kidneys extracted, on 20 May. The circumstances of the attack are unknown, although it seemed to be a case of organs extraction and trafficking, which became a more frequent practice in the country in the last decade. 1 fatality.
Other: On 19 May 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Debussy, Turgeau, and Bas Canape-Vert. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 19 May 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard on Romain Street, near Boulevard 15 Octobre. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 21 May 2025, in Petion Ville - Academie, Ouest, police forces dismantled a building used as a clandestine place for organ trafficking on the Freres Road, near the Police Academy. Several individuals were arrested, and medical equipment was seized.
Other: On 21 May 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard near the Police Academy. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Looting: Around 22 May 2025 (as reported), in Delmas - Cite Militaire, Ouest, gang members arrived at the neighborhood and occupied the houses of residents who fled the area. Casualties unknown.

On 23 May 2025, in Delmas - Maguana, Ouest, unidentified individuals kidnapped two people from a vehicle near a Baptist church at the intersection of Barbe de Marbois Street and the Delmas 31 Road. The driver managed to escape. There is no information on the abductors, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.
Other: On 23 May 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard along the RN2 near the Cazeau and Sarthe neighborhoods. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 25 May 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Cazeau neighborhood. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 27 May 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 75, Ouest, unidentified individuals set tires on fire in Delmas 75. The motivation for the roadblock was not reported.
Other: On 27 May 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Fort National neighborhood. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
On 28 May 2025, in Delmas - Musseau, Ouest, a group of people held a protest over unclarified claims in front of the Primature building.
On 28 May 2025, in Petion Ville - Pernier, Ouest, the police shot and killed a member of the Kraze Barye Gang during an armed clash in Pernier 17. 1 fatality.

Around 29 May 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Bois Patate, Ouest, police forces and armed members of the population (self-defense groups) engaged in clashes with the Viv Ansanm Gang in the Pont Morin area. Security forces managed to expel the criminals. Casualties unknown.

Around 30 May 2025 (as reported), in Delmas - Christ-Roi, Ouest, armed members of the population (self-defense groups) engaged in clashes with the Viv Ansanm Gang as these ones attacked the vicinity of the Sinai Church. Casualties unknown.

Around 30 May 2025 (as reported), in Delmas - Delmas 32, Ouest, armed members of the population (self-defense groups) engaged in clashes with the Viv Ansanm Gang as these ones attacked the Delmas 32 neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: Around 31 May 2025 (between 30 - 31 May), in Petion Ville - Pernier, Ouest, the police supported by armed members of the population (coded as self-defense groups) engaged in armed clashes with the 400 Mawozo Gang in Pernier. During the clashes, the gang members entered a house and killed six family members, including four young girls. 6 fatalities.

Other: On 31 May 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Vivy Mitchell neighborhood. There is no information on the authorship of the gunshots, although it is known that the police responded with heavy gunfire but it is unclear who they targeted. Casualties unknown.

source: PNH: National Police of Haiti; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 31 May 2025, in Tabarre - Torcelle, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members during anti-gang operations in Torcelle. Despite reinforcements among the gangs, several gangsters were hit, although it was not clarified if they were injured and/or killed. Casualties unknown.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Alterpresse; AP; Haiti Press Network; Haiti Progres; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network; UN (unspecified); Vi Free Press
notes: On 3 October 2024, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, in the early morning, dozens of members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang shot and killed at least 115 civilians (including at least 10 women and three babies), and injured 357 as they occupied the National Road 1 and set fire to residents' properties. At least five cases of rape were mentioned, including one involving a minor. Some of the fatal victims were identified as a voodoo priest, a school principal, and several vendors. At least 45 houses and 34 vehicles were burned in La Poterie area. The attack was a reprisal against the Coalition of Revolutionnaires to Save the Artibonite self-defense group for encouraging the local population to use agricultural roads to avoid toll booths installed by the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang on the National Road 1 (coded separately). The self-defense group tried to fight back by blocking the bridge into town, but the gang members invaded from the Artibonite River waters. The victims were described as unharmed civilians. More than 6,200 people fled their homes. An unspecified number went missing as they tried to flee. At least 115 fatalities, 357 injured.

Around 15 May 2025 (month of), off the Coast of Anse a Galets, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm gang hijacked a boat and abducted its occupants. The victims were freed after a 50,000 US dollar ransom was paid.

source: Alterpresse; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Vi Free Press
notes: On 24 February 2025, in Tabarre - Tabarre 27, Ouest, overnight, the Kraze Barye Gang attacked the positions of a self-defense group brigade in Tabarre 27 and 25, prompting clashes with the police, who intervened to expel them. During the offensive, the gangsters set fire to residents' houses. A local morgue held up to 15 bodies, although 22 fatal victims were counted in the end. At least four were identified (two men and a woman whose bodies were found on the streets, and a former high school head and executive of the Ministry of Education man killed and burned at his home). A military officer was shot and injured. One source attributed the attack to the 400 Mawozo Gang, although this was not confirmed by other media. 22 fatalities, 1 injured.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 25 March 2025, in Hatte Chevaux, Artibonite, members of the La Porte self-defense brigade killed six members of the family of a gang leader operating in the zone in reprisal for the killing of two residents in La Porte locality (coded separately). 6 fatalities.

source: Le Facteur Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 5 June 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, members of the Coalition of Revolutionaries to Save the Artibonite Gang and residents held a protest and set up barricades with tree branches, stones, and other materials along the National Road 1 (at the height of Te Nwa, Desoulye, and Kado neighborhoods) to demand the intervention of the authorities in the handling of increasing gang violence and dismantling of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang. Protesters, also using signs, voiced insults towards different government authorities and demanded the return of the former departmental police chief, whom they believe was more efficient at fighting gang violence. Barricades were also set up in Saint-Marc and Gros-Morne, Villard, and L'Estere (coded separately).

source: Amerique Info 7; Juno 7; Metropole; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 6 June 2025, in Bon Repos, Ouest, the Taliban Gang and the 400 Mawozo Gang engaged in clashes with the Chien Mechant Gang. Clashes erupted after the Chien Mechant Gang refused to remove a gate at a toll station that the 400 Mawozo Gang deemed no longer necessary. Both gangs were allies due to their affiliation to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition. Clashes were also registered in Lilavois, Santo, Croix des Missions, and Marassa (coded separately). Several members of both gangs were killed in Marassa (coded separately). Gunshots were heard throughout these areas, trapping residents inside their homes. Several people were injured. One source stated that the clashes erupted after two former members of the Chien Mechant Gang joined the ranks of the 400 Mawozo Gang. Several injured.

On 6 June 2025, in Marassa, Ouest, the Taliban Gang and the 400 Mawozo Gang engaged in clashes with the Chien Mechant Gang in Carrefour Marassa. A Chien Mechant gang leader and a gang member were killed. Two members of the 400 Mawozo Gang were also killed. The gang members looted and set fire to homes and businesses. Several people were injured, including a merchant. Clashes erupted as the Chien Mechant Gang refused to remove a gate at a toll station that the 400 Mawozo Gang deemed no longer necessary. Both gangs were allies under their affiliation to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition. Clashes were also registered in Lilavois, Bon Repos, Santo, and Croix des Missions (coded separately). Gunshots were heard throughout the areas. Some residents managed to flee, while several were trapped inside their homes. One source stated that the clashes erupted after two former members of the Chien Mechant Gang joined the ranks of the 400 Mawozo Gang. 4 fatalities, several injured.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 6 June 2025, in Santo, Ouest, the Taliban Gang and the 400 Mawozo Gang engaged in clashes with the Chien Mechant Gang in Lakou Bastien (Santo 25). During clashes, two men and a woman were killed by stray bullets while inside their home, and nine homes were set on fire. Several people were injured. Clashes erupted as the Chien Mechant Gang refused to remove a gate at a toll station that the 400 Mawozo gang deemed no longer necessary. Both gangs were allies due to affiliation to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition. Clashes were also registered in Lilavois, Croix des Missions, Bon Repos, and Marassa (coded separately). Several gang members were killed in Marassa (coded separately). Gunshots were heard throughout the areas. Hundreds of residents fled the area by crossing the Grise river toward Tabarre. Others were trapped inside their homes. One source stated that the clashes erupted after two former members of the Chien Mechant Gang joined the ranks of the 400 Mawozo Gang. 3 fatalities. Several injured.

On 6 June 2025, in Vivier, Ouest, the Taliban Gang and the 400 Mawozo Gang engaged in clashes with the Chien Mechant Gang in the Lilavois neighborhood. Several people were injured. Clashes erupted as the Chien Mechant Gang refused to remove a gate at a toll station that the 400 Mawozo Gang deemed no longer necessary. Both gangs were allies under their affiliation to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition. Clashes were also registered in Santo, Croix des Missions, Bon Repos, and Marassa (coded separately). Several gang members were killed in Marassa (coded separately). Gunshots were heard throughout the areas, trapping residents inside their homes. One source stated that the clashes erupted after two former members of the Chien Mechant Gang joined the ranks of the 400 Mawozo Gang. Several injured.

source: Haiti Press Network; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 5 June 2025, in Delmas - Kernizan, Ouest, former employees at the National Center of Equipment (CNE) held a demonstration in front of the Ministry of Public Works, Transport and Communications (MTPTC), along the Delmas 33 Road, to demand the payment of 10 months of unpaid wages. They set tires on fire. A mobilization on the same claims was held on 2 June (coded separately).

On 6 June 2025, in Tabarre - Croix des Missions, Ouest, the Taliban Gang and the 400 Mawozo Gang engaged in clashes with the Chien Mechant Gang. Several people were injured. Clashes erupted as the Chien Mechant Gang refused to remove a gate at a toll station that the 400 Mawozo Gang deemed no longer necessary. Both gangs were allies due to their affiliation to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition. Clashes were also registered in Lilavois, Santo, Bon Repos, and Marassa (coded separately). Several members from both gangs were killed in Marassa (coded separately). Gunshots were heard throughout the areas, trapping residents inside their homes. One source stated that the clashes erupted after two former members of the Chien Mechant Gang joined the ranks of the 400 Mawozo Gang. Several injured.

source: Alterpresse; GardaWorld; Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: Strikes: On 28 January 2024, in the arrondissement of Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the National Awakening for the Sovereignty of Haiti movement (led by Guy Philippe), together with the Anti-Corruption Union Brigade (BSAC), and the National Coordination of Haitian Workers (CNOHA), called on three days of nationwide general strike as of 29 January to demand that national authorities provide solutions to the security crisis in Haiti. As a consequence, school activities were suspended in several locations across Haiti as anti-government mobilizations continued on 29 January. The strike was suspended on 30 January due to the lack of support throughout the national territory (transport and commercial activities did not paralyze).

source: Jamaica Observer; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: On 20 March 2024, in Lascahobas, Centre, a mob of residents killed an arrested man and suspected member of the 400 Mawozo Gang. The mobsters grabbed him by force from a police vehicle. 1 fatality.

Around 29 July 2024 (as reported), in Camp Perrin, Sud, armed individuals killed a man and a woman (methods unspecified) and their bodies were found burned inside a vehicle on the National Road 7. One source described her as his daughter. Four people were arrested in connection with the attack. Motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.
On 7 August 2024, in Fer A Cheval, Centre, residents protested by blocking the bridge to demand its reparation.

On 21 November 2024, in Camp Perrin, Sud, police forces shot and killed a gang member who used to work as driver for the leader of a gang known as 'Bakop bosal' from Les Cayes . The killing was ordered by the Miragoane police commissioner, Ernst Muscadin. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Haiti (2024-) Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP)
notes: On 29 December 2024, in Lascahobas, Centre, BSAP agents on a patrol beat up a police officer in the head after ordering him to stop and accusing him of illegal firearms possession. The beaten police officer, who was a Polifront border agent, was taken to hospital for treatment. The incident sparked a reprisal attack by a mob of residents against the BSAP institution and clashes with police forces the day after (coded separately). 1 injured.

actor2: Police Forces of Haiti (2024-) Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP)
notes: On 30 December 2024, in Lascahobas, Centre, a mob of residents set fire to a vehicle belonging to the Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP) and painted the facade of the BSAP base at the Ministry of the Environment. BSAP agents who were within the Ministry fled to prevent being burnt. The incident led to clashes between BSAP agents and police officers (coded separately). This was part of a reprisal for the aggression of a police officer by BSAP agents the day prior (coded separately).

actor2: Police Forces of Haiti (2024-) Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP)
notes: On 30 December 2024, in Lascahobas, Centre, BSAP agents clashed with police officers next to the BSAP base at the Ministry of the Environment, resulting in at least two people shot and injured, one being a journalist man. Another source counted up to four casualties. Clashes took place moments after a mob of residents set fire to a BSAP vehicle in reprisal for the aggression of a police officer by BSAP agents the day prior (coded separately). At least 2 injured.

On 3 February 2025, in Lascahobas, Centre, in the morning, hundreds of residents held a protest demanding the restoration of power service in their community after four months of shortage. Protesters blocked the roadway with barricades of tree branches, tires, and pieces of vehicles.
On 4 February 2024, in Lascahobas, Centre, people blocked the Lascahobas road to demand electricity supply to the area.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 4 July 2025, in Villard, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang engaged in clashes with self-defense group members. Casualties unknown.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: Non-violent activity: On 4 July 2025, in Carrefour Paye, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang erected a wall on the National Road 1, next to the Pat-Chwal police station.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 21 June 2025, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang shot at residents, killing at least two civilians and injuring several others, including children, near the police station. Several civilians, including minors, were abducted. Their whereabouts are unknown. At least 2 fatalities, several injured.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 4 July 2025, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, members of the Gran Grif de Savien Gang assaulted a police station, prompting a police intervention to prevent it. Police forces clashed with the gang members and managed to expel them. Casualties unknown.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 4 July 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang engaged in clashes with self-defense group members. A self-defense group member was shot and injured to the neck. 1 injured.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 3 July 2025, in Chambrun, Centre, the 400 Mawozo Gang and the Taliban Gang (affiliated with the Viv Ansanm Gang) attacked the Chambrun village and other nearby areas from the Sarazin communal section (Mirebalais 2nd communal section) (coded separately). The gang members set several houses on fire, forcing scores of residents to flee, and clashed with police forces, who were supported by the Bakop Feray defense brigade and the Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP) police agents. During clashes, a dozen gang members and at least eight people were killed, including a police officer, whose body was then desecrated by the gang members (coded separately). Two BSAP agents, including one who was injured, were abducted by the gangsters. Their whereabouts are unknown. Several police vehicles were stolen. At least 20 fatalities split across three events. 6 coded here.

Around 30 June 2025 (as reported), around Fer a Cheval, Centre, police forces killed around 20 armed individuals who tried to cross a security perimeter set up by the officers along the National Road 3 at the height of Fer a Cheval. At least 20 fatalities.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 3 July 2025, in the Mirebalais commune, Centre, in the morning, the 400 Mawozo Gang and the Taliban Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang) attacked a police and BSAP agents patrol at the height of the Desvarieux residential area, killing a police officer and injuring a BSAP agent. The criminals also attacked the nearby Savane Lacoupe area, among others from the Sarazin communal section (Mirebalais 2nd communal section). They set several houses on fire, forcing scores of residents to flee, and clashed with police forces, who were supported by the Bakop Feray self-defence brigade and Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP) police agents. During clashes, a dozen gang members and at least eight people were killed, including the mentioned police officer, whose body was then desecrated by the gang members (coded separately). Two BSAP agents, including the one who was injured, were abducted by the gangsters. Their whereabouts are unknown. Several police vehicles were stolen. At least 20 fatalities split across three events. 7 coded here.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 3 July 2025, in Sarazin, Centre, the 400 Mawozo Gang and the Taliban Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang) attacked the Sarazin locality and other nearby areas from the Sarazin communal section (coded separately). The gang members set several houses on fire, forcing scores of residents to flee, and clashed with police forces, who were supported by the Bakop Feray self-defence brigade and the Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP) police agents. During clashes, a dozen gang members and at least eight people were killed, including a police officer, whose body was then desecrated by the gang members (coded separately). Two BSAP agents, including one who was injured, were abducted by the gangsters. Their whereabouts are unknown. Several police vehicles were stolen. At least 20 fatalities split across three events. 7 coded here.

On 20 June 2025, in Quartier Morin, Nord, residents held a protest and blocked the National Road 6 at the height of Carrefour Lamort to decry the demolition of the fence of a public slot meant for a high school, claiming misuse of a court order.

On 2 July 2025, near Ferrier, Nord-Est, residents held a protest and blocked the National Road 6 at the height of Morne Casse with barricades (unspecified materials) to decry a sale made by local authorities of a section of public land to a private owner. The land has been used by residents to access the main road. Police forces intervened and used tear gas to disperse the crowd.

On 2 July 2025, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, citizens held a protest and shut the doors of the Mayor's office (methods unspecified) to decry local authorities' mismanagement of the city, and to demand the resignation of three members of the city council. Protesters wrote messages on the walls of the office, decrying the local authorities as thieves and criticizing the misuse of collected taxes.

On 24 June 2025, in Ile de La Gonave, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang killed a businessman from the wholesale fish trade, before forcing witnesses to clean up his blood on the ground. The gang members left the scene with the victim's body. 1 fatality.

On 28 June 2025, in Ile de La Gonave, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang killed a man who was attempting to travel to Saint-Marc to cash a check. His body was thrown into the sea. The victim was health worker from the Ministry of the Public Security and the Population. 1 fatality.

On 21 June 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Debussy/Haut-Turgeau, Ouest, overnight, a group of police officers (described as acting as a vigilance brigade) shot and killed another police officer during an altercation of unclarified nature in the Debussy neighborhood. The victim's body disappeared after the attack and the whereabouts of the corpse are still unknown despite his police colleagues' efforts to find it. During the search of the body, police officers set fire to homes in the area. 1 fatality.

On 5 June 2025, in Villard, Artibonite, residents held a protest along the National Road 1 to demand the intervention of the authorities in the handling of increasing gang violence and dismantling of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang. Protests on the same claims were held in Pont Sonde and L'Estere (coded separately).

On 5 June 2025, in L'Estere, Artibonite, residents held a protest along the National Road 1 to demand the intervention of the authorities in the handling of increasing gang violence and dismantling of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang. Protests on the same claims were held in Pont Sonde and Villard (coded separately).

actor1: Police Forces of Haiti (2024-) Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP)
source: Amerique Info 7; PSOPK: Pou Si Ou Pas Tkonnen; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 4 June 2025, outside Mirebalais, Centre, BSAP police agents, supported by self-defense group members, clashed with gang members in the Divye locality (on the road between Mirebalais and Lascahobas) as the criminals tried to take control of the area. Several gang members were killed. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 9 June 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, in the morning, unidentified individuals kidnapped an unknown number of people between Delmas 19 and Delmas 33 neighborhoods. Their whereabouts are unknown.
On 9 June 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, in the morning, unidentified armed individuals engaged in an exchange of fire between Delmas 19 and Delmas 33 neighborhoods. Casualties unknown.

On 6 June 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, unidentified individuals shot and injured a person during a kidnapping attempt in Delmas 19. The gunshots were heard since Delmas 31 Road. Police forces attended the location. 1 injured.
On 9 June 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, gang members shot and killed a person in Delmas 19 (around Delmas 19/Mackandal). The gangsters fired shots in the area. 1 fatality.

source: RTM: Radio Television Monopole; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 7 June 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 65, Ouest, a police inspector together with several accomplices shot and killed a man and injured her wife at their home, on Faustin 1er street (Delmas 65). The perpetrators took the victim's body away and then delivered a letter to the wife for her to claim her husband's corpse. The motivation for the attack is unknow. 1 fatality, 1 injured.
On 5 June 2025, in Petion Ville - Centre Ville (Ouest), Ouest, a group of people held a small protest over unclarified claims in the vicinity of the National Old Age Insurance Office (ONA).
Property destruction: Around 2 June 2025 (as reported), in Petion Ville - Vivy Mitchell, Ouest, the Taliban Gang and the 400 Mawozo Gang set fire to several houses in the neighborhood.

Other: On 8 June 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard on Cameau street and Magloire Ambroise Avenue (Bas Peu de Choses). There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

On 1 June 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Musseau-Delmas 48, Ouest, a group of people held a protest over unclarified claims along the Delmas 60 Road towards the Primature building (in Musseau-Delmas 48 neighborhood).
On 9 June 2025, in Marceline, Sud, a group of workers held a protest and blocked the National Road 7 demanding the payment of their salaries.

source: Aid Worker Security Database; Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network; Trip Foumi
notes: On 1 April 2025, in Mirebalais, Centre, for a second consecutive day, gang members attacked the commune and took control of the Mirebalais High School. The criminals fired shots in the direction of residents, killing several people who tried to flee the Mirebalais Hospital, including a security guard. An International Non-Governmental Organization aid worker also died after being injured during an ambush carried out by the gangsters. The criminals were identified as affiliates of the Canaan Gang and the 400 Mawozo Gang. This was part of an offensive orchestrated by the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition in reprisal for the resistance of the Trianon self-defense group to gang presence in the area over the weekend (coded separately). Between 31 March and 3 April, at least 30 people were killed and more than 6,000 were displaced as a result of gang attacks in Mirebalais and Saut-d'Eau communes (30 fatalities split across seven events). Between 31 March and 8 April, 19 civilians were killed in Mirebalais village (19 fatalities split across four events). 2 fatalities coded here.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Press Network; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Trip Foumi
notes: Agreement: Around 28 May 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the Haitian government entered into a confidential agreement with Erik Prince, founder of the private security firm Blackwater, to support efforts against gang violence. According to reports, their armed drones have been operating in Haiti since March 2025. The firm has also been delivering weapons and may deploy up to 150 personnel in the coming months to assist local forces. The details of the contract remain undisclosed, and no major arrests or outcomes have been officially confirmed. On 20 June, the President of the Transitional Presidential Council (CPT) denied the existence of an agreement with Blackwater, although he confirmed the government had entered an agreement with another private security firm but still withheld the details of the contract. On 16 August, it was confirmed that the government entered a 10-year agreement with the firm which plans to deploy several hundreds of men as well as technological support to the country. They are also planning to restore the national tax payment system once security is reestablished.

source: Haiti Info Project (HIP); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Realite Info; SG Alert (Whatsapp); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 24 May 2025, in Petion Ville - Pernier, Ouest, police forces clashed with members of the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) as they raided the house of the gang's leader. Several gang members were killed. Weapons and firearms were seized. Clashes took place as the police continued with an anti-gang operation in Pernier that had involved clashes with the Kraze Barye Gang since 22 May (coded separately). Several sources reported that the Kraze Barye Gang leader was injured during a police intervention around this day. He got a leg broken as he tried escape. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: PNH: National Police of Haiti; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 29 May 2025, in Tabarre - Torcelle, Ouest, in the morning, police forces clashed with members of the Kraze Barye Gang during a security operation in Torcelle, killing several of them. A police officer was injured. The police also seized weapons and other materials. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Juno 7; Le Facteur Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Rezo Nodwes; SG Alert (Whatsapp); Trip Foumi
notes: On 17 June 2025, in Mirebalais, Centre, the police clashed with members of the Taliban Gang and the 400 Mawozo Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) during an anti-gang operation in Mirebalais, killing six of them. Weapons and other materials were also seized. In reprisal, members of the mentioned gangs threw a Molotov cocktail at a police armored vehicle in Carrefour Peligre, burning it. 6 fatalities.

source: Gazette Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Rezo Nodwes; Trip Foumi
notes: On 19 June 2025, in Les Cayes, Sud, armed men shot and killed a lawyer man and former president of the Chamber of Commerce near his residence, in the Dexia area. He died in hospital. The motivation for the attack is unknown, although authorities suspect that it was premeditated. The victim's brother was killed in similar circumstances on 2 April (coded separately). On 20 June, the police arrested three individuals, including a police officer, in connection to the killing. 1 fatality.

On 28 June 2025, off the Coast of Anse a Galets, La Gonave, unidentified armed gang members attacked a boat that was traveling between Arcahaie and La Gonave Island. The gang members stole the boat's cargo and abducted the crew. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Gazette Haiti; Le Filet Info; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 8 July 2025, off the Coast of Leogane, Ouest, members of the 103 Zombies Gang in a boat opened fire on several small boats at the height of Leogane as they were traveling between the coast of Port-au-Prince and the Caymite islands (Grande Anse). The so-called 'Benediction' boat was carrying female traders (Madan Sara) and their merchandise. A man, a woman, and a boy were shot and killed. 13 people were injured (three men and 10 women), while several others went missing after jumping off the boats to avoid being shot. 3 fatalities, 13 injured.

Looting: Around 25 June 2025 (weekend of), off the Coast of Anse a Galets, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang hijacked the boat of a carrier man operating between Wharf Jeremie and Anse a Galets. The gang members demanded a 1 million gourdes ransom for the return of boat. The criminals returned it on 3 July after several unspecified ransoms had been paid by the owner.

On 11 June 2025, in Delmas - Kernizan, Ouest, employees at the National Center of Equipments (CNE) held a demonstration demanding the payment of unpaid salaries since the CNE was dissolved in 2024. Demonstrators set tires on fire and vandalized the offices of the Ministry of Public Works, Transport and Communications (MTPTC), in the vicinity of the Delmas 33 Road. The incident caused important damage to the institution's offices, especially to the main gate.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Juno 7; Le Facteur Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 17 June 2025, in Peligre, Centre, for a second consecutive day, several dozens of residents held a demonstration at the Peligre hydroelectric central to demand an intervention by the authorities in the handling of increasing gang violence in the area. Demonstrating residents forced employees to shut the central down, causing widespread blackouts in the capital. They caused material damages and soldered the central's gate to block the entrance. Powe lines were vandalized in the Domond neighborhood. At least 10 electricity pylons were destroyed between 17 and 18 June (coded separately).

actor2: Police Forces of Haiti (2024-) Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP)
notes: On 4 May 2025, in Saint-Raphael, Nord, supporters of the Platfom Pitit Desalin Party (PPD) joined a political rally organized by the PPD party leader and former senator at the Saint-Raphael's public square. During the mobilization, BSAP agents shot and injured several people as they opened fire on the crowd. No further details were mentioned. Several injured.

source: Amerique Info 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 11 July 2025, in Kenscoff - Obleon, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition launched an attack in the Obleon neighborhood. Several teenagers were killed (methods unclarified). Members of the gang also broke into a private house, and looted it before taking up residence at the property. Several people who were inside managed to escape while two individuals were held hostage. Their identity and their whereabouts are unknown. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 5 July 2025, in the Kenscoff commune, Ouest, overnight, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked a police convoy as the officers conducted a security operation in the Viard area. During clashes, one police officer was shot and killed and several others injured. Several gang members were killed. The gang members set a police vehicle on fire and shared footage on social media. At least 1 fatality, several injured.

On 8 July 2025, in Petion Ville - Pernier, Ouest, police forces shot and killed several members of the Kraze Barye Gang as they conducted an operation in the Pernier and Torcelle (coded separately) neighborhoods. Six weapons were seized. 10 gang members were arrested. Police forces claimed to have regained control of several areas previously under the gang's control. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 8 July 2025, in Tabarre - Torcelle, Ouest, police forces shot and killed several members of the Kraze Barye Gang as they conducted an operation in the Torcelle and Pernier (coded separately) neighborhoods. Six weapons were seized. 10 gang members were arrested. Police forces claimed they had regained control of several areas previously under the gang's control. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 4 July 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Avenue Christophe, Ouest, police forces engaged in armed clashes with armed group members along the Avenue Christophe and near the Oloffson hotel. Several gang members were killed during clashes. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 8 July 2025, in Carrefour Paye, Artibonite, the Savien Gang assaulted drivers along the National Road 1. No further details on the nature of the attack were mentioned. Casualties unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti)
notes: Property destruction: On 5 July 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Saint Gerard, Ouest, in the evening, members of the Grand-Ravine Gang and the Base 5 Secondes Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) set fire to the Oloffson Hotel, a renowned cultural symbol of Port-au-Prince. The building was entirely destroyed.

actor2: Police Forces of Haiti (2024-) Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP)
notes: On 4 July 2025, in Gonaives, Artibonite, police forces opened fire on members of the Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP) agents at the BSAP headquarters, located in the Biennac 22 area. Heavy gunfire was heard. One BSAP agent was seriously injured and brought to hospital. Two BSAP agents were arrested by police forces, but released later that day after a leader from civil society intervened. The motivation for the police intervention was not clarified, although it happened after an altercation between BSAP agents and the police at the Gonaives police station. 1 injured.

On 3 July 2025, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, thousands of residents took to the streets to demand the resignation of the chief commissioner of the Saint-Marc arrondissement, and to protest against his decision to remove armored vehicles from the police and troops from the Multinational Security Support Mission. Protesters gathered in front of the police station, carrying tree branches and decrying corruption and lack of efforts to improve the security situation.

On 11 July 2025, in Kenscoff - Furcy, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition broke into the house of a well-known businessman and abducted his guard's three children. A minor in the household was killed in unspecified circumstances. The whereabouts of the three other children are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 11 June 2025, in Kenscoff - Godet, Ouest, in the morning, armed gang members attacked the neighborhood. No details were mentioned on the nature of the attack. Casualties unknown.

Looting: On 13 June 2025, in Mirebalais, Centre, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang looted and vandalized the building of the Mirebalais University Hospital (HUM), which had been under gang control since April 2025. The criminals stole materials and equipment.

On 18 June 2025, in Peligre, Centre, for a third consecutive day, residents held a demonstration at the Peligre hydroelectric central to demand an intervention by the authorities in the handling of increasing gang violence in the area. Demonstrating residents caused material damages as they vandalized power lines. At least 10 electricity pylons were destroyed between 17 and 18 June (coded separately).

actor1: MSS: Multinational Security Support Mission in Haiti (2023-2025)
actor2: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: Around 15 April 2025 (month of), near Descordes, Artibonite, Kenyan agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MSS) engaged in clashes with the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang in the Segur hamlet. During clashes, a gang member was accidentally shot and injured by another gangster. He died on 28 June due to his injuries. 1 fatality.

On 11 June 2025, in Petion Ville - Freres, Ouest, the police clashed with armed individuals in the Impasse Gracien area and the Torcelle neighborhood (coded separately). At least an armed individual was shot and killed during the clash. At least 1 fatality split across two location. 0 coded here.

On 11 June 2025, in Tabarre - Torcelle, Ouest, the police clashed with armed individuals in Torcelle and the Impasse Gracien area (coded separately). At least an armed individual was shot and killed during the clash. At least 1 fatality split across two location. 1 coded here.

Non-violent activity: On 11 June 2025, in Mirebalais, Centre, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang set up roadblocks at access points to the Mirebalais village to prevent police forces from entering the area. The roadblocks were set up after they noticed police vehicles at place.

Other: On 15 June 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard between the Marche Telele market (Jacquet Toto neighborhood) and the Delmas 95 Road (Charles-Oscar / Bas-Cimetiere neighborhood). There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 16 February 2024, between La Chapelle, Artibonite, and Mirebalais, Centre, the Route Departementale 11 was blocked. There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblock or who set it up.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Trip Foumi
notes: On 22 June 2025, in La Chapelle, Artibonite, overnight, the police clashed with members of the Taliban Gang, affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang Coalition, while they carried out an attack against residents in the commune. After clashes with the officers, the gangsters set fire and destroyed the police station. They also set fire to several houses and businesses. Gunshots were heard throughout the area. More than 10 residents were injured, while six of them were killed. Residents who tried to escape the area were still fleeing by dozens the morning after, totaling nearly 9000 displaced. The police retreated as they were not enough in numbers to repel the gangsters, who set up barricades in strategic areas to block police intervention (coded separately). 6 fatalities, at least 10 injured.

Non-violent activity: On 22 June 2025, in La Chapelle, Artibonite, overnight, the Taliban Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang Coalition) erected barricades across strategic areas of the commune to prevent police forces from accesing these areas and carrying out anti-gang operations. The roadblocks were set up after clashes with the police in the commune (coded separately).

source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Passion Info Plus; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 5 July 2025, near Desarmes, Artibonite, police forces clashed with gang members during a security operation in the Charrier locality. A police officer was shot and killed during the clashes. 1 fatality.

On 10 July 2025, around Boucan Philippe, Grande-Anse, members of the population lynched two gang members in the South of the Cayemite Island. The victims had attacked several boats traveling to the Cayemite islands two days before (coded separately). The two gang members had been arrested by the police before they were taken from custody by the mob of residents. 2 fatalities.

On 29 June 2025, in Martina, Artibonite, police forces supported by the Chandelle Communal Militia (self-defense group) engaged in clashes with the Taliban Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) as members of the gang attacked the village. Casualties unknown.

source: Amerique Info 7; Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: Around 17 July 2025 (between 16 - 17 July), in Dessalines, Artibonite, overnight, members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang set fire to the Marchand Dessalines police station as they attacked the commune, firing shots as they drove into the area. The gang members clashed with four police officers at the police station, injuring one police officer. The criminals stole police equipment, including bulletproof vests, before setting it on fire and destroying the building. Two police officers were kidnapped. Their whereabouts are unknown. They also robbed several businesses in the commune and stole several motorbikes, and burned a police vehicle in front of the station. The gang members left the commune following the attack after several hours. 1 injured.
On 17 July 2025, in Liancourt, Artibonite, gang members from Savien engaged in armed clashes in the commune. Casualties unknown.

source: Gazette Haiti; International Crisis Group; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti)
notes: Non-violent activity: On 16 July 2025, in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, the leaders of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition, the 400 Mawozo Gang, the Canaan Gang, and members of an elite unit from the Ti Bwa Gang (known as Backup 100 Plak) were seen in the Mont-Carmel area distributing notes among beggars. The Mont-Carmel is a well-known place of pilgrimage for Catholic parishioners. The gang leaders' presence was noticed on the occasion of the Our Lady of Mont-Carmel celebration. The place did not host pilgrims due to the presence of gang members.

On 11 July 2025, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, overnight, police forces shot and killed three suspected gang members after the now deceased refused to stop their tricycle for a police control in the Bel-Air area. The armed individuals opened fire on the police patrol, leading to a clash as the officers chased them up to the Carrefour ODN area. Moments later, two other suspected gang members were killed during a clash with the police. 5 fatalities.

source: AP; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vi Free Press
notes: On 13 July 2025, off the Coast of La Tortue, Nord-Ouest, police forces clashed with drug traffickers on board two boats. Police forces first approached the boats and ordered the traffickers to comply, but they refused and opened fire on the officers. Police forces opened fire in return, shooting and killing two Jamaican nationals, while a third Jamaican national was injured and later died of his injuries. One Bahamian national was injured and arrested, alongside another person. One of the boats was able to escape during the clash. Police forces seized the remaining boat which contained 1,045 kg of cocaine. This was the largest amount of cocaine ever seized by police forces in Haiti. It is suspected that the drugs were intended to be trafficked to the Dominican Republic. 3 fatalities, several injured.

On 13 July 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, internally displaced residents from the Carrefour-Feuilles, Delmas 30, and Solino neighborhoods held a protest against insecurity and to decry the uninhabitable living conditions in their displaced people camps. Protesting residents called on authorities to intervene to improve security conditions, to allow them their safe return to their neighborhoods.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 11 July 2025, in Kenscoff - Furcy, Ouest, overnight, members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang) engaged in clashes with the police as they attacked the Furcy sub-police station and nearby police facilities in the Ka-Blain area (coded separately). Police forces were forced to flee the Furcy sub-police station as gang members set the building on fire and demolished it. During clashes, that lasted for five hours, two police officers were injured. A police car was set on fire. Families fled their homes due to the violence, and several civilian cars were set on fire by the gang members. 2 injured.

On 13 July 2025, in Kenscoff - Furcy, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang clashed with police forces as they led an armed incursion into the Furcy neighborhood. Police forces were able to repel the gang. One source stated that security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) used drones during clashes with gang members in the commune on that day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 15 July 2025, in Petion Ville - Academie, Ouest, overnight, members of the Kraze Barye Gang clashed with police forces near the Police Academy. Heavy gunfire was heard in the Academie, Meyotte and, Kay Colette neighborhoods (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 17 July 2025, in Petion Ville - Belvil, Ouest, armed gang members (likely from the Viv Ansanm Gang) attacked residents in the Belvil and Vivy Mitchell (coded separately) neighborhoods. Members of the mentioned gang also attacked and kidnapped civilians in the Freres neighborhood on that day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 17 July 2025, in Petion Ville - Freres, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents along the Impasse Gracien and the Freres Road (Northern border of the Freres neighborhood, near the Police Academy). Several people were shot, including children. The gang members set houses on fire and kidnapped several residents on Impasse Gracien. Gunshots were heard and residents were forced to flee. A woman injured herself as she attempted to run away from the violence. The identity and the whereabouts of the abducted victims are unknown. One source stated that the gang attack was linked to tensions between the police and the Kraze Barye Gang and their allies from the 400 Mawozo Gang and the Canaan Gang. Several injured.

On 15 July 2025, in Petion Ville - Kay Colette, Ouest, overnight, members of the Kraze Barye Gang clashed with police forces. Heavy gunfire was heard in the Kay Colette, Academie, and Meyotte neighborhoods (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 11 July 2025, in Petion Ville - Laboule, Ouest, overnight, members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang) engaged in clashes with the police as they attacked police facilities in the Ka-Blain area (located along the Kenscoff Road, in Laboule neighborhood) and the Furcy sub-police station (coded separately). Police officers fled the Ka-Blain facilities, although it is not known if they were destroyed. Families fled their homes due to the violence, and several civilian cars were set on fire by the gang members. There were no fatalities.

On 15 July 2025, in Petion Ville - Meyotte, Ouest, overnight, members of the Kraze Barye Gang clashed with police forces. Heavy gunfire was heard in the Meyotte, Academie, and Kay Colette neighborhoods. Casualties unknown.

On 17 July 2025, in Petion Ville - Pernier, Ouest, overnight, armed group members (likely from the Viv Ansanm Gang) launched an attack on the Pernier and Torcelle (coded separately) neighborhoods. Members of this gang had attacked several other nearby areas on that day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 17 July 2025, in Petion Ville - Vivy Mitchell, Ouest, armed gang members (likely from the Viv Ansanm Gang) attacked residents in the Vivy Mitchell and Belvil (coded separately) neighborhoods. Members of the mentioned gang also attacked and kidnapped civilians in the Freres neighborhood on that day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

Other: On 17 July 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Metivier, Doco, Morette, Duval, Gros Jean, and Corvette neighborhoods. There is no information on the authorship of the gunshots, although they were likely linked to armed attacks by the Viv Ansanm Gang against several neighborhoods of Petionville on that day (coded separately).

Other: Around 13 July 2025 (week of), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, barricades were erected near the Primature building (Musseau-Delmas 48 neighborhood) and near the National Palace (Champs de Mars neighborhood). The roadblocks were set up while the Prime Minister was out of the country during a diplomatic visit to the United States. The circumstances and the authorship of the roadblocks are unknown.

Other: On 17 July 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Chateau Blond neighborhood. There is no information on the authorship of the gunshots, although they were likely linked to armed attacks by the Viv Ansanm Gang against several nearby neighborhoods of Petionville on that day (coded separately).

On 17 July 2025, in Tabarre - Aeroport Toussaint Louverture, Ouest, several dozens of citizens held a protest in front of the airport against the national government. The mobilization was held as the Haitian Prime Minister was returning from a diplomatic visit abroad. Protesters chanted anti-government slogans. Simultaneously large crowd also gathered in front of the airport to celebrate the Prime Minister's return.

On 17 July 2025, in Tabarre - Torcelle, Ouest, overnight, armed group members (likely from the Viv Ansanm Gang) launched an attack on the Torcelle and Pernier (coded separately) neighborhoods. Members of this gang had attacked several other nearby areas on that day (coded separately). Scores of people fled, heading towards the Police Academy. Casualties unknown.

On 16 June 2025, in Malfety, Nord-Est, residents held a protest over unclarified demands and blocked the National Road 6 at the height of the Malfety village. Police forces was deployed to the area, although no intervention on their side was mentioned.
Looting: Around 16 June 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang looted houses and properties in the neighborhood. The scene was recorded on video.

On 19 June 2025, in Delmas - Carrefour Aeroport/Delmas 13, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals engaged in clashes near the Airport Road. The gunshots were heard from Delmas 33 and Bourdon neighborhoods. Casualties unknown.
Looting: On 19 June 2025, in Delmas - Carrefour Drouillard/Parc Industriel, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang looted the Berman Motors car dealership business.

On 19 June 2025, in Delmas - Pele Simon, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members (likely from the Simon-Pele Gang) and fired tear gas against them. Gang members from La Saline (likely from the Base Project La Saline Gang) arrived to support the criminals, although it was not clarified if they clashed with the police. Casualties unknown.
Other: On 19 June 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Montagne Noire neighborhood. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

On 20 June 2025, in Carrefour, Ouest, thousands of citizens, led by Ti Bwa Gang leader, held a protest against the rising insecurity, as well as against arbitrary executions of Carrefour residents by the police when they are found in other areas of the capital.

On 22 June 2025, in Petion Ville - Academie, Ouest, in the early morning, unidentified armed individuals engaged in clashes along the Freres Road. The gunshots were heard at the height of the Police Academie. Casualties unknown.
On 24 June 2025, in Marassa, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals engaged in clashes in Marassa and the Pont Marassa Fleuriot (a.k.a. Pont Tabarre). Casualties unknown.

On 25 June 2025, in Desarmes, Artibonite, police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang as members of this gang attacked the village. Some residents fled their homes. Unconfirmed versions stated that the clashes were between police forces and armed individuals defending the local population. Casualties unknown.

On 26 June 2025, in Petit-Goave, Ouest, a group of people held a protest demanding the repair of La Digue bridge. Protesters blocked the National Road 2 at the height of the mentioned bridge. They parked trucks along the roadway.

Other: On 27 June 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, a roadblock were set up along the Delmas 48 Road (Delmas 48 neighborhood). There is no information on who set them up, although it is known that it consisted of parked vehicles placed across the roadway. The roadblock was not ruled out to be linked to a call for protests by the leader of the Canape-Vert self-defense group.

Property destruction: On 27 June 2025, in Petion Ville - Thomassin, Ouest, a group of around 15 armed individuals, some of them hooded, occupied the facilities of the Maison L'Arc en Ciel NGO, located in the Thomassin 32 area, and destroyed a part of the building. The mentioned NGO provides aid to children affected by HIV/AIDS in Haiti.

Other: On 27 June 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, roadblocks were set up in the Juvenat, Pelerin, and Petion Ville - Centre Ville (Nord) neighborhoods. There is no information on who set them up, although it is known that several consisted of burning tires, vehicles, and containers placed across the roadway. The roadblocks were not ruled out to be linked to a call for protests by the leader of the Canape-Vert self-defense group. Gunshots were heard in Canape-Vert.

Other: On 27 June 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, roadblocks were set up in the Bois Patate, Canape-Vert, Debrosse, and Bourdon neighborhoods. There is no information on who set them up, although it is known that several consisted of burning tires and metal fences placed across the roadway. The roadblocks were not ruled out to be linked to a call for protests by the leader of the Canape-Vert self-defense group. Gunshots were heard in Canape-Vert

Other: On 28 June 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, roadblocks were set up along the Pinchinat and Clerveau streets, as well as in St Pierre square (Petion Ville - Sud), in Stenio Vincent (Jalousie neighborhood) and Morne Calvaire neighborhoods, were trucks were parked to block access. There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblocks or who set them up.
Other: On 29 June 2025, in Kenscoff, Ouest, gang members installed themselves in the Grenier zone. Gunshots were heard from time to time in the area.

Other: On 1 July 2025, in Kenscoff, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the heights of the commune, including in Belot and Thomassin 38 (Fermathe). There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Property destruction: On 1 July 2025, in Kenscoff - Fermathe, Ouest, unidentified individuals set fire to houses in Thomassin 37 (Fermathe neighborhood).
Other: On 2 July 2025, in Kenscoff, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Godet, Belo, and Fermathe neighborhoods. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Looting: On 5 July 2025, in Delmas - Maguana, Ouest, gang members stole a vehicle and tried to perpetrate a kidnapping along the Delmas 31 Road and the Magua street. The kidnapping attempt failed.

On 6 July 2025, in Kenscoff - Corail, Ouest, residents held a protest in front of the Kenscoff police station rejecting the attacks by gang members in the commune the night prior and clashed with police forces (coded separately).

On 6 July 2025, in Kenscoff - Fermathe, Ouest, in the early morning, police forces and agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission engaged in clashes with gang members in the Fermathe and Thomassin neighborhoods (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 6 July 2025, in Petion Ville - Thomassin, Ouest, in the early morning, police forces and agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission engaged in clashes with gang members in the Thomassin and Fermathe neighborhoods (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
Looting: On 7 July 2025, in Cite Soleil - Sarthe, Ouest, gang members coming from Carrefour Vincent hijacked a trailer vehicle carrying goods along the Hubert Street.

On 7 July 2025, in Delmas - Kernizan, Ouest, unidentified individuals who arrived in a car kidnapped an unknown number of people travelling in a private car along the Delmas 33 Road, in Kernizan area. Their whereabouts are unknown. There is no information on the perpetrators and circumstances of the abduction, but the latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related.

On 9 July 2025, in the Kenscoff commune, Ouest, in the early morning, police forces engaged in clashes with unidentified armed men in the Viard area. Clashes lasted for several hours, until security forces managed to expel the armed men. Casualties unknown.

Other: On 10 July 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, a roadblock of burning tires was set up along the Delmas 33 Road, near the Ministry of Public Works. There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblock or who set it up.

Other: On 10 July 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Laboule 12 (Desire/Boutilliers), Nazon, and Christ-Roi neighborhoods. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

source: Alterpresse; Radio Tele Galaxie; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 23 July 2025, in Santo, Ouest, overnight, members of the 400 Mawozo Gang clashed with the Chien Mechant Gang, as the 400 Mawozo Gang attempted to take over the Marassa crossroads toll booth. Heavy gunfire was heard in the area. Casualties unknown.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Gazette Haiti; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); ReliefWeb; Rezo Nodwes; Trip Foumi; Vi Free Press
notes: On 22 July 2025, in Liancourt, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang shot and killed three police officers, a police informant, and several members of the population as they ambushed a police armored vehicle and opened fire on it before setting fire to the vehicle. The driver managed to escape and another police officer went missing. According to witnesses, several gang members were killed during the clash. The bodies of the killed police officers were exhibited by the gangsters at a crossroad toward Savien. The gangsters also posted a video showing the incident. The gangsters also set fire to at least 10 houses and one vehicle. At least 7 fatalities.

source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Haiti Press Network; Haitian Times; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Trip Foumi
notes: On 19 July 2025, around Lacroix-Perisse, Artibonite, in the early morning, the Kokorat San Ras Gang clashed with the police and members of a self-defense group (likely the Kapenye self-defense) moments after invading and attacking residents in the Kapenyen locality (L'Estere commune). During clashes, the leader of the gang, 10 gang members, and at least seven civilians were confirmed killed. Around 10 people were also injured. Some other gangsters were lynched to death by civilians later that day (coded separately). One source stated that the self-defense group members were affiliated to the Jean-Denis Gang (a.k.a. Coalition des Revolutionnaires pour Sauver l'Artibonite or Jean Denis Coalition), although this was not confirmed by additional media. Gunshots were heard in nearby areas before the attack. At least 18 fatalities. At least 10 injured.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 24 July 2025, in Kenscoff - Belo, Ouest, police and military forces, supported by the Multinational Security Support Mission, and self-defense groups, engaged in clashes with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they conducted anti-gang operations in the Belo, Godet, Furcy, Bois d'Avril, and Carrefour bete neighborhoods (coded separately). During clashes, several gang members were killed and several others were injured. Security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) used drones to fight the gangsters. The police also used a helicopter. The gangsters tried to shoot it down, unsuccessfully. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 24 July 2025, in Kenscoff - Bois d'Avril, Ouest, police and military forces, supported by the Multinational Security Support Mission, and self-defense groups, engaged in clashes with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they conducted anti-gang operations in the Bois d'Avril, Godet, Furcy, Belo, and Carrefour bete neighborhoods (coded separately). During clashes, several gang members were killed and several others were injured. Security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) used drones to fight the gangsters. The police also used a helicopter. The gangsters tried to shoot it down, unsuccessfully. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 24 July 2025, in Kenscoff - Carrefour bete, Ouest, police and military forces, supported by the Multinational Security Support Mission, and self-defense groups, engaged in clashes with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they conducted anti-gang operations in the Carrefour bete, Bois d'Avril, Godet, Furcy, and Belo neighborhoods (coded separately). During clashes, several gang members were killed and several others were injured. Security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) used drones to fight the gangsters. The police also used a helicopter. The gangsters tried to shoot it down, unsuccessfully. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 24 July 2025, in Kenscoff - Furcy, Ouest, police and military forces, supported by the Multinational Security Support Mission, and self-defense groups, engaged in clashes with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they conducted anti-gang operations in the Furcy, Carrefour bete, Bois d'Avril, Godet, and Belo neighborhoods (coded separately). During clashes, several gang members were killed and several others were injured. Security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) used drones to fight the gangsters. The police also used a helicopter. The gangsters tried to shoot it down, unsuccessfully. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 24 July 2025, in Kenscoff - Godet, Ouest, police and military forces, supported by the Multinational Security Support Mission, and self-defense groups, engaged in clashes with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they conducted anti-gang operations in Kavri (Godet), Furcy, Carrefour bete, Bois d'Avril, and Belo neighborhoods (coded separately). During clashes, several gang members were killed and several others were injured. Security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) used drones to fight the gangsters. The police also used a helicopter. The gangsters tried to shoot it down, unsuccessfully. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

Around 16 July 2025 (as reported), in Liancourt, Artibonite, Kokorat San Ras gang members clashed with self-defense groups as they attacked residential areas within the commune. They destroyed homes and killed and injured several civilians. Nearly 15,000 residents fled the Verrettes and Dessalines communes due to gang violence. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: On 25 July 2025, in Kenscoff - Obleon, Ouest, in the morning, the Viv Ansanm Gang ambushed a police patrol at the former Teleco company headquarters (a.k.a. Teleco base, where Teleco antenna is located, in Morne Tranchant area), killing one officer and injuring another one. The injured officer went missing. As the criminals attacked the police patrol, a clash erupted with the gang members, resulting in the killing of several gangsters. At least 4 fatalities, 1 injured.

On 16 July 2025, in Petion Ville - Meyotte, Ouest, a journalist and collaborator from Le Nouvelliste was shot and injured by a stray bullet at his home. There is no information on the circumstances and the target of the attack, although it was not ruled out to be linked to armed clashes between gangs and the police in the area. Clashes between the Kraze Barye Gang and the police were registered the day prior in the neighborhood (coded separately). 1 injured.
