On 26 November 2024, near Petion Ville - Academie, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang attacked residents as they fired shots and set fire to their houses in the 'Kajwo' locality (less than 1 km away from the Police Academy), and in 'Gwo jan' area (coded separately).Casualties unknown.

On 26 November 2024, in Petion Ville - Pernier, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang attacked residents as they fired shots and set fire to their houses in the 'Gwo jan' area (Pernier neighbourhood), and in the 'Kajwo' locality (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

Non-violent activity: On 22 November 2024, in Tabarre, Ouest, overnight, the Kraze Barye Gang set up a roadblock along the Tabarre 53 Road, cutting access to the Torcelle neighbourhood. This was to prevent police forces from carrying out anti-gang operations in the area. The road was opened in the morning of 23 November. The criminals also built a wall at the entrance of the Torcelle neighbourhood.
On 24 November 2024, in Petion Ville - Pernier, Ouest, gang members invaded and attacked the Pernier neighbourhood. Casualties unknown.
On 24 November 2024, in Tabarre, Ouest, gang members invaded and attacked neighbourhoods in the commune. Casualties unknown.

Non-violent activity: Around 25 November 2024 (month of), in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, according to residents, gang members built a prison for police and military officers in the Canaan neighbourhood.
Non-violent activity: Around 25 November 2024 (month of), in Lacroix-Perisse, Artibonite, according to residents, gang members built a prison for police and military officers.

Non-violent activity: Around 25 November 2024 (month of), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, according to residents, gang members built a prison for police and military officers in Village de Dieu neighbourhood.
Non-violent activity: Around 25 November 2024 (month of), in Thomazeau, Ouest, according to residents, gang members built a prison for police and military officers in the Onaville area.

On 29 November 2024, near Petion Ville - Academie, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) fired shots as they attacked the 'Kajwo' locality (less than 1 km away from the Police Academy) and the Freres Road. Casualties unknown.

On 2 December 2024, in Delmas - Puits Blain, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) attacked residents in Delmas, likely at the height of the Puits Blain neighbourhood, where police forces later intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

Around 29 November 2024 (as reported), in Bon Repos, Ouest, police forces and agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) clashed with gang members in the Lilavois neighbourhood. Casualties unknown.

Around 29 November 2024 (as reported), in Chapini, Ouest, police forces and agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) clashed with gang members in the Rosembert neighbourhood. Casualties unknown.

Around 29 November 2024 (as reported), in Delmas - Christ-Roi Ouest, police forces and agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) clashed with gang members in the Christ-Roi and Delmas 32 (coded separately) neighbourhoods. Casualties unknown.

Around 29 November 2024 (as reported), in Delmas - Delmas 32, Ouest, police forces and agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) clashed with gang members in the Delmas 32 and Christ-Roi (coded separately) neighbourhoods. Casualties unknown.

On 29 November 2024, Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang fired shots as they attacked and took control of the Nazon neighbourhood. Some residents were seen fleeing the area. Casualties unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2021-2025)
notes: Security measures: On 13 March 2024, in Tabarre, Ouest, a second group of US soldiers was deployed in the vicinity of the US Embassy (Chateau Blond neighborhood) to reinforce its security. A first group had been deployed three days earlier on 10 March 2024 (coded separately) also as part of the Embassy's security reinforcements.

actor1: Military Forces of the Dominican Republic (2020-)
notes: On 13 March 2024, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, a Haitian civilian was shot and killed by soldiers from the Dominican Republic, close to the Ouanaminthe Canal on the border between the two countries. The man was about to cross the border into the Dominican Republic to go shopping. 1 fatality.

On 13 March 2024, in Leogane, Ouest, according to hospital staff, an 80-year-old man was killed in his room at the Sainte-Croix Hospital by several unidentified armed individuals. The victim was receiving emergency medical treatment after he was shot earlier that day in his home. 1 fatality.
On 17 March 2024, in Port-Salut, Sud, during a police intervention, there was an armed clash between police officers and a gang member. The gang was killed and a gun was seized. 1 fatality.

Other: On 27 March 2024, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Delmas 19 and Delmas 31 neighborhoods, causing people to flee and return to their homes. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

On 30 March 2024, in Carrefour - Le Lambi, Ouest, a member of a gang operating in Mariani Gang was killed following a car chase and exchange of gunfire with police forces. The man was about to be installed as local leader of the gang. 1 fatality.

On 31 March 2024, in Petion Ville - Centre Ville (Nord), Ouest, overnight, four people were killed in Rue Villate. There is no information on the circumstances or perpetrators of the incident. 4 fatalities.

On 2 April 2024, in Petionville, Ouest, two men were killed by affiliates of the Bwa Kale Movement in the Nandren neighborhood, after they were stopped by the police and refused to provide information about the weapons they were carrying and their destination. There is no information on the specific circumstances of the incident. 2 fatalities.
On 3 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Bourdon, Ouest, according to a witness, armed individuals shot and killed a man affiliated to the PHTK party on his way home. 1 fatality.
On 4 April 2024, in Morne Oge, Sud-Est, the police arrested the second leader of the Team H Gang who was wanted for diverse illegal acts.

On 7 April 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 32, Ouest, people, with holding signs and accompanied by music, protested in favor of the former senator Guy Phillipe and against the CARICOM-supported Presidential Transitional Council (PTC).
Looting: On 7 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Cathedrale, Ouest, overnight, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang looted the Jean Baptiste Damier Professional School.

On 8 April 2024, in Delmas - Carrefour Aeroport/Delmas 13, Ouest, several people were injured while others were killed in Carrefour Aeroport. Although gunshots were heard in the area, there is no information on the circumstances of the attack. Several injured. Unspecified fatalities coded as 3.

Looting: On 9 April 2024, in Carrefour - Cote Plage, Ouest, gang members looted the offices of Natcom in Cote Plage 18 after tying up the security guard. They seized materials before leaving the premises.

source: Amerique Info 7; Ordre des Defenseurs des Droits Humains (ORDEDH)
notes: On 11 April 2024, in Cabaret, Ouest, the Kanaran gang attacked the residents, shooting and killing at least 10 people. At least 10 fatalities.
On 12 April 2024, in Petionville, Ouest, a gang member was killed by affiliates of the Bwa Kale Movement. There is no information on the circumstances of the incident. 1 fatality.

Other: On 12 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard throughout the capital after the Presidential Transitional Council (PTC) was created (coded separately). There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
On 14 April 2024, in Carrefour - Brochette, Ouest, gang members shot and injured a hotel manager. They also kidnapped his wife. Her whereabouts are unknown. 1 injured.
Non-violent activity: On 18 April 2024, in Gros-Morne, Artibonite, members of the Ti Bwa Gang set up a paid toll for all drivers going to the Nord-Est area of the country.
On 19 April 2024, in Anse a Galets, Ouest, two police officers beat up a man in a court. There is no information on the circumstances or motives of the attack. 1 injured.
Looting: On 21 April 2024, in Petionville, Ouest, members of the Kraze Barye Gang looted the home of an ex-congressman and took everything they could find.

On 29 April 2024, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, armed gang members killed several people between Lilavois 51-53 neighborhoods. They also looted the residents' homes. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 29 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Avenue Christophe, Ouest, two gang members tried to carry out a kidnapping in Rue 6 but were stopped by police officers . The two kidnappers were wounded (methods unknown) during the police intervention. One of them was badly injured and intercepted by residents who killed him (coded separately) while the other was able to flee the scene. 2 injured.

On 29 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Avenue Christophe, Ouest, members of the population affiliated to the Bwa Kale Movement killed a wounded gang member after he tried to run from the police who stopped him during a kidnapping attempt (coded separately). 1 fatality.
Other: On 1 May 2024, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard on Freres Road near the Police Academy. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

source: Amerique Info 7; Invasion Radio Tv; Ordre des Defenseurs des Droits Humains (ORDEDH); Radio Graphie
notes: On 3 May 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 65, Ouest, overnight, at least 4 men were killed in Delmas 65 and their bodies were found with badges around their necks with a different number written on each one of them. Some versions indicate that the victims were killed during a clash with police officers carrying out a routine security operation. Other versions indicate that there were 6 victims and they were killed inside the restaurant Chez Bibi by unknown armed individuals. There is no information on the meaning of the numbers or the motives of the attack. Only two of the victims were identified. At least 4 fatalities.

On 3 May 2024, in Tabarre - Cazeau/Tabarre 14, Ouest, members of the Kraze Barye Gang attacked different neighborhoods, including Tabarre 12 and 16. They set fire to residents' homes and fired gunshots. Casualties unknown.
Property destruction: On 5 May 2024, in Tabarre - Aeroport Toussaint Louverture, Ouest, armed individuals opened fire on the airport building.
On 10 May 2024, in Cap Rouge, Sud-Est, a man accused of stealing cattle was killed by residents of the Matador locality. The mob burned the body of the suspected thief. 1 fatality.
On 10 May 2024, in Miragoane, Nippes, the police killed a member of the Base 5 Secondes Gang in the Berquin locality. 1 fatality.
Property destruction: On 13 May 2024, in Merger, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang set fire to residents' homes in the area. There were no casualties.

Other: On 15 May 2024, in Carrefour, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the commune. Although armed individuals were seen in vehicles driving around the Waney 87 neighborhood, there is no information on the circumstances of the gunshots.
Other: On 19 May 2024, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the commune. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
On 20 May 2024, in Limbe, Nord, a gang leader was killed by affiliates of the Bwa Kale Movement after he tried to rape a woman of the area. 1 fatality.

Movement of forces: On 20 May 2024, in Tabarre - Aeroport Toussaint Louverture, Ouest, around 50 Kenyan police officers arrived to the country as part of the Multinational Security Support Mission in Haiti.

On 21 May 2024, in Pilate, Nord, members of the Pasousa Gang kidnapped all the passengers (number unknown) who were traveling in a bus including the director and administrator of the institution. The kidnappers requested a ransom of USD 50.000 in exchange for their release. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.
Property destruction: On 21 May 2024, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, gang members destroyed the Lilavois police station.

Non-violent activity: On 29 May 2024, in Petionville, Ouest, overnight, members of the Kraze Barye Gang dug holes in several roads to prevent the police from attacking them in Pernier. Residents have been unable to access or leave the area. They did the same in Tabarre (coded separately).

Non-violent activity: On 29 May 2024, overnight, in Tabarre, Ouest, members of the Kraze Barye Gang dug holes in several roads to prevent the police from attacking them in Torcelle. Residents have been unable to access or leave the area. They did the same in Petionville (coded separately).

source: Amerique Info 7; Ordre des Defenseurs des Droits Humains (ORDEDH)
notes: On 29 May 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, overnight, three men were shot and killed in Delmas 19. Their naked bodies were found after a lot of gunshots were heard in the area. It is suspected that the killings were perpetrated by police officers. There is no information on the motives of the attack. 3 fatalities.
On 3 June 2024, in Pilate, Nord, the police killed the second leader of the Baz Pilat gang. 1 fatality.

On 5 June 2024, in Tabarre, Ouest, students of the Mission Bon Samaritain International School protested the school administration's demand to pay fees for a month they were unable to attend classes due to gang violence.

On 6 June 2024, in Tabarre, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, several dozens of students of the Mission Bon Samaritain International School protested the school administration's demand to pay fees for a month they were unable to attend classes due to gang violence.

On 7 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Bicentenaire, Ouest, several dozens of people protested in front of the Prime Minister's Office to demand the arrest of the Finance and Economy Minister who they believe have been getting in the way of the new Prime Minister.

Non-violent activity: Around 11 June 2024 (as reported), in Petionville, Ouest, members of the Kraze Barye Gang dug holes and set up blocks on the roads to prevent the police from entering their base in Pernier 17. They did the same in Tabarre (coded separately).

Non-violent activity: Around 11 June 2024 (as reported), in Tabarre, Ouest, members of the Kraze Barye Gang dug holes and set up blocks on the roads to prevent the police from entering their base in Tabarre 53. They did the same in Petionville (coded separately).
Other: On 16 June 2024, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard at night in Gerardeau. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Looting: Around 25 June 2024 (between 25 - 26 June), near L'Estere, Artibonite, members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang seized the only ambulance available for the area.

On 26 March 2024, in Petion Ville - Jacquet Toto, Ouest, residents killed (methods unknown) two members of the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) near the Telele market on Frere road and burned their bodies. The event is likely a case of vigilante violence. 2 fatalities.

Security measures: Around 11 December 2024 (as reported), in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, local authorities imposed a night curfew from 8 p.m. to 6 a.m. until further notice. The decision was taken after a flare-up of violence by the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang.

actor2: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 10 December 2024, in Savien, Artibonite, Haitian police forces supported by the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) shot and killed several members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang during clashes. This was part of anti-gang operations in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune that also led to the dismantling of gang bases and the removal of gang roadblocks. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 10 December 2024, in Delmas - Carrefour Aeroport/Delmas 13, Ouest, overnight, armed gang members (likely from the Viv Ansanm Gang that controls the area) killed several residents as they attacked the Carrefour Aerorport, Delmas 17, and Delmas 19 (coded separately) neighborhoods. Some vehicles were set on fire. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 10 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 17, Ouest, overnight, armed gang members (likely from the Viv Ansanm Gang) killed several residents as they attacked the Delmas 17, Delmas 19, and Carrefour Aeroport (coded separately) neighborhoods. Some vehicles were set on fire. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 10 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, overnight, Haitian police forces supported by the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS) shot and killed several members of the Viv Ansanm Gang during clashes in the Delmas 19 neighborhood. Clashes erupted as security forces intervened to expel the criminals, who attacked residents in the area (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 11 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, the Viv Ansanm Gang fired shots as they attacked the Delmas 19 neighborhood. Casualties unknown.
On 11 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 32, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang fired shots as they attacked the Delmas 32 neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

On 6 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 33, Ouest, a trader woman was shot and killed by a stray bullet between Delmas 31 and Delmas 33 (Delmas 33 neighborhood). It happened as police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang in nearby Delmas 30 and Carrefour Aeroport neighborhoods, among others (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 10 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Christ-Roi/Nan Moise, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with gang members in the Christ-Roi/Nan Moise and Nazon (coded separately) neighborhoods. In Christ-Roi, the officers took control of the Rosa Villa Hotel, which had been occupied by the criminals. Casualties unknown.

On 13 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Nord Alexis, Ouest, police forces clashed with the Viv Ansanm Gang as they intervened to expel the criminals from the Nord Alexis neighborhood, which was under gang attack since that morning (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: Amerique Info 7; Gazette Haiti; Trip Foumi
notes: On 13 December 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Nord Alexis, Ouest, in the morning, the Viv Ansanm Gang set fire to the Horace Etheard National School and several nearby houses as they attacked the Nord Alexis neighborhood. Police forces intervened and clashed with the criminals (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

Around 12 December 2024 (as reported), in Tabarre - HT Monquette, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) kidnapped two employees at the MSC Plus company, located on Boulevard 15 Octobre (HT Monquette). The company provides services for the Haitian military forces, which was described as the motivation for the abduction. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

Around 1 April 2024 (as reported), in Petion Ville - Desir-Gabriel, Ouest, four people were killed and their dead bodies were found near the Extra Market between Villate and Metellus streets (near the Desir-Gabriel neighborhood). The perpetrators and circumstances were not clarified. 4 fatalities.
Weapons seizure: On 14 December 2024, in Delmas, Ouest, police forces seized two vehicles transporting weapons and ammunition to gang members in the Delmas 33 neighborhood.
On 15 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 17, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Delmas 17 neighborhood. Casualties unknown.
On 15 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Delmas 30 neighborhood. Casualties unknown.
On 15 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas 32, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Delmas 32 neighborhood. Casualties unknown.
On 15 December 2024, in Delmas - Delmas - Sylvio Cator/Delmas 28, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in Delmas 24 (Sylvio Cator/Delmas 28). Casualties unknown.
On 15 December 2024, in Delmas - Village W. Lamothe, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in Delmas 29 (Village W. Lamothe neighborhood). Casualties unknown.

On 16 December 2024, Tabarre - Croix des Missions, Ouest, in the morning, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Croix des Missions neighborhood. Residents claimed that the criminals were about the dismantle the Croix des Missions' bridge. Casualties unknown.

Around 17 December 2024 (as reported), in the Nippes department (coded to Petite Riviere de Nippes), a group of Evangelical missionaries stoned and beat a local houngan (voodoo priest) at his home, in an area known as 'Deriso (Vye wout)'. The beating knocked him unconscious. The motivation was not clarified. 1 injured.

source: Juno 7; Passion Info Plus; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 17 December 2024, in Petionville, Ouest, police officers clashed with gang members in the commune where gunshots were heard in the early morning. Between four and seven bodies were found on the street near an ancient cemetery which became a bus stop. At least 4 fatalities.
On 19 December 2024, in Savien, Artibonite, police forces clashed with the Savien Gang as they carried out anti-gang operation in the Artibonite department. Casualties unknown.

On 19 December 2024, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, police forces shot and killed the leader of an unspecified gang and arrested two of his accomplices during a security operation in an area known as Sainte-Philomene. 1 fatality.

Around 25 December 2024 (as reported), in Petion Ville - Sainte Therese, Ouest, a group of men physically and verbally aggressed a former minister woman from the Democratic and Popular Sector party (SDP) during a political conference at El Rancho hotel, located between Faubert and Darguin streets (near Sainte Therese neighborhood). No further details were mentioned. There were no casualties.

Non-violent activity: Around 25 December 2024 (as reported), in Petionville, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) set up roadblocks in Pernier, cutting road traffic and access to the Police Academy (in nearby Academie neighborhood).

Property destruction: On 30 December 2024, in Tabarre - Carrefour Fleuriot, Ouest, police forces used a vehicle known as 'Satan' to destroy a wall that had been built by the Kraze Barye Gang in the number 53 of Boulevard 15 Octobre (Carrefour Fleuriot neighborhood).

On 31 December 2024, Petion Ville - Kay Colette, Ouest, overnight, police forces killed two members of the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) whom they intercepted along the Freres Road, at the height of the Boucan Lapli area (Kay Colette neighborhood). The victims were thieved who used to be based in Chateau Blond (Tabarre). 2 fatalities.
On 1 January 2025, in Kenscoff, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked and tried to invade the Kenscoff commune. Casualties unknown.

On 6 January 2025, in Trou-du-Nord, Nord-Est, teachers held a protest demanding better working conditions, including the payment of due salaries and benefits, among other claims. The mobilization was part of a labor strike.

On 7 January 2025, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, teachers affiliated to the National Civic Education Program (PRONEK) and the Free and Compulsory Universal Schooling Program (PSUGO) held a protest and formed a picket in front of the Northern Education office, in Vodrey area, demanding better working conditions. The mobilization was part of a labor strike.

On 7 January 2025, in Fort-Liberte, Nord-Est, for a second consecutive day, scores of teachers supported by trade union representatives held a protest demanding better working conditions, including the payment of due salaries and benefits, among other claims. The mobilization was part of a labor strike.

On 7 January 2025, in Trou-du-Nord, Nord-Est, for a second consecutive day, scores of teachers supported by trade union representatives held a protest demanding better working conditions, including the payment of due salaries and benefits, among other claims. The mobilization was part of a labor strike.

Around 7 January 2025 (as reported), in Petion Ville - Juvenat, Ouest, members of the Pa Fristre Gang shot and killed at least four civilians in the Mount Menna area. Two of the victims were known local personalities. At least 4 fatalities.

On 9 January 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Avenue Christophe, Ouest, police forces shot and killed a man whom they had identified as a gang informant. The killing took place on Avenue Christophe neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 9 January 2025, in Tabarre - Clercine II/Carrefour Clercine, Ouest, police forces clashed with the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) and the Viv Ansanm Gang near the Police Motorized Intervention Brigade (BIM), in Clercine II neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

On 9 January 2025, in Tabarre - Village Thomas Theodate, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Village Thomas Theodate neighborhood. Clashes with security forces were registered in nearby Clercine II neighborhood (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

Security measures: On 17 January 2025, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, local authorities imposed a ban on the carrying of firearms until 4 March to ensure security during a visit of Colombian President, Gustavo Petro.

Around 6 January 2024 (weekend of), in Tabarre - Torcelle, Ouest, members of the Kraze Barye gang kidnapped two civilians who were travelling in the car of an Evangelical Christian local pastor. The civilians were released the same day by the gang from the gang's base, but the car was kept. There had been clashes between the pastor and the gang in the past.

On 9 January 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, suspected members of the Belair gang clashed with police forces, as they attempted to break into the Port-au-Prince sub-police precinct. The gang was attempting to recapture another gang member (who served as the gang leader's driver), who had been arrested earlier that day. Police forces were able to repel the gang, and the arrested member remained in custody. Casualties unknown.

On 15 January 2024, in Saint-Louis du Nord, Nord-Ouest, a group of students from several local schools took to the streets, demanding that authorities finish the construction of one of their schools, that had remained unfinished for four years. The protestors also demanded that the government pay their teachers, who hadn't received their salaries for several months. This took place on the same day as many other demonstrations nationwide, primarily calling for Prime Minister Ariel Henry's resignation (coded separately).

On 15 January 2024, in Bon Repos, Ouest, gang members attacked and looted a series of houses in the Lilavois 51 and 53 areas, stealing property and physically attacking homeowners. Casualties unknown.

Non-violent activity: On 22 January 2024, in Aquin, Sud, the offices of several public institutions, including the local court, immigration office, and tax office, were sealed off by civilians using padlocks in the front doors. The local police commissioner removed the padlocks to allow activities to resume. This was likely part of anti-government mobilizations called by Guy Philippe (a former police officer, senator, convict, paramilitary leader, and warlord who had called on taking the streets and leading a revolution in Haiti).

source: Amerique Info 7; Ordre des Defenseurs des Droits Humains (ORDEDH)
notes: On 23 January 2024, in Carrefour - Do Karyann, Ouest, members of the Bwa Kale Movement militia killed and burned the bodies of three unidentified armed individuals. The individuals had been encountered with weapons, no identification and were unable to describe who they knew in the area, before the militia attacked them. 3 fatalities.

On 23 January 2024, in Carrefour - Le Lambi, Ouest, police forces clashed with armed individuals, who were described as arriving by sea to reinforce the ranks of the Bout Ba Gang. Many gunshots were heard in the neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

Other: On 26 January 2024, in Tabarre, Ouest, heavy gunfire was heard in the Caradeux neighborhood, reaching as far as the US Embassy (Chateau Blond neighborhood). There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 27 January 2024, in Carrefour, Ouest, Gunshots were heard in the Mariani neighborhood. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

On 27 January 2024, in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, gang members attacked residents as they tried to invade the Coupe Mardi-Gras area, base of the Zagoloray gang. Heavy gunfire was heard throughout the night. Casualties unknown.

On 13 January 2024, in La Saline (coded to near Cordier), Nord-Ouest), there was an armed clash between members of a local gang operating in La Croix Saint Joseph and police forces who were carrying out an operation in La Saline locality. A high-ranking member of the gang was killed. 1 fatality.

On 29 January 2024, in Mirebalais, Centre, hundreds of residents took to the streets to protest against the rationing of electricity that had been taking place for the past several days, which had lead to blackouts. Some demonstrators also demanded the resignation of Prime Minister Ariel Henry.

On 29 January 2024, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, members of the Canaan gang shot and killed three boys who were attempting to flee the Canaan neighborhood, following restrictions the gang had placed on residents leaving their homes. Since Wednesday 31 January the gangs were preventing residents from accessing food and economic support. 3 fatalities.

On 30 January 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Saint Gerard, Ouest, police forces and unidentified armed individuals clashed as the police intervened to stop a kidnapping. The unidentified armed men had attempted to kidnap a civilian, after firing several shots in the street to force the crowd to disperse. Police forces shot at a kidnapper, who was hit by a bullet before abandoning his weapon and the civilian, but he was able to escape in a nearby vehicle. Casualties unknown.

On 31 January 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, a group of women's organizations organized a peaceful march for peace, denouncing the ongoing violence tied to gang activity. Some called for an international intervention to bolster the Haitian police forces. The protest started at the Natcom and ended at the Constitution Square (Champs de Mars) after passing through Lamartiniere avenue, Christophe avenue and Capois street. The march was organized by the organization 'Mouvman Pou Lape' which integrates several feminist organizations such as SONAFAL and the Committee of Women Engaged for Haiti.

On 31 January 2024, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, for the second consecutive day, students of the Pinchinat and Celie Lamour high schools took to the streets to demand that their professors return to their classrooms after an undisclosed period when classes were not taking place. As the group marched in the streets, they forced all other schools on their route to release their students and shut their doors. Students in one school who did not wish to join the demonstrators had rocks thrown at them. Police forces were present, but no intervention was mentioned.

On 12 February 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, students from the Faculty of Ethnology of Haiti's State University blocked the area around the university with burning tires and other barricades, in an attempt to disrupt government-sponsored carnival festivities being held in the neighborhood. The carnival was held in honor of former President Jovenel Moise.
On 16 February 2024, in Carrefour, Ouest, protestors gathered to demand the resignation of Prime Minister Ariel Henry. Protestors were seen holding signs with anti-government messages.

On 21 February 2024, in Delmas - Musseau, Ouest, at least a man was shot and killed by unidentified armed individuals on board a vehicle (drive-by). The motive for the attack, which caused people in the area to flee in panic, is unknown. At least 1 fatality.

On 22 February 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Portail Leogane/Cite Louverture, Ouest, a woman was abducted by unidentified armed men, as she was about to enter her home. There is no information on the perpetrators and circumstances of the abduction, but the latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown.

On 22 February 2024, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, a school principal was attacked and injured by gang members with machetes. The attack took place following the victim's intervention on local radio, where he had called for students to return to school after several weeks of disruptions, due to anti-government protests. The attack was described as an assassination attempt. 1 injured.

Other: On 23 February 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, heavy gunfire was heard in the vicinity of the Haiti Central Bank, located in the Bicentenaire neighborhood. While the building wasn't hit, the gunshots caused panic inside the building. There is no information regarding the authors or circumstances of the gunshots.

On 29 February 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, a police officer was shot and injured in the vicinity of the Civil Prison (a.k.a. National Penitentiary) by unidentified armed individuals. This was likely tied to a series of coordinated attacks that day led by the G-9 Gang leader and supported by gangs aligned to the Living Together Movement gang-led initiative (coded separately). 1 injured.

actor2: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: Around 18 January 2025 (between 17 - 19 January), in La Ville, Artibonite, police forces supported by Kenyan agents from the Multinational Security Support Mission killed the leader of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang and several accomplices during clashes in the Segur area. Several weapons were seized. The police regained control of several areas in the department. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 18 January 2025, in Montrouis, Artibonite, rival armed members of the population from Piatre and Deluge engaged in armed clashes over a longstanding land conflict. At least seven men were killed while several people were injured. At least 7 fatalities, several injured.
On 23 January 2025, in Liancourt, Artibonite, a mob of residents lynched (likely killed) a man who was in custody. He was accused of being a member of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang. 1 fatality.

On 29 January 2025, in Kenscoff - Fermathe, Ouest, police forces killed a woman and a man in Fermathe 45. The police action was described as part of efforts to expel criminals from the Kenscoff commune. The now deceased were searching for people on the road leading to Juvenat (Petionville). Affiliation of the victims unknown. It was not clarified if they carried firearms. Their bodies were left on the ground. 2 fatalities.

actor2: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 26 January 2025, in Verrettes, Artibonite, a mob of residents lynched a man whom they accused of ties with the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang. The victim was decapitated. 1 fatality.

Around 4 February 2025 (as reported), in Cap-Haitien, Nord, a group of teachers from public schools held a protest with banners in front of the North Department delegation building over labor-related demands. The mobilization was part of a labor strike.

Around 7 February 2025 (as reported), in Cap-Haitien, Nord, militants of the Child of Dessalines Platform Party held a protest demanding the departure of the party's director of rights. Protesters want to appoint another head from their election.

Movement of forces: Around 1 February 2025 (as reported), in Kenscoff, Ouest, around 100 military officers were deployed at the former Teleco company headquarters. The deployment aimed at restoring security after the Viv Ansanm Gang launched coordinated attacks against the commune since 26 January (coded separately).

On 3 February 2025, in Kenscoff - Carrefour bete, Ouest, gang members set fire to several properties near the presbytery in Carrefour bete (Bongars communal section), forcing civilians who were around to flee. Due to similar attacks, residents from several communities fled de area. The criminals were part of an armed offensive by the Base 5 Secondes Gang, the Grand-Ravine Gang, and the Ti Bwa Gang (affiliates of the Viv Ansanm Gang) against the Kenscoff commune (coded separately). Recent reports clarified that the offensive was linked to a plan led by the Didi Gang to take control of the close Petionville commune. Casualties unknown.

source: Amerique Info 7; BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 7 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Pernier, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang attacked residents in the 'Gwo jan' area (Pernier neighborhood). Between 7 and 13 February, the Kraze Barye Gang injured at least five civilians and kidnapped seven (their whereabouts are unknown) during attacks in Metivier, Meyotte, and Pernier neighborhoods (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
Security measures: On 5 February 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, local authorities imposed a ban on the celebration of carnival activities on the streets of the commune due to fears of gang violence.

On 30 January 2024, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, students of the Pinchinat and Celie Lamour high schools took to the streets to demand that their professors return to their classrooms after an undisclosed period when classes were not taking place.
On 9 February 2025, in the Petionville commune, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Nan Tunnel neighborhood. This was part of an offensive to invade the Petionville commune. Casualties unknown.
On 9 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Diegue, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Diegue neighborhood. This was part of an offensive to invade the Petionville commune. Casualties unknown.
On 9 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Metivier, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Metivier neighborhood. This was part of an offensive to invade the Petionville commune. Casualties unknown.
On 9 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Corvette, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked the Corvette neighborhood. This was part of an offensive to invade the Petionville commune. Casualties unknown.

On 10 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Morette, Ouest, in the morning, the Kraze Barye Gang fired shots and attacked the Morette neighborhood, among other areas in the commune (coded separately), as they tried to invade Petionville. Casualties unknown.

On 11 February 2025, in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune, Artibonite, police forces clashed with the Savien and Palmiste gangs and expelled them from the Anba Tisous locality and the Labady communal section (3rd Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite's communal sections), which were under gang attacks since the morning (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 11 February 2025, in the Petionville commune, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, the Kraze Barye Gang fired shots on the Freres Road and Nan Tunnel areas, among other areas in the commune (coded separately), as they tried to invade Petionville. Casualties unknown.

On 11 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Freres, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang fired shots as they attacked Impasse Gracien area (Freres neighborhood). This was part of an offensive aimed at invading Petionville. Casualties unknown.

On 11 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Academie, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, the Kraze Barye Gang fired shots as they attacked the 'Kajwo' area (less than 1 km away from the Police Academy). This was part of an offensive aimed at invading Petionville. Casualties unknown.

On 12 February 2025, in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune, Artibonite, the Savien Gang fired shots as they attacked the Laverdure area (in Bas Coursin II, the 2nd Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite's communal section). Casualties unknown.
Other: On 12 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Nazon, Solino, and Poste Marchand. There is no information on the authorship and the circumstances of the gunshots.

On 12 February 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang looted, burned property (nature unclarified), and opened fire as they attacked the Nan Tunnel area. This was part of an offensive aimed at invading Petionville. Casualties unknown.

On 12 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Freres, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang looted, burned property (nature unclarified), and opened fire as they attacked the vicinity of the Saint Claire d'Assis Church (Freres neighborhood). This was part of an offensive aimed at invading Petionville. Casualties unknown.

source: Amerique Info 7; BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 12 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Pernier, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang looted, burned, and opened fire as they attacked the 'Gwo Jan' area. This was part of an offensive aimed at invading Petionville. Between 7 and 13 February, the Kraze Barye Gang injured at least five civilians and kidnapped seven (their whereabouts are unknown) during attacks in Metivier, Meyotte, and Pernier neighborhoods (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Trip Foumi
notes: On 13 February 2025, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, the 400 Mawozo Gang killed at least 10 people. Their bodies were on display in public for hours before being recovered. The attack was perpetrated after the gang's leader ordered its affiliates to track cellphones and kill everyone having links with the police. The order was made in reprisal for a ban on carnival celebrations by local authorities (coded separately). Between 11 and 22 February, at least 42 people were killed and five were injured during 400 Mawozo attacks in the Michaud, Cottard, and Duval neighborhoods (in Croix-des-Bouquets downtown), and in Morne a Cabrit areas (coded separately). 42 fatalities split across three events. At least 10 fatalities coded here.
Security measures: Around 13 February 2025 (as reported), in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, authorities imposed a ban on the celebration of carnival festivities due to risks of gang violence.

On 18 February 2025, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, a mob of residents beat up and injured a woman who had stabbed to death and robbed a man at the Vertieres Hotel moments before. Police forces fired shots into the air to disperse the mobsters and arrest the woman. 1 injured.

On 20 February 2025, in the Ouest department (coded to Croix-des-Bouquets), Ouest, the 400 Mawozo Gang shot and killed a former mayor and former magistrate of the Cite Soleil commune after torturing him. His body was burned. The victim had been kidnapped earlier that day. 1 fatality.

On 16 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Freres, Ouest, in the morning, the Kraze Barye Gang opened fire as they attacked the Impasse Gracien area (Freres neighborhood), and the Freres Road. Casualties unknown.
On 20 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour Feuilles, Ouest, armed group members engaged in armed clashes with armed members of the population. Casualties unknown.

On 20 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour Feuilles, Ouest, in the morning, residents took to the streets to decry gang violence and lack of action by national authorities in the face of gangs. During the mobilization, police forces intervened (methods unknown) to put an end to the violent clashes the demonstrators engaged in.

On 20 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Solino, Ouest, in the morning, hundreds of residents took to the streets to decry gang violence and lack of action by national authorities in the face of gangs. During the mobilization, police forces intervened (methods unknown) to put an end to the violent clashes the demonstrators engaged in.
Other: On 27 February 2025, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Sarthe neighborhood. There is no information on the circumstances and the authorship of the gunshots.

On 24 February 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, residents took to the streets in the commune calling for security measures in the face of gang violence. Mobilizations on these claims were held on the same day in Delmas and Port-au-Prince (coded separately).
On 24 February 2025, in Delmas - Carrefour Aeroport/Delmas 13, Ouest, overnight, gang members attacked residents in Carrefour Aeroport. Casualties unknown.
On 24 February 2025, in Delmas - Cite Militaire, Ouest, overnight, gang members attacked residents in Cite Militaire. Casualties unknown.

On 25 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 17, Ouest, in the morning, gang members (likely from the Viv Ansanm Gang, whose members attacked the neighborhood the day prior) attacked residents and set fire to their homes in Delmas 17, prompting the displacement of civilians. Casualties unknown.

On 24 February 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 33, Ouest, armed individuals (described as police officers), who had attacked the leader of a self-defense group from Petionville earlier that day (coded separately) in reprisal for his resistance in the face of the Kraze Barye Gang, opened fire on the Petionville police commissioner. It happened as the police commissioner was looking for the mentioned resistance leader in Delmas 33. The armed individuals also broke into the police commissioner's mother's house. Casualties unknown.
On 26 February 2025, in Delmas - Maguana, Ouest, police forces engaged in armed clashes with armed individuals in Delmas 31. Casualties unknown.
On 24 February 2025, in Delmas - Nazon, Ouest, overnight, gang members attacked residents in Nazon. Casualties unknown.

source: Amerique Info 7; BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 27 February 2025, in Petion Ville - Academie, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang entered a displaced people's camp located on the Freres Road and near the Police Academy and opened indiscriminate fire. At least a man and a woman were killed. At least five men were injured. At least 2 fatalities, at least 5 injured.

On 24 February 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, armed men (described as police officers) used firearms and fists to beat up the leader of a self-defense group operating in several neighborhoods of Petionville. The attack was described as a reprisal for his role as leader of the resistance in the face of the Kraze Barye Gang offensive against the commune. There were no fatalities.
Around 24 February 2025 (as reported), in the Petionville commune, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents along the Freres Road. Casualties unknown.

On 22 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bois Verna, Ouest, overnight, police forces engaged in armed clashes with gang members in the Bois Verna neighborhood. Clashes were also registered in Lalue, Christ Roi, Debussy, Canape-Vert, Poste Marchand, and Fort National (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 24 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bourdon, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, residents held a demonstration and erected burning barricades on the streets of the neighborhood against the violence of gangs and to prevent them from entering their communities.
Around 24 February 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Bourdon, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in Bourdon. Casualties unknown.
On 28 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bourdon, Ouest, gang members attacked residential areas. Casualties unknown.

On 22 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Canape-Vert, Ouest, overnight, police forces engaged in armed clashes with gang members in the Canape Vert neighborhood. Clashes were also registered in Lalue, Christ Roi, Debussy, Bois Verna, Poste Marchand, and Fort National (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 22 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Christ Roi - Lalue, Ouest, overnight, police forces engaged in armed clashes with gang members in Lalue and Christ Roi neighborhoods. Clashes were also registered in Canape-Vert, Debussy, Bois Verna, Poste Marchand, and Fort National (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
Around 24 February 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Christ Roi - Lalue, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in Lalue. Casualties unknown.
On 26 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Christ Roi - Lalue, Ouest, in the morning, gang members set fire to the 'Micky Mouse' School with teachers and students inside. Casualties unknown.

On 22 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Debussy/Haut-Turgeau, Ouest, overnight, police forces engaged in armed clashes with gang members in the Debussy neighborhood. Clashes were also registered in Lalue, Christ Roi, Bois Verna, Canape-Vert, Poste Marchand, and Fort National (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 25 February 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Ravine Pintade, Ouest, overnight, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents and set fire to homes located along the Vaillant street (Ravine Pintade) and along nearby Kafou 3 and Corvington areas, killing an unknown number of civilians. Many families fled their homes. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
Around 24 February 2025 (as reported), in Tabarre - Cazeau/Tabarre 14, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in Cazeau. Casualties unknown.
Around 24 February 2025 (as reported), in Tabarre - Chateau Blond, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in Chateau Blond. Casualties unknown.
Around 24 February 2025 (as reported), in Tabarre - Clercine, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in Clercine. Casualties unknown.

Non-violent activity: On 3 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - La Saline, Ouest, several leaders of gangs affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition attended a meeting in La Saline neighborhood to organize reprisal attacks in Port-au-Prince after anti-gang police operations in Bas Delmas and Village de Dieu (Cite de Dieu) between 1 and 2 March killed several gang members and injured the Base 5 Secondes Gang's leader (coded separately).
On 7 March 2025, in the Gros-Morne commune, Artibonite, overnight, the Kokorat San Ras Gang kidnapped a woman who was leaving the Grepin market. Her whereabouts are unknown.
On 8 March 2025, in the Artibonite department (coded to Gros-Morne) Artibonite, the Kokorat San Ras Gang killed a community leader man and stole eight cows in the Dipui locality. 1 fatality.

source: Amerique Info 7; BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Gazette Haiti
notes: On 9 March 2025, in Delmas - Cite Numero Un, Ouest, overnight, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) carried out a drone strike against gang targets at the intersection of Sans Fil and Delmas 18 streets (Cite Numero Un neighborhood). The targeted criminals were taking refuge at a forested area after having burned a Natcom antenna (coded separately). Dead bodies were seen in the area, although the number of fatalities was not clarified. Between 1 and 17 March, drone strikes by the police and armed clashes were drones were used killed at least 50 gang members, according to the head of the RNDDH (50 fatalities split across nine events). In March, police drone airstrike and armed clashes were drones were used resulted in at least 115 gang members killed and 119 injured. At least 115 fatalities split across 22 events. 1 coded here.

Property destruction: Around 9 March 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Ravine Pintade, Ouest, gang members set fire to a Natcom antenna located in the Mon Dede zone (at the height of Ravine Pintade neighborhood). After the arson attack, the criminals took refuge at a forested area in Cite Numero Un neighborhood, in Delmas where police forces carried out a drone strike on the gang (coded separately).

On 11 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Ravine Pintade, Ouest, overnight, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in the neighborhood. The attack was part of a gang offensive that targeted multiple areas in Port-au-Prince on that day. Casualties unknown.

On 11 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, overnight, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in the neighborhood. The attack was part of a gang offensive that targeted multiple areas in Port-au-Prince on that day. Casualties unknown.

On 6 July 2024, in Chalon, Nippes, several hundred residents took to the streets to express their support for the Miragoane police commissioner, Ernst Muscadin, and to denounce a statement made by a national human rights organization (RNDDH) calling for his removal for human rights violations. The protesters carried tree branches and signs and were accompanied by music trucks and motorbikes, and expressed hostility towards the director of the human rights organization. The protestors expressed that the police commissioner was the only one capable of eradicating gang violence in the area.

actor1: Police Forces of Haiti (2024-) Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP)
notes: On 11 August 2024, in Cayes-Jacmel, Sud-Est, overnight, a police officer from the Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP) shot and killed a 16-year-old boy in the Ti Mouillage beach area following an argument with another civilian (unspecified). The source described that the boy was not the target but that he received a shot in the head. Police authorities claimed that the perpetrator had abandoned his BSAP training, but residents claimed he was indeed a member of the institution. The police officer fled following the incident. 1 fatality.

On 12 August 2024, in Cabaret, Ouest, members of an unidentified gang attacked and killed several civilians. According to a witness, one of the victims was an entrepreneur, who was killed in the Teleco area. At least 1 fatality.

Property destruction: Around 23 August 2024 (between 23 - 24 August) in Tabarre - Torcelle, Ouest, members of the Kraze Barye Gang demolished three houses, after the inhabitants had fled because of gang violence. Rubble from the houses was dumped in Pernier 17 and on Petitwoupo Road in Pernier 12 to create roadblocks.

source: Ordre des Defenseurs des Droits Humains (ORDEDH); Trip Foumi
notes: On 31 August 2024, in Petion Ville - Vivy Mitchell, Ouest, members of the Kraze Barye Gang shot and killed a Haitian soldier as he was on his way to work (off-duty) during an attack carried out in the neighborhood. The gang members decapitated and took the soldier's body. The gangsters also injured several residents and looted several homes. 1 fatality.
Other: On 31 August 2024, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Delmas 30 neighborhood. There is no information regarding the authors of the gunshots.

On 31 August 2024, in Tabarre - Torcelle, Ouest, members of an unidentified gang removed a man from his house and shot and killed him at Carrefour Isme. The gang members took his body away in a wheelbarrow. 1 fatality.

Other: On 18 September 2024, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Cargo, Gros Jean, Corvette and Tunel neighborhoods. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

source: Amerique Info 7; Ordre des Defenseurs des Droits Humains (ORDEDH)
notes: Around 21 September 2024 (weekend of), in Gressier, Ouest, eight 103 Zombies gang members were shot and killed during armed clashes with police forces. Several weapons were also seized. 8 fatalities.

source: Ordre des Defenseurs des Droits Humains (ORDEDH); Trip Foumi
notes: On 23 September 2024, in Miragoane, Nippes, one of the leaders of the Grand-Ravine Gang was shot and killed by the Miragoane Police Commissioner, Ernst Muscadin. The killing took place on the Miragoane dock, as the gang leader was attempting to flee on a boat to Ile-a-Vache. Another report indicates that two other unidentified individuals were also killed. It also stated that residents of the Canape-Vert neighborhood protested the killing (coded separately) and claimed that the killed man was a barber who worked in the area. 3 fatalities.
On 25 September 2024, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, a group of merchants, workers and customers protested against the Cap Haitien customs authorities and the high cost of clearing goods.

source: Aid Worker Security Database; Trip Foumi
notes: On 17 March 2025, in Delmas - Barbancourt, Ouest, unidentified individuals kidnapped three aid workers at the Food for the Poor organization (Christian group). The victims were abducted at their workplace, located on a street close to L. Jeudy street. The victims remained in captivity for three days. The organization decided to suspend its activity following the abductions. There is no information on the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related.

Around 13 March 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Avenue Christophe, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members coming from Carrefour Feuilles as they attacked residents in the neighborhood (coded separately), prompting the interruption of academic activities, which were suspended until 31 March following the gang offensive. The criminals were likely members of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition, whose affiliates clashed with the police and attacked residents in Carrefour Feuilles since 11 March (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

Other: On 16 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Canape-Vert neighborhood for hours. There is no information on the circumstances and the authorship of the gunshots, although they are not ruled out to be part of gang attacks. Several sources stated that gang members have been trying to take control of this neighborhood over the past days.

On 21 March 2025, in Les Cayes, Sud, police forces shot and killed three gang members as they conducted a security operation in Les Cayes and Ducis (coded separately). The operation was led by the Miragoane police commissioner, Ernst Muscadin. 3 fatalities split into two events. 1 fatality coded here.

On 21 March 2025, in Ducis, Sud, police forces shot and killed three gang members as they conducted a security operation in Ducis and Les Cayes (coded separately). The operation was led by the Miragoane police commissioner, Ernst Muscadin. 3 fatalities split into two events. 2 fatalities coded here.

On 27 March 2025, in the Fonds-des-Negres commune, Nippes, in the morning, the police killed two members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang) in the Belech locality. One of the gangsters was the right hand of the gang's leader. They had been expanding the gang's activities in the area. The operation was carried out under the orders of the Miragoane police commissioner, Ernst Muscadin. 2 fatalities.
Around 24 March 2025 (between 23 - 25 March), in the Grande Saline commune, Artibonite, gang members killed six people and set fire to several houses in the Potno and Chevo localities. 6 fatalities.

On 31 March 2025, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, teachers called by the coalition of teachers' union held a protest demanding the government and the Ministry of National Education better working conditions, including higher wages, among other claims.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network; Trip Foumi; Vi Free Press
notes: On 31 March 2025, in the Mirebalais commune, Centre, in the early morning, gang members attacked residents in the Sarazin communal section (Mirebalais 2nd communal section), killing and injuring an unknown number of civilians. Scores fled their homes. Residents claimed that this was a reprisal orchestrated by the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition for the resistance of the Trianon self-defense group to gang presence in the area (coded separately). The gangsters were identified as affiliates of the Canaan Gang and the 400 Mawozo Gang. They wore t-shirts with the names of these groups. Between 31 March and 3 April, at least 30 people were killed and more than 6,000 were displaced as a result of gang attacks in Mirebalais and Saut-d'Eau communes. At least 30 fatalities split across seven events, 2 fatalities coded here.

On 31 March 2025, in Jeremie, Grande-Anse, public school students from the Nord Alexis High School and the Young Girls High School held a protest demanding the returning of teachers to classrooms. The mobilization was held after the students found the schools' gates closed due to the teachers' absence.

On 1 April 2025, in Ducis, Sud, police forces shot and killed a member of the Bakop Bosal Gang. The killing happened as part of a police operation by the Miragoane police commissioner, Ernst Muscadin. 1 fatality.
On 5 April 2025, in Kenscoff - Belo, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents and set fire to several houses in Belo. Casualties unknown.

On 7 April 2025, in Saint Michel du Sud, Nippes, unidentified individuals killed a former member of the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang). The killing was perpetrated shortly after the victim had been interrogated by the Miragoane police commissioner, Ernst Muscadin, although the motivation and the identified of those involved were not clarified. The now deceased had been arrested on 3 April after being intercepted with a false police identification badge. 1 fatality.

Looting: Around 12 April 2025 (as reported), in Mirebalais, Centre, gang members looted the Mirebalais University Hospital, which had been evacuated in early April due to gang attacks in the area (coded separately).
Security measures: On 12 April 2025, in the Nippes department (coded to Miragoane), authorities imposed a ban on rara celebrations due to risks of gang attacks in the department.

Other: On 16 April 2025, in Kenscoff, Ouest, overnight, gunshots were heard around the Kenscoff police station (Corail neighborhood). This was likely the authorship of the Viv Ansanm Gang, whose members clashed with the police in the area on 17 April as they tried to attack the zone (coded separately).

On 24 April 2025, near Petion Ville - Academie, Ouest, armed individuals (likely police forces) shot and killed at least seven members of the Kraze Barye Gang as they attacked the Grasyen area, near the Police Academy. At least 7 fatalities.
On 25 April 2025, in Kenscoff - Fermathe, Ouest, gang members opened fire on people who were at the market, causing several victims (nature of casualties unclarified). Casualties unknown.
On 25 April 2025, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, members of the Protestant church held a protest to decry rising insecurity and high costs of living across different regions of the country.

On 17 April 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bois Verna, Ouest, employees at the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor (MAST) held a demonstration along the Charles Summer Avenue to demand the payment of due salaries and better working conditions, among other specific claims. Demonstrators set up burning barricades on the mentioned road, blocking traffic.

On 10 May 2025, around Miragoane, Nippes, the police commissioner shot dead a member of the Bakop Bosal gang who was wanted by the police. After receiving a tip, the commissioner found the gangster at a citizen's home where he had been hiding for over four months. The individual was also arrested. 1 fatality.

On 10 May 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 83, Ouest, a confrontation erupted at the Gecko Lounge Bar after a policewoman assigned to protect a singer and former mayor of Petit-Goave forcefully denied an off-duty officer access to the VIP area. In response, the officer called in several heavily armed police colleagues for support. The singer's security guard shot the officer at close range, which caused his fellow officers to open fire, injuring several people, including the singer himself. At least 15 people were shot and injured. At least 15 injured.

On 9 May 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bois Verna, Ouest, armed individuals opened fire on the coordinator of the campsite for displaced persons set up within the Ministry of Culture and Communication premises. The motivation of the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 19 May 2025 (between 18 - 20 May), in the Limbe commune, Nord, an 17-year-old young woman who had gone missing on 18 May was killed (methods unknown) and her body was found with the heart and kidneys extracted, on 20 May. The circumstances of the attack are unknown, although it seemed to be a case of organs extraction and trafficking, which became a more frequent practice in the country in the last decade. 1 fatality.

Non-violent activity: Around 15 February 2024 (month of), in Kenscoff, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang installed checkpoints at the entrance of the Furcy neighborhood to demand a fee from farmers and visitors needing to pass through the area.

Property destruction: Around 15 April 2024 (month of), in Kenscoff, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang set fire to farmers' fields, forcing them to leave their lands behind. This was in reprisal for the farmers' work in collaboration with the authorities.

Around 15 March 2024 (month of), in Kenscoff - Furcy, Ouest, armed individuals (likely gangs) attacked homes and residential areas in the Morne Tranchant zone, forcing residents to flee their homes. The attack was likely related to gang activity in the area. The Viv Ansanm gang had installed a roadblock at the entrance of Furcy the month prior (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
Property destruction: On 5 May 2025, in Kenscoff - Furcy, Ouest, unidentified individuals set fire to the Lodge Hotel. The attack was announced, but there was no response from the police.

Property destruction: Around 15 May 2025 (month of), in Petion Ville - Laboule, Ouest, unidentified individuals looted and set fire to second residences of businessmen and bank employees, mainly in Laboule 23.

Property destruction: Around 15 May 2025 (month of), in Delmas - Maguana, Ouest, the police dismantled a clandestine workshop that was used to produce t-shirts for the Base 5 Secondes Gang, in Delmas 31. The operation was part of efforts to disrupt the logistical and visual propaganda networks supporting gangs.

On 23 May 2025, in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals attacked areas in Bas Coursin I et and Bas Coursin II communal sections. A similar attack took place on 30 May (coded separately). The attacks caused over 5000 people to flee the area, most of whom sought refuge in Dessalines. Casualties unknown.

On 30 May 2025, in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals attacked areas in Bas Coursin I et and Bas Coursin II communal sections. A similar attack took place on 23 May (coded separately). The attacks caused over 5000 people to flee the area, most of whom sought refuge in Dessalines. Casualties unknown.

Other: On 4 June 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Torcelle neighborhood as the 400 Mawozo Gang and the Taliban Gang tried to take over several areas in the Petionville commune. There is no information on the specific actions taken by gangs.
On 7 June 2025, in Tabarre - Torcelle, Ouest, the police clashed with members of the Kraze Barye Gang, killing five of them in Carrefour Isme. 5 fatalities.

On 15 June 2025, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, residents from the Shada neighborhood held a protest to demand justice and reparations after five years of displacement following the destruction of their homes by the authorities in retaliation against a gang in June 2020 (coded separately).

On 17 June 2025, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, residents from Shada held a protest to demand justice and reparations after five years of displacement following the destruction of their homes by the authorities in retaliation against a gang in June 2020 (coded separately).

On 21 June 2025, in Saint-Michel-de-l'Atalaye, Artibonite, unidentified individuals kidnapped a 14-year-old boy as he was herding his parents' cattle. His abductors transported him to Ouanaminthe where he was kept bound and gagged for several days. His abductors requested a 500,000 gourdes ransom for his safe release, later lowered to 120,000 gourdes. The victim was released after the ransom was paid by his parents. Police arrested one of the abductors four days later in Ouanaminthe.
Around 15 June 2025 (month of), in Tabarre - Torcelle, Ouest, a member of the Kraze Barye Gang burned a woman alive. 1 fatality.

Around 14 July 2025 (as reported), in Cap-Haitien, Nord, a group of residents whose houses were destroyed (circumstances unclarified) held a protest demanding reparations and justice from the authorities.
On 19 July 2025, in Kenscoff - Belo, Ouest, the police shot and killed a gang leader during an operation in the neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 18 July 2025, in Cite Soleil - Sarthe, Ouest, an unidentified armed individual shot and killed the third leader of the Terre Noire Gang and another gang member while the victims were traveling on a motorcycle. The shooter took the leader's body and weapon from the scene. 2 fatalities.
Around 10 August 2025 (as reported), in the Artibonite department (coded to Lacroix-Perisse), members of a self-defense group killed the second leader of the Kokorat San Ras Gang. 1 fatality.
Property destruction: On 6 August 2025, in La Fresiliere, Sud, the police seized around 1,917 kg of marijuana during an operation. They also seized other materials and money.

On 18 August 2025, in L'Estere, Artibonite, members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) kidnapped a divisional police inspector on the National Road 1. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

On 2 September 2025, in Carrefour - Fontamara, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched drones against areas under the control of the Ti Bwa Gang. In Fontamara 27, several Ti Bwa Gang members were killed. The police managed to dismantle a toll station that had been installed by the gang. According to witnessing residents, civilians were killed and others were injured as a result of the strike. Drones were also launched in Martissant (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 29 August 2025, in Deluge, Artibonite, overnight, the police engaged in clashes with members of the Deluge Gang, resulting in the killing of a passers-by woman and the injuring of six civilians, including a teenager, and three police officers. Upon receiving information about ongoing gang activity on the National Road 1, the police ordered a suspicious vehicle to stop. The car's occupants opened fire on the officers, who responded with gunfire, prompting a confrontation that lasted over an hour. During clashes, an impacted police car was knocked over, and then set on fire. Several gang members were killed. At least two criminals, including one leader of the gang, and another gang leader's concubine, were injured. She was arrested. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 4, including the passer-by woman.

On 27 July 2025, in Miragoane, Nippes, two men kidnapped a female teenager. After complaints from the victim's family, the police arrested the suspects on 29 July. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

On 3 September 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 83, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals kidnapped an unspecified number of people in Delmas 83. There is no information on the circumstances and the authorship of the abduction, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

source: Alterpresse; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 23 August 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Cite de Dieu, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched drone strikes against gang bases in Village de Dieu, as well as several other neighborhoods of Port-au-Prince (coded separately). In Village de Dieu, seven gang members were killed. 7 fatalities.

On 27 August 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, in the morning, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched drone strikes in the neighborhood. Explosions were heard. Casualties unknown.

On 31 August 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bas Peu de Choses, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched drone strikes on Rue Cameau. The target were likely gang-controlled areas, since it was reported that several gangsters fled towards Carrefour. At least 23 drones were launched across the Bas Peu de Choses, Martissant, Gabelliste, and Grand-Ravine neighborhoods on that day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 31 August 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Cite de Dieu, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched drones against gang bases in Village de Dieu and Martissant 4 (coded separately). There has not been an official report of the potential fatalities. Residents indicated that gang members fled during the offensive, causing panic in the area. Casualties unknown.

On 31 August 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Gabelliste/Grand Cimetiere, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched drone strikes in the neighborhood near the cemetery. The target were likely gang-controlled areas, since it was reported that several gangsters fled towards Carrefour. At least 23 drones were launched across the Gabelliste, Martissant, Grand-Ravine, and Bas Peu de Choses neighborhoods on that day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 31 August 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Grand Ravine, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched drone strikes in the Grand Ravine neighborhood. The target were likely gang-controlled areas, since it was reported that several gangsters fled towards Carrefour. At least 23 drones were launched across the Grand-Ravine, Martissant, Gabelliste and Bas Peu de Choses neighborhoods on that day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 31 August 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Martissant, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched drones against gang bases in Martissant 4 and Martissant 2A neighborhoods. There has not been an official report of the potential fatalities. Residents indicated that gang members fled during the offensive, causing panic in the area. At least 23 drones were launched across the Martissant, Grand Ravine, Gabelliste, and Bas Peu de Choses neighborhoods on that day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 2 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Martissant, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched drones against a Base 5 Secondes Gang base. They also launched a strike against gang-controlled areas in Fontamara (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2025-)
source: Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 29 August 2025, off the Coast of Cap-Haitien, Nord, members of the U.S. Coast Guard arrested 191 Haitian nationals in international waters as they were trying to enter the U.S. territory illegally. After appropriate care and processing, the Haitians were deported back to Haiti on 2 September.

On 29 August 2025, near Fer A Cheval, Centre, the police clashed with gang members at the Montagne de la Grace base, which had been under gang control. The police regained control of the base and seized several weapons. The gangsters occupied the area again on 1 September (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 31 August 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 33, Ouest, in the morning, police forces clashed with three gang members during a kidnapping attempt against a man whom they had forced into a car. The gang members were injured by the bullets, although they managed to flee the scene. The victim was released unharmed and the kidnapping was thwarted. 3 injured.

On 1 September 2025, near Fer A Cheval, Centre, overnight, the police and members of self-defense brigades clashed with gang members at the Morne de la Grace base. The gangsters took control of the area, injuring several police officers and self-defense group members. The base had been under police control after armed clashes of 29 August (coded separately). Several injured.

actor2: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 4 September 2025, in Liancourt, Artibonite, the police, supported by self-defense groups, clashed with members of the Base Gran Grif de Savien Gang. Between 4 and 5 September, these clashes resulted in around 15 gang members killed, including a gang lieutenant. Four members of self-defense groups and several police officers were injured. The police seized a weapon and a motorcycle at the scene. At least 15 fatalities split across two events. 8 fatalities coded here. At least 4 injured.

actor2: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 5 September 2025, in Liancourt, Artibonite, for a second consecutive day, the police, supported by self-defense groups, clashed with members of the Base Gran Grif de Savien Gang. Between 4 and 5 September, these clashes resulted in around 15 gang members killed, including a gang lieutenant. One source stated that the killed gangsters were affiliated with the Kokorat San Ras Gang, unlike the majority of the media, which identified them as Base Gran Grif de Savien Gang members. Four members of self-defense groups and several police officers were injured. The police seized a weapon and a motorcycle at the scene. At least 15 fatalities split across two events. 7 fatalities coded here. At least 4 injured.

On 24 August 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched drone strikes against gang bases in several neighborhoods, including Village de Dieu (Cite de Dieu neighborhood) (coded separately). Witnesses indicated there were fatalities. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 24 August 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Cite de Dieu, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched drone strikes against gang bases in Village de Dieu, as well as several other neighborhoods of Port-au-Prince (coded separately). Witnesses indicated there were fatalities. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 29 August 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Musseau-Delmas 48, Ouest, around 10 people held a protest in front of the Villa D'Accueil over unspecified demands.

On 22 August 2025, around Tabarre - Aeroport Toussaint Louverture, Ouest, the police shot and killed two female cousins near the airport over wrong accusations that they had ties with the Viv Ansanm Gang. The victims' family denounced the police error. 2 fatalities.

On 8 August 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 75, Ouest, in the morning, unidentified armed individuals beat a man as they attempted to force him into their car to kidnap him. The kidnapping attempt happened in the Lespinasse area. It is unknown if the man was abducted or not. There were no fatalities.

On 25 August 2025, in Petion Ville - Bois-Moquette, Ouest, unidentified gang members attacked a couple inside their home. The couple had been living abroad in the US and had recently returned to Haiti. The wife was killed (methods unspecified) while her husband was severely injured and brought to hospital. The gang members stole a Jeep and other personal belongings from the property. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

On 31 August 2025, in Kenscoff - Nan Cofi, Ouest, overnight, at least 16 gang members carried out an attack against the Gelin locality, located within the Belle Fontaine communal section (Kenscoff's 4th communal section), and subsequently near the Nan Cofi neighborhood. The gang members set fire to dozens of farmers' houses after looting them. Gunshots were heard, causing residents to flee their homes. Casualties unknown.
