Looting: Around 27 August 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Nazon, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition looted the Union Baptist Church of Nazon.
Other: On 22 August 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, in the afternoon, gunshots were heard in the Delmas 30 neighborhood. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 22 August 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, in the afternoon, gunshots were heard in the Christ-Roi neighborhood. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 28 August 2025, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, in the morning, gunshots were heard in the Sarthe and in the Terre Noire/Blanchard neighborhoods, between Carrefour Vincent and Rue Hubert. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 28 August 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, in the morning, gunshots were heard in the Tete de l'Eau neighborhood. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 2 September 2025, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, in the afternoon, gunshots were heard in the Sarthe neighborhood. Unidentified armed individuals were seen on the National Road 1 in the area, although there is no information on the circumstances of the gunshots.

Other: On 2 September 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, in the afternoon, gunshots were heard in the Cazeau neighborhood (Tabarre - Cazeau/Tabarre 14). There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2025-)
source: Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Trip Foumi
notes: Movement of forces: Around 31 August 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the U.S. government, following an agreement with the Haitian government, deployed an unspecified number of Marines to protect their diplomatic representatives, and support the national police as well as the Multinational Security Support Mission in Haiti (MSS) in the fight of gangs.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: Property destruction: On 1 September 2025, in Gonaives, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang looted and set fire to houses.

On 2 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Musseau-Delmas 48, Ouest, over 20 disabled people, holding signs, held a sit-in protest in front of the Prime Minister's office, in Villa D'Accueil, to demand the payment of ten months of allowances from the Social Welfare Fund (CAS). They demanded that Prime Minister intervene to resume the institution's activities and ensure the immediate payment of their benefits.

On 3 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Deprez, Ouest, employees of the Social Welfare Fund (CAS) protested in front of the Anti-Corruption Unit (ULCC) office to denounce the poor management of the institution's director. The protesters denounced that the institution provides funding to organizations and individuals connected to a former congressman candidate. They also demanded the payment of six months of pending salaries.

source: Alterpresse; El Nacional (Dominican Republic); Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Vi Free Press
notes: On 7 September 2025, in Cabaret, Ouest, the police and members of self-defense groups clashed with members of the Viv Ansanm coalition, including members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang, killing a gang leader and other gang members. Following the killing, members of the Arcahaie self-defense group burned two cars belonging to the Base 5 Secondes Gang. The gangsters attacked the Laboderie locality on 11 September in retaliation (coded separately). At least 1 fatality.

On 6 September 2025, in Kenscoff, Ouest, overnight, members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang clashed with police forces, after the gang launched an attack on the commune. Gunfire was heard in the Fermathe, Teleco, Viard and Centre-Ville areas. Police forces were able to repel the gang members. Casualties unknown.

On 5 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bas Peu de Choses, Ouest, in the evening, police forces clashed with members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang during a police operation that was launched to regain control of the Centre Ville area of Port-au-Prince. The operation took place on Capois street, Chavanne street, and Christophe avenue. Gunshots were heard in the area and several gang members were killed by police. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 7 September 2025, in Bercy, Ouest, in the evening, police forces clashed with members of the Canaan Gang and the Base 5 Secondes Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) as they attacked residents in the locality, killing 15 gang members before forcing the rest of criminals to leave the area. Before leaving, the criminals opened indiscriminate fire and injured 11 civilians (seven women and four men). 15 fatalities, 11 injured.
On 8 September 2025, in Bercy, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, police forces clashed with members of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition. Casualties unknown.

On 9 September 2025, in Bercy, Ouest, for the third consecutive day, police forces clashed with members of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition. A roadblock made up of cars was erected on National Road 1, likely by the gangsters to prevent police forces from accessing the area. The roadblock was erected two days before a large-scale attack by the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition on Labodrie village in the commune (coded separately). The roadblock lasted until 17 September. Casualties unknown.

source: Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network; Trip Foumi
notes: On 6 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, the police clashed with members of the Viv Ansanm gang members. During the incident, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) also launched air drone strikes aimed to be against the gang members, that killed at least 11 civilians. It is unclear if gang members were injured or killed during the operation. At least 11 fatalities.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; SG Alert (Whatsapp); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 9 September 2025, in Tabarre - Carrefour Fleuriot, Ouest, in the afternoon, members of the Kraze Barye Gang shot and killed a police officer (likely off-duty since he was in a non-police car with civilians), another man, and a woman as they were exiting a vehicle in the Tabarre 48 neighborhood. The two men were police agents. 3 fatalities.

On 9 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Turgeau, Ouest, suspected members of the Viv Ansanm Gang killed three brothers at their home at the intersection of Jean Paul II and N avenue. They temporarily kept other members of the family hostages (including women and children), before letting them go. They then burned their bodies. 3 fatalities.

source: AFP; Alterpresse; BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; El Nacional (Dominican Republic); Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network; Trip Foumi; Vi Free Press
notes: On 11 September 2025, in Labodrie, Ouest, the Base 5 Secondes Gang and the Canaan Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm gang coalition) killed at least 50 people (at least 23 men, 13 women, four boys, and two girls) and injured at least 25 (17 women and eight men). The incident happened in retaliation for the killing of one of their leaders during a clash between the police and self-defense group members, and the gangsters on 7 September (coded separately). The gangsters used firearms and bladed weapons to kill residents of the village, including women, children, as well as elders. A four-year-old and most of his family were killed. Additional residents were reported missing. 70 houses were burned down by the gangsters. Many residents were not able to flee the area despite previous warnings of a potential attack. Another report indicates that police and self-defense groups tried to hold the gangsters off during the attack, while others indicate the gangsters were still on site and residents were requesting for the authorities' support after the incident. At least 50 fatalities, at least 25 injured.
Property destruction: On 8 September 2025, in Kenscoff - Godet, Ouest, gang members set fire to several homes and stole farmers' belongings.

Property destruction: On 1 September 2025, near Delmas - Delmas 30, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition cut and stole high tension electrical lines, before retreating with them to Delmas 30 neighborhood.

Non-violent activity: On 7 September 2025, in Mirebalais, Centre, in the afternoon, barricades of flaming tires were erected (likely by Mawozo and Taliban Gang members due to recent context) in front of Mirebalais University Hospital. This took place after the leader of the 400 Mawozo Gang had released a video earlier that week, threatening to burn down the hospital if police were to use drone strikes against his gang and the Taliban gang. The hospital was not damaged.

Other: On 8 September 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, a roadblock made up of two cars was set up on Jean Gilles street (Delmas - Carrefour Drouillard/Parc Industriel street). There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblock or who set it up.

Other: On 4 September 2025, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, around midday, gunshots were heard near Carrefour Vincent. Armored police vehicles were seen in the area, although there is no information on the circumstances of the gunshots.
Other: On 6 September 2025, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, in the morning, gunshots were heard near Lilavois 36. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 8 September 2025, in Kenscoff, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Madeleine area. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 10 September 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, in the afternoon, gunshots were heard near Nerette. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
On 4 September 2025, in Petion Ville - Centre Ville (Ouest), Ouest, in the morning, residents protested on Lamarre street and marched towards St Pierre square, over unspecified demands.
On 8 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Musseau-Delmas 48, Ouest, a small group of residents protested in front of the Villa D'Accueil over unspecified demands.

source: Impulse Web Medias; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 16 September 2025, in Bois Neuf, Artibonite, the Jean-Denis Gang (a.k.a. La Coalition), in support of police forces, shot and killed two gang members during a clash. The victims were identified as leaders of the Deluge Gang. Another version identified one gangster as the leader of the Kokorat San Ras Gang at their Tibwadom base. A weapon was seized. The killings motivated the burning of the Montrouis police station by Deluge gang members later that day (coded separately). 2 fatalities.

On 16 September 2025, in Gonaives, Artibonite, police forces shot and killed the leader of the Former Artibonite Resistance Front, a rebel group that had been involved in the 2004 Haitian coup d'etat, and another man inside their car in the Canal Bois locality. Police forces claimed that the man had opened fire on police officers at a police checkpoint, prompting the police officers to shoot back at the car, hitting both men with several gunshots. Another source had initially reported that the shooting was tied to an ongoing land conflict. The killing prompted violent demonstrations in Gonaives that same day and in the following days (coded separately). 2 fatalities.

On 16 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Canape-Vert, Ouest, police forces opened fire on a motorcyclist after he refused to stop at a police checkpoint. Three other bystanders were hit by bullets, including an elderly street vendor who died at the scene. The two other victims were brought to hospital in critical condition. 1 fatality, 2 injured.

On 15 September 2025, in Arcahaie, Ouest, in the afternoon, unidentified gang members attacked the commune. This took place following a large-scale attack by the Viv Ansanm Gang Coalition in Labodrie three days earlier (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; AP; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 18 September 2025, in Bassin Bleu, Nord-Ouest, around 60 members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang coming from Tibwadom (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) attacked the Bassin Bleu commune. The gang members opened fire in the streets, killing several civilians, including one identified as a teacher, whose body was burned. The gangsters set the police station on fire. Between two to three police officers were inside at the moment of the attack. They also ransacked other buildings including the town hall, a credit union, as well as civilian houses and their cars. The criminals abducted several people including employees from the credit union, before withdrawing from the commune. By 22 September, several kidnapped victims had been released in exchange of ransom. The whereabouts of the other abducted victims are unknown. On 19 September, police forces announced they had regained control of the Bassin Bleu police station. The gang offensive was described as a reprisal for a prior police operation in an area close to the gang's base in Tibwadom. At least 1 fatality.

source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: Looting: On 17 September 2025, on the Coast of Leogane, Ouest, a group of armed individuals stole two boats carrying goods from the port. Police forces retrieved the boats the next day during an operation.

source: Impulse Web Medias; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network; SG Alert (Whatsapp); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 16 September 2025, in Montrouis, Artibonite, members of the Deluge Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) attacked the town of Montrouis in reprisal for the killing of two of their leaders in Bois Neuf earlier that day (coded separately). The gangsters burned down the Montrouis police station and the market square. Police officers inside the building managed to escape the premises, but the building was destroyed. Casualties unknown.
Non-violent activity: Around 11 September 2025 (as reported), in Kenscoff, Ouest, gang members were seen parading through the Belo neighborhood as a show of force, alongside a rara band.

source: Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 16 September 2025, in Saint-Michel-de-l'Atalaye, Artibonite, hundreds of residents and members of a civil society organization took to the streets to demand the resignation of the interim municipal executive agent, who they accused of having badly managed the commune for ten years and of living abroad in the U.S. despite his role. Protesters called for an investigation into his mismanagement and also denounced the unsanitary conditions of the commune and lack of drainage systems. Protesters shut the doors to the municipal building and blocked the road towards the North of the country. The roadblock lasted at least three days.
On 16 September 2025, in Milot, Nord, residents protested to denounce eviction threats.

On 16 September 2025, in Gonaives, Artibonite, a member of Former Artibonite Resistance Front and other armed men took to the streets following the killing of the former leader of the Resistance Front earlier that day at a police checkpoint (coded separately). The Former Artibonite Resistance Front member claimed that the Artibonite departmental director of police was involved in the killing and called for justice. Heavy gunfire was heard in several neighbourhoods. Barricades of flaming tires were erected on Clerveau and Louverture streets.

On 17 September 2025, in Gonaives, Artibonite, hundreds of residents led by a member of Former Artibonite Resistance Front and other armed men took to the streets to demonstrate against the killing of the former leader of the Resistance Front the day before (coded separately). Demonstrators decried the killing as a police execution and called for an investigation. Demonstrators erected barricades in the streets. Gunshots were heard in the centre of Gonaives.

On 18 September 2025, in Gonaives, Artibonite, for the second consecutive day, residents led by a member of Former Artibonite Resistance Front and other armed men took to the streets to demonstrate against the killing of the leader of the Former Artibonite Resistance.

source: Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 19 September 2025, in Gonaives, Artibonite, for the third consecutive day, hundreds of residents led by a member of Former Artibonite Resistance Front and other armed men took to the streets to demonstrate against the killing of the leader of the Former Artibonite Resistance Front days before (coded separately). Demonstrators decried the killing as a police execution and called for an investigation. Demonstrators erected barricades of flaming tires in the streets. Gunshots were heard during the mobilization. They were likely the authorship of the armed men taking part in the mobilization.

On 18 September 2025, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, residents demonstrated outside of the Cap Haitien Customs office, in support of the Director of the Customs office who had been transferred to another office. Demonstrators erected barricades of flaming tires in the street.

source: Alterpresse; AP; El Pais; Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network; UNSC; Vi Free Press
notes: On 20 September 2025, in Delmas - Pele Simon, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched two drone strikes against the leader of the Djouma Gang and their accomplices in the Pele Simon neighborhood. The zone was described as under the control of the Viv Ansanm Gang. According to witnesses, the strikes were launched as the local gang leader was distributing presents among children as part of celebrations linked to his birthday. There were at least 21 fatalities (16 were identified as civilians and at least four were gang members) and 41 injured (23 gang members and 18 civilians). The gang leader (intended target) escaped unharmed. At least 21 fatalities, at least 41 injured.

On 23 August 2025, in Petion Ville - Laboule, Ouest, in the afternoon, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched a drone strike against gang bases near the Laboule and Thomassin neighbourhoods. The detonations were heard by witnesses in Laboule, Petionville and nearby areas. Security forces also launched strikes in Village de Dieu (Cite de Dieu neighbourhood) (coded separately). Witnesses indicated there were fatalities. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 15 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, in the morning, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched drone strikes in the center of Port-au-Prince. Explosions were heard in the Champs de Mars and Portail Leogane areas (coded separately). Gunshots were also heard in the same neighbourhoods (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 15 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Portail Leogane/Cite Louverture, Ouest, in the morning, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched drone strikes in the center of Port-au-Prince. Explosions were heard in the Portail Leogane and Champs de Mars areas (coded separately). Gunshots were also heard in the same neighbourhoods (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 25 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, in the afternoon, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched several drone strikes in the southern area of the city, including in Pacot (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 25 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Pacot, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched a drone strike. Casualties unknown.

source: Haiti Standard; PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: On 13 September 2025, in Kenscoff - Obleon, Ouest, overnight, the Base 5 Secondes Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) attacked and burned a police and military armored vehicle with Molotov cocktails in the Morne-Tranchant area. At least two police officers were injured, while a civilian man working as a mechanic for the National Police was killed. Self-defense brigades coming from several localities in Kenscoff arrived to help the victims. Police reinforcements attended the area and clashed with the criminals, killing several. 1 fatality, at least 2 injured.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Alterpresse; Metropole; ReliefWeb; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 15 September 2025, in Liancourt, Artibonite, in the early morning, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang set fire to the Liancourt police station, forcing police agents to leave the building. The gangsters also set fire to the Peace Court building. An unspecified number of fatalities were registered, and thousands of residents were displaced. Clashes to recover the police station were later registered between the gang members and the police. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 22 September 2025, in L'Estere, Artibonite, self-defense group members from Kapenyen engaged in clashes with the Kokorat San Ras Gang, who had attacked the commune earlier that day (coded separately). The self-defense brigade managed to expel the gangsters after several hours of clashes. Casualties unknown.

On 18 September 2025, in Petion Ville - Cargo, Ouest, in the evening, members of the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) clashed with members of a self-defence brigade near Freres Road. Gang members were seen in the Cargo and Lakou Zaboka areas, and gunshots were heard in Cargo and Metivier. The clashes ended later in the evening. Casualties unknown.

On 21 September 2025, around Gros-Morne, Artibonite, police forces engaged in clashes with the Kokorat San Ras Gang at the height of the Pelitye area (Gros-Morne commune). Several gang members, wearing red clothes, were neutralized. It was not clarified if they were injured or killed. Casualties unknown.
On 20 September 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Joseph Janvier, Ouest, armed clashes were recorded between unidentified individuals in the Delmas 19 neighbourhood. Casualties unknown.

On 20 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Pacot, Ouest, in the late afternoon, armed clashes were recorded between unidentified armed individuals in the Pacot neighbourhood. Gunshots were heard and tear gas was used in the neighbourhood. Casualties unknown.

On 20 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Turgeau, Ouest, in the late afternoon, armed clashes were recorded between unidentified armed individuals in the Turgeau neighbourhood. Gunshots were heard and tear gas was used in the neighbourhood, near Charles Sumner avenue and the Sacre Coeur church. Casualties unknown.
On 24 September 2025, in Kenscoff, Ouest, in the evening, armed clashes were reported in Kenscoff commune. There is no further information regarding the clashes. Casualties unknown.

On 18 September 2025, in Petion Ville - Thomassin, Ouest, unidentified gang members clashed with members of a self-defence brigade in Zone Planchet (Thomassin neighbourhood). The gang members set five houses on fire. Casualties unknown.

location: Petion Ville - Fatima - Lakou Normil de Pernier
source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 30 January 2024, in Petion Ville - Fatima - Lakou Normil de Pernier, Ouest, in the morning, the 400 Mawozo Gang invaded and attacked residents in the Fatima neighborhood (close to the Kraze Barye Gang base). Several people were killed and many residents were displaced. The attack happened amidst clashes between the 400 Mawozo and the Kraze Barye Gang. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 14 September 2025, in Labodrie, Ouest, members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) killed 10 moto taxi drivers along the National Road 1. The attack happened at the height of Labodrie (between Cabaret and Archaie). The gang members looted and set fire to several properties. 10 fatalities.

source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole
notes: On 20 September 2025, around Lacroix-Perisse, Artibonite, overnight, the Kokorat San Ras Gang attacked the Kapenyen and the Kay Kayou locality (L'Estere commune). The gang members opened fire, forcing residents and farmers to leave their houses, which were set on fire moments later. No fatalities were reported, although several cattle animals were killed, and several dozen civilians were injured. 20 injured.

source: Alterpresse; Metropole; Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 21 September 2025, around Lacroix-Perisse, Artibonite, for a second consecutive day, the Kokorat San Ras Gang attacked the Kapenyen locality (L'Estere commune). The gang members opened fire, forcing residents and farmers to leave their houses, which were set on fire moments later. A church was also burned. No fatalities were registered during the attack, although there were several civilians injured. Several rice mills were burned. Several injured.

On 22 September 2025, in L'Estere, Artibonite, in the morning, the Kokorat San Ras Gang shot and killed a person and injured more than four as they attacked the commune. Up to 20 houses were set on fire. The gang members had blocked the National Road 1 moments before the attack. The offensive was a reprisal against residents for the blockade of the National Road to prevent the criminals from free movement in the commune (coded separately). The gang members were seen in a video sending challenging messages to the leader of the Kapenyen locality self-defense group. Hours later, the self-defense group leader shared another video entering L'Estere after clashes with the gangsters (coded separately). 1 fatality, at least 4 injured.

source: Amerique Info 7; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 24 September 2025, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, two armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a lawyer man as he was driving along the Espagnole street (drive-by). The shooters fled the scene. The victim was a member of the Fort-Liberte bar and led a lawyer's cabinet. Suspectedly, the attack could be linked to his work. He was involved in a lawsuit seeking compensation for three victims of a road accident. The case had motivated a conflict with a pastor involved in the accident. The pastor was arrested for interrogation on 25 September. A cousin of the victim and wife of the current President of the Fort-Liberte bar was also arrested. On 29 September, three additional people were arrested, including the main perpetrator. 1 fatality.

On 14 July 2025, in Villard, Artibonite, overnight, armed group members from Savien (GCO de Savien) attacked several areas in Villard, including Bofo, Savari, Letan, and Fouje, as well as nearby Ponte Sonde (coded separately). Gunshots were heard. Several people were killed, while others were kidnapped. Their whereabouts are unknown. During the attack, a voodoo temple was looted in Letan area. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 14 July 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, overnight, armed group members from Savien (GCO de Savien) attacked Ponte Sonde and several areas in nearby Villard (coded separately). Gunshots were heard. Several people were killed, while others were kidnapped. Their whereabouts are unknown. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

Weapons seizure: On 26 August 2025, in Carrefour Desruisseaux, Nippes, police forces intercepted a truck driver transporting several firearms, ammunition, and equipment towards Les Cayes. The seizure included cartridges, chargers, bulletproof vests, and several spare parts for the assembly of weapons. The driver was arrested.

Property destruction: Around 18 September 2025 (between 15 - 21 September), in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, gang members destroyed a police station. The property destruction was described as a reprisal for the killing of gang members in recent weeks.

On 13 September 2025, in Petion Ville - Thomassin, Ouest, in the evening, residents invaded the police station in an attempt to lynch a suspected gang member, who had been arrested earlier that day. Footage was shared on social media but it is unknown if the lynching actually took place. Casualties unknown.
Other: On 21 September 2025, in Plaisance, Nord, a trailer was used as a roadblock on National Road 1. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the roadblock.

Other: Around 22 September 2025 (as reported), in L'Estere, Artibonite, residents set up a roadblock along the National Road 1 to prevent the Kokorat San Ras Gang from free movement in the commune. The roadblock motivated a gang reprisal on 22 September (coded separately).

Other: On 17 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, in the afternoon, gunshots were heard in the Morne a Tuf neighbourhood near the Sylvio Cator stadium. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 18 September 2025, in Savane Carree, Artibonite, unidentified individuals erected a roadblock on National Road 6. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the roadblock.
Other: On 18 September 2025, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Santo neighbourhood. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 19 September 2025, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, in the morning, gunshots were heard in the Sarthe neighbourhood, near Carrefour Vincent and in the Radio Commerce area. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 21 September 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, in the afternoon, gunshots were heard near the Police Academy on Freres Road. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 22 September 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, in the afternoon, gunshots were heard in Delmas 19. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 24 September 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, in the afternoon, gunshots were heard on Romain street. There is no information on the circumstances or the authorship of the gunshots.

Non-violent activity: Around 16 September 2025 (as reported), in Montrouis, Artibonite, unidentified individuals erected a roadblock on National Road 1 at the height of Montrouis and Deluge. The roadblock was likely erected by members of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition, who launched an attack on Montrouis the same day (coded separately). The roadblock lasted at least three days.

On 24 September 2025, in Fort-Liberte, Nord-Est, health workers led by the Multi-Purpose Community Health Workers of the Northeast (AASCP-NE) Association, nurses, assistants, accountants, social workers, and housekeepers, among other professionals, held a march with banners to demand the payment of eight months of due salaries.
On 12 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Musseau-Delmas 48, Ouest, in the morning, residents protested in front of the Villa D'Accueil over unspecified demands.

On 21 September 2025, in Gonaives, Artibonite, citizens held a protest to oppose the replacement of the departmental director of police and demanding the creation of a police jurisdiction in the Lower Artibonite to maintain the divisionary commissioner's presence in the department.

On 22 September 2025, in L'Estere, Artibonite, scores of young residents held a protest with banners to decry lack of intervention by the authorities to fight gang violence. Protesters demanded the immediate eradication of armed groups causing insecurity in the Artibonite department.

On 22 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Fort National, Ouest, in the morning, residents protested and erected roadblocks of unspecified materials, after a young man was killed by police in the area.

On 25 September 2025, in the Artibonite department (coded to Gonaives), dozens of residents held a protest in support of the head of the departmental police, and against calls for his departure after the police killing of the leader of the Former Artibonite Resistance Front on 16 September (coded separately).

On 25 September 2025, in Petion Ville - Centre Ville (Ouest), Ouest, militants and supporters of several political organizations held a sit-in protest in front of the Hexagone building (Darguin street) to decry foreign interference in Haitian political affairs. They also decried insecurity.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: Around 15 March 2025 (month of), in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour Feuilles, Ouest, members of the Grand-Ravine Gang and the Base 5 Secondes Gang raped women and girls in the neighborhood, killed an unknown number of them, and set fire to everything they found while crossing the area. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 24 September 2025, in Gonaives, Artibonite, residents and supporters of Former Artibonite Resistance Front and other armed men (some of them wearing masks) took to the streets to demonstrate against the police killing of the leader of the Former Artibonite Resistance Front on 16 September (coded separately). Demonstrators decried the killing as a police execution, asked for the departure of the head of the departmental police, and called for an investigation. Demonstrators erected barricades of flaming tires in the streets. Gunshots were heard during the mobilization. This was likely authorship of the armed men taking part in the demonstration.

On 24 September 2025, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, residents held a demonstration to decry the killing of a lawyer man earlier that day (coded separately). Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires.

On 25 September 2025, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, residents erected a roadblock of tree trunks on National Road 6 before setting them on fire, to demonstrate against the killing of a lawyer in Ouanaminthe the day before (coded separately). The roadblock was removed later that day.

On 17 July 2025, in Tabarre - Carrefour Fleuriot, Ouest, Viv Ansamn gang members abducted a young woman. A 100,000 gourdes ransom was paid by her mother, although the kidnappers demanded additional money. The woman remained in captivity at least until September 2025 after her family was unable to pay. Her whereabouts are unknown.

On 3 October 2025, near Plaisance, Nord, in the morning, armed gang members abducted two female passengers from a bus belonging to the Rotation Tours Company on the National Road 1, at the height of Morne Bedoret. The bus was intercepted while transporting around 40 passengers between Cap-Haitien and Port-au-Prince. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 8 July 2025, near La Ville, Artibonite, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang engaged in clashes with the Jean-Denis Gang (a.k.a. Coalition Jean-Denis) in the Beaufort rural community. Casualties unknown.

Around 27 September 2025 (weekend of), in Cite Soleil - Sarthe, Ouest, police forces engaged in clashes with gang members in Carrefour Vincent, interrupting road traffic along the National Road 1. Casualties unknown.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 1 October 2025, in Carrefour Paye, Artibonite, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang engaged in clashes with police forces and self-defense group members. During clashes, at least six gangsters were killed and two self-defense group affiliates were injured. More than 15 properties were burned, including the house of a former deputy and former Education minister. At least 6 fatalities, 2 injured.

On 19 August 2025, in Roseaux, Grand-Anse, armed individuals executed and decapitated a man at his home, in the Larak locality, and took the corpse away. The man was killed in front of her wife. The attack was in reprisal for a previous altercation between the victim and a young man. It was described as a case of vigilante justice 1 fatality.

Security measures: On 29 September 2025, in the Nord-Est department (coded to Fort-Liberte), the authorities at the Nord-Est government's delegation imposed a temporary suspension of firearm carrying permits in the department. The decision aimed at improving the security situation in the Nord-Est department. It was expected to be in force until further notice.

Weapons seizure: Around 26 September 2025 (between 25 - 26 September), in Terre Rouge, Centre, police forces seized five trucks transporting pieces of firearms, a gun, and an assault rifle. At least an individual was arrested.

Weapons seizure: Around 26 September 2025 (between 25 - 26 September), near Belle-Anse, Sud-Est, police forces seized four trucks transporting pieces of firearms, a gun, and an assault rifle. At least an individual was arrested.

Around 10 September 2025 (as reported), around Roseaux, Grande-Anse, a mob of individuals lynched a man whom they accused of having stolen cattle heads. It was not clarified if he was injured or killed. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; AP; BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Gazette Haiti; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole
notes: Other: On 30 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) approved the deployment of a Gang Suppression Force in Haiti (FSG) aiming at supporting the National Police of Haiti in the fight against gang violence in replacement of the Multinational Security Support Mission (MMSS), which mandate expired on 2 October 2025. The FSG is planned to consist of a 12-month deployment of 5,550 security forces and 50 civilians from a number of countries willing to contribute. The new force was proposed and co-sponsored by the United States and Panama in August, and became operational on 15 October.

On 21 September 2025, in Les Cayes, Sud, scores of teachers held a protest in front of the National Education departmental office to decry the non-implementation of an agreement signed with the government in January, as well as to demand the payment of due salaries, among other labor-related claims.

On 29 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Musseau-Delmas 48, Ouest, a group of displaced residents from the Carrefour Feuilles neighborhood held a sit-in protest next to the Primature and the Villa D'Accueil building to decry poor living conditions at place used as shelters. They also demanded the authorities to take action in the face of insecurity.

On 30 September 2025, in Gros-Morne, Artibonite, hundreds of residents marched with banners and tree branches and held a sit-in protest in front of the commune's police station to demand more resources for the national police to fight insecurity and gang violence. Protesters also claimed to support the head of the departmental police. The march was joined by several local authorities from the commune.

On 1 October 2025, in Gonaives, Artibonite, overnight, relatives and partisans of the leader of the Former Artibonite Resistance Front demanded justice for his killing by police forces on 16 September (coded separately). The protest took place in the Raboto neighborhood during his funeral wake.

On 2 October 2025, in Gonaives, Artibonite, supporters and partisans of the leader of the Former Artibonite Resistance Front, most of them carrying firearms, took to the street to decry his killing by police forces on 16 September (coded separately) and calling for justice. They also asked for the departure of the head of the departmental police. The protest was held on the occasion of his funeral.

On 3 October 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, hundreds of residents held a march towards the main facility of the Artibonite Valley Development Organization (ODVA) and back to the Pont Sonde Carrefour to demand justice for the victims of the massacre of 3 October 2024 (coded separately). Protesters blocked the National Road 1 with a dozen barricades (nature unclarified) between Anba Gwomon area and the Pont Sonde market. They claimed that the road would remain blocked until the dismantling of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang. The protest was held on the occasion of the first anniversary of the massacre and after a religious commemoration event. The mobilization was joined by a government commissioner, as well as by multiple local organizations, including from the farmer sector.
Looting: Around 22 September 2025 (as reported), in Quartier Morin, Nord, members of an unidentified armed group looted residents' properties, stole farmers 'cattle heads, and destroyed their goods.
On 25 September 2025, in the Kenscoff commune, Ouest, armed clashes were registered. There is no information on the actors and circumstances of the confrontations. Casualties unknown.
Other: On 26 September 2025, in Moron, Grande-Anse, a roadblock was set up on the Moron road in the La Ferme locality. There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblock or who set it up.
Other: On 26 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Pacot. There is no information on the circumstances and authorship of the gunshots.

On 26 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bas Peu de Choses, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched several drone strikes, including on Cameau street. Casualties unknown.

Other: On 26 September 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, in the morning, gunshots were fired in Torcelle. The gunfire was heard in Puits Blain and Delmas 75. There is no information on the circumstances and authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 27 September 2025, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, gunshots were heard on Hubert street in Terre Noire. Police armored vehicles were present, although the authorship of the gunshots was not clarified.

On 29 September 2025, in Gonaives, Artibonite, members of the population protested to demand justice for the killing of the leader of the Former Artibonite Resistance Front by the police on 16 September (coded separately).

On 29 September 2025, near Belladere, Centre, members of the population demonstrated by blocking the road between Belladere and the border with the Dominican Republic. The demonstrators also threw stones while demanding security in the country.
On 29 September 2025, in Roseaux, Grande-Anse, members of the population protested by erecting a roadblock. The motivation of the protest is unknown.
On 29 September 2025, in Limbe, Centre, members of the population marched to demand the release of an entrepreneur who was kidnapped on 9 September (coded separately).
On 29 September 2025, in Fort-Liberte, Nord-Est, people held a sit-in in front of the court to demand justice for a lawyer killed in Ouanaminthe the previous week (coded separately).
On 29 September 2025, in Petit-Goave, Ouest, members of the population protested by erecting a roadblock. The motivation of the protest is unknown.
Non-violent activity: On 29 September 2025, in Cite Soleil - Sarthe, Ouest, the police set up a roadblock in Carrefour Vincent using an armored vehicle. The motivation of the roadblock is unclear.

On 29 September 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, an unknown number of people were kidnapped on the Airport Road. Although there is no information on the perpetrators, latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

Looting: On 30 September 2025, in Cite Soleil - Drouillard, Ouest, two trucks were hijacked on Lisius street. The perpetrators are unknown, although gunshots were heard in the area after the incident.

On 30 September 2025, in Petion Ville - Thomassin, Ouest, armed individuals kidnapped an unknown number of residents on their way to their gardens in the Boucan area. Gunshots were also heard in the area, although the circumstances are unclear. The victim(s)' whereabouts are unknown.

On 30 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm gang opened fire on residents near the Departmental Law Enforcement Unit (UDMO) base, injuring at least two people, a vendor and a disabled person. The police intervened, causing a clash. Some residents locked themselves inside their homes while others fled the area. At least 2 injured.

On 1 October 2025, in Delmas - Village W. Lamothe, Ouest, an unknown number of people were kidnapped in Delmas 29. Although there is no information on the circumstances or perpetrators, latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victim(s)' whereabouts are unknown.

On 2 October 2025, in Delmas - Kernizan, Ouest, members of the population demonstrated by erecting barricades of burning tires blocking the road near the Ministry of Public Works, Transport and Communications (MTPTC). They demanded the raise of the minimum wage and the reopening of the Labor and Social Security court.
Other: On 3 October 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Delmas 83. There is no information on the circumstances and authorship of the gunshots.

Around 4 October 2025 (between 3 - 6 October), in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, residents held a protest and blocked the 'Portail des Guepes' area (Northern entry of the city) to decry gang violence. The protest was supported by multiple social and political organizations, and was part of a movement from Pont Sonde calling for the complete cessation of activities until the dismantling of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang. A protest over the same claims was held in Pont Sonde on 3 October (coded separately).

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: Non-violent activity: On 4 October 2025, in Liancourt, Artibonite, armed group members (likely from the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang) set up a roadblock along Liancourt's main road. The commune was repeatedly attacked since the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang assaulted and burned the police station on 15 September (coded separately).

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 4 October 2025, in Liancourt, Artibonite, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang attacked residents in the Estral locality, killing at least 10 civilians among residents and farmers. The gang members set fire to houses and looted businesses. At least 10 fatalities split across two events that occurred in the same location on 4 and 5 October. 5 coded here.

On 5 October 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, residents held a protest and set up barricades along the National Road 1 demanding the dismantling of gangs and their bases. Protests on the same claims were held in Pont Sonde and Saint-Marc since 3 October (coded separately).

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 5 October 2025, in Liancourt, Artibonite, for a second consecutive day, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang attacked residents in the Estral locality, killing at least 10 civilians among residents and farmers. The gang members set fire to houses and looted businesses. At least 10 fatalities split across two events. 5 coded here.

On 6 October 2025, in the Saint-Marc commune, Artibonite, self-defense group members supported by residents coming from Pont Sonde demonstrated and forced the closure of schools (unclear methods) in the commune as they demanded equality for students who have seen their access to education affected by the violence of gangs in areas under gang control. The mobilization was part of a movement aiming at pushing the authorities to take action against the Kokorat San Ras and the Baz Gran Grif de Savien gangs.

source: Alterpresse; El Nacional (Dominican Republic); Gazette Haiti; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Listin Diario
notes: On 6 October 2025, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, hundreds of Haitian workers held a protest at the Industrial Development Company (CODEVI) industrial park free zone to decry tax regularization measures approved by the Haitian government. Following the protest, the national authorities temporarily suspended the application of the measures. The protest was part of a labor strike that was expected to end on 8 October.

On 6 October 2025, in Leogane, Ouest, in the morning, hundreds of residents held a demonstration with banners and tree branches and blocked several streets with burning tires to prevent a police armored vehicle from being transferred to Port-au-Prince. The demonstrating residents claimed that the vehicle had contributed in the fight against the 103 Zombies Gang in the commune, and they wanted to keep it.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 8 October 2025, in Liancourt, Artibonite, according to witnesses, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang killed an unknown number of people, looted and set fire to dozens of houses in the Estral locality, forcing residents to flee their properties. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: Property destruction: On 8 October 2025, in Verrettes, Artibonite, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang set fire to residents' houses, forcing several families to flee their homes.

On 8 October 2025, in Des Granges, Nord-Ouest, the Ti Rach Gang set fire to residents' houses and kidnapped several civilians in the Des Granges locality (Desgranges communal section). The whereabouts of the victims are unknown. Casualties unknown.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 9 October 2025, in Liancourt, Artibonite, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang shot and killed at least two people and injured several others during an attack against the commune. One of the victims was identified as a teacher. At least 2 fatalities, several injured.

source: AFP; AP; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 9 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, police forces clashed with members of the Viv Ansamn Gang near the premises of the National Palace. The clash happened while the Transitional Presidential Council and high-ranking government officials held a meeting at the palace. A police armored vehicle was shot, although no human casualties were mentioned. After the clashes were over, the leader of the Viv Ansanm Gang shared a social media video mocking claims that security forces had retaken control of the Champs de Mars area. There were no casualties.

On 9 September 2025, in Limbe, Ouest, a man was kidnapped. Although there is no information on the perpetrators, latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

actor1: Coalition of Revolutionaries to Save the Artibonite Gang
source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: Around 29 April 2025 (as reported), in Preval, Artibonite, members of the Coalition of Revolutionaries to Save the Artibonite Gang (a.k.a. Jean Denis Coalition) riding a motorcycle opened fire in the direction of residents, causing panic among civilians (drive-by). Casualties unknown.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: Property destruction: On 23 June 2025, in La Chapelle, Artibonite, members of the Taliban Gang, affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang Coalition, destroyed what remained from the police station building, which had been set on fire the day prior (coded separately).

source: Ordre des Defenseurs des Droits Humains (ORDEDH); RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 30 June 2025, in Desarmes, Artibonite, police forces and self-defense group members clashed with the 400 Mawozo Gang and the Taliban Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) as members of these gangs attacked the village. Five gang members were shot and killed during the clashes. 5 fatalities.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 1 July 2025, in La Chapelle, Artibonite, the Taliban Gang and the 400 Mawozo Gang kidnapped several people and took them to their bases in Canaan. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

Other: On 4 October 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, a roadblock was set up along the National Road 1. This was likely the authorship of residents' protests demanding the dismantling of gangs and their bases. Protests on the same claims were held since 3 October (coded separately).

source: Rezo Nodwes; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 5 October 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Joseph Janvier, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched at least two drone strikes against the Simon-Pele Gang in Delmas 19, killing several gang members. Police armored vehicles patrolling the Airport Road fired shots in the area. No responding gunshots were registered indicating a clash, although the gunshots went on for half an hour. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 6 October 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, residents held a protest and set up barricades along the National Road 1 demanding the dismantling of gangs and their bases. The protesters threatened to keep the road closed and suspend all activities in public institutions if the issue is not solved. Protests on the same claims were held since 3 October (coded separately).

Other: On 6 October 2025, in Jeremie, Grande-Anse, burning tires were erected in front of the administrative building of the city. There is no information on the circumstances of the barricades or who set them up.

On 8 October 2025, in Savien, Artibonite, in the morning, residents held a protest and set up a roadblock demanding the dismantling of gangs and their bases. Protests on the same claims were held since 3 October (coded separately).

On 8 October 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, in the morning, residents held a protest and set up a roadblock demanding the dismantling of gangs and their bases. Protests on the same claims were held since 3 October (coded separately).

location: Delmas - St Louis de Gonzague- Henfrasa -Palais de l'art
notes: On 8 October 2025, in Delmas - St Louis de Gonzague- Henfrasa -Palais de l'art, Ouest, displaced residents living at shelters in the area held a protest and blocked the Delmas 33 Road, near the Saint Louis de Gonzague school. The motivation of the protest was not clarified, although it was likely related to poor living conditions at shelters or against insecurity and gang violence. Displaced residents have held mobilizations over these claims over the past months (coded separately).

On 8 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Turgeau, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched two drone strikes in Bas Turgeau near the downtown area. Casualties unknown.
On 8 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Turgeau, Ouest, armed clashes were registered. The circumstances and actors involved are unknown. Casualties unknown.

On 9 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bas Peu de Choses, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition killed a teacher man on Nicolas street, when he was travelling in a bus to his workplace at the Petionville National High School (in Fontamara). During the ride, the bus driver stopped at a gang toll booth. According to other passengers, the gangsters executed the man in reprisal for a comment he made criticizing the ransoms imposed to let the driver cross the area. 1 fatality.

Looting: On 10 October 2025, in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, unidentified armed individuals looted the facilities of Radio Tele Evolution Inter. The perpetrators stole several photovoltaic equipment and technical materials.

On 10 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched drone strikes at the bottom of Port-au-Prince. Gunshots were also heard in the area. Casualties unknown.
On 10 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, armed clashes were registered. The circumstances and actors involved are unknown. Casualties unknown.

On 10 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Pacot, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with armed gang members at the intersection of the 6th street and the N Avenue, killing several gangsters. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Rezo Nodwes; Trip Foumi
notes: On 11 October 2025, in Kenscoff - Obleon, Ouest, overnight, police forces engaged in clashes with the Viv Ansanm Gang as the criminals attacked and set fire to the nearby Wynn Farm natural reserve. During clashes, several gang members were killed. No police or civilian casualties were mentioned. The gang members threatened to attack the Camp Zoi area (Obleon). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 11 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Debrosse, Ouest, in the morning, unidentified individuals moving in a vehicle kidnapped a woman in the Debrosse zone (near the border with the Juvenat neighborhood). The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: Around 12 October 2025 (between 11 - 12 October), in the Mirebalais commune, Centre, police forces engaged in clashes with the Viv Ansanm Gang, killing several of its members, as they intervened to expel the criminals from fixed police checkpoints set up by security forces across the Mirebalais region, including the Ledier police station (Northern entry of the city), which was under attack. During clashes, several gang members were killed. According to witnesses, two police agents from the Public Security Bureau (BSAP) were killed by gang members who pretended to be self-defense group affiliates. Gunshots linked to these clashes were heard since 11 October overnight and until 12 October. At least 2 fatalities.

On 13 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Turgeau, Ouest, a drone (likely launched by the Task Force coded as Police forces) fell near the National Sacred Heart Catholic School. The incident caused panic among parents and students, although there is no further information on the circumstances of the event. It was not clarified whether the drone exploded or not. Casualties unknown.

source: Alaso Press; Gazette Haiti; Juno 7; Trip Foumi
notes: Around 14 October 2025 (as reported), in Carrefour - Haut Thor, Ouest, armed individuals killed the operations director of the Haiti Metal S.A. company in Thor 65. She was killed in front of her 4-year-old daughter. The attack occurred after the business's installations had been attacked several times and employees kidnapped. The incident resulted in the company shutting down its operations. 1 fatality.

On 15 October 2025, in L'Estere, Artibonite, members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang attacked residents and stole farmers' rice harvests and destroyed their plantations before opening fire on civilians. Several people were shot and injured and two of them died later that day. The gang members came back the following day to destroy more plantations (coded separately). 2 fatalities, several injured.

On 15 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Musseau-Delmas 48, Ouest, dozens of political militants and activists protested in front of the Villa D'Accueil to demand the departure of the Transitional Presidential Council (CPT). The police intervened throwing tear gas, dispersing the crowd.

Property destruction: On 16 October 2025, in L'Estere, Artibonite, members of the Kokorat Sans Ras Gang set fire to several plantations, including some belonging to self-defense group members. This occurred after they killed two people during an attack the previous day (coded separately). That same day, residents held a protest to denounce the situation (coded separately).

On 16 October 2025, in L'Estere, Artibonite, residents held a protest and erected barricades (nature unclarified) on the Route Nationale 1 to demand a police intervention to put an end to gang violence in the commune. Protesters also demanded the removal of a toll station on the national road, the presence of at least two armored vehicles to regularly patrol the area, and the deployment of the special unit to the area to address the issue. The barricades were removed after long negotiations with the police. The protest occurred after gangsters attacked the area, killing two people on the previous day (coded separately) and destroying residents' plantations on the same day (coded separately).

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 19 March 2025, in Delmas - Cite Numero Un, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched drone airstrikes over the territories of gangs in Delmas 6. This action was also carried out in the Delmas 30, Centre Ville, near Fort-Mercredi, Cite de Dieu, Eglise Baptiste de Bolosse, Martissant, as well as in Grand Ravine neighborhoods (coded separately). In March, police drone airstrike and armed clashes were drones were used resulted in at least 115 gang members killed and 119 injured. At least 115 fatalities split across 22 events. 5 coded here.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 23 March 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bel Air, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) carried out drone strikes against several gang-controlled areas in Bel Air and Bas Delmas (Delmas) (coded separately), killing several gang members. In March, police drone airstrike and armed clashes were drones were used resulted in at least 115 gang members killed and 119 injured. At least 115 fatalities split across 22 events. 5 coded here.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 23 March 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) carried out drone strikes against several gang-controlled areas in Bas Delmas and the Bel Air neighborhood (coded separately), killing several gang members. In March, police drone airstrike and armed clashes were drones were used resulted in at least 115 gang members killed and 119 injured. At least 115 fatalities split across 22 events. 5 coded here.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 1 June 2025, around Port-au-Prince - Cite de Dieu, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched drone airstrikes against gang bases in Village de Dieu (Cite de Dieu neighborhood) and the Grand Ravine neighborhood (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 1 June 2025, around Port-au-Prince - Grand Ravine, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched drone airstrikes against gang bases in the Grand Ravine neighborhood and Village de Dieu (Cite de Dieu neighborhood). Casualties unknown.
On 7 August 2025, in Mirebalais, Centre, gang members clashed with the police in the commune. Casualties unknown.

On 10 September 2025, in Petion Ville - Centre Ville (Ouest), Ouest, unidentified individuals kidnapped two minor sisters at their home in Laboule 12. They were freed on 13 October after the payment of a ransom.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 16 October 2025, near Jean Denis, Artibonite, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang supported by allies from the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition attacked the Chandel locality, which is located next to Jean Denis, and between the Liancourt and Verrettes communes. The gang members burned residents' homes and stole their cattle heads. Members of a local self-defense group (likely from the Jean-Denis Gang, a.k.a. La Coalition) clashed with the gang members during hours to expel them, although they were unable to prevent the occupation and takeover of the area. Casualties unknown

Land seizure: On 17 October 2025, in Montrouis, Artibonite, around 20 members of the 400 Mawozo Gang and the Taliban Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) invaded and took control of Montrouis and Deluge (coded separately) after arriving to these areas using rowboats through the sea. The criminals installed local gang leaders at the Montrouis police station, and set up roadblocks along the National Road 1. No human casualties were caused as a result of the takeover. This was part of a gang mission aimed at installing new local gang leaders after the killing of two gang leaders in Bois Neuf in September (coded separately).

Land seizure: On 17 October 2025, in Deluge, Artibonite, around 20 members of the 400 Mawozo Gang and the Taliban Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) invaded and took control of Montrouis and Deluge (coded separately) after arriving to these areas using rowboats through the sea. The criminals installed local gang leaders at the Montrouis police station, and set up roadblocks along the National Road 1. No human casualties were caused as a result of the takeover. This was part of a gang mission aimed at installing new local gang leaders after the killing of two former gang leaders in Bois Neuf in September (coded separately).

On 17 October 2025, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, hundreds of people from the 'Cri du 20 Septembre' movement led by the head of the Movement of Informed Citizens for Decentralization and Deconcentration (MOCADD), and supported by several organizations, held a protest with banners to decry the government of the Transitional Presidential Council (CPT) and to demand the departure of its members.
On 18 October 2025, in Janvier Artibonite, members of the Taliban Gang set fire to residents' houses and plantations as they attacked the village. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 18 October 2025, in the Fond Des Blancs commune, Sud, unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a police officer as he conducted a search warrant at a property to arrest a woman, in the Gousse locality. The attackers shot from somewhere around the property. It was not clarified whether the perpetrators were linked to the woman who was about to be arrested. A man who was suspected of being the main perpetrator was shot and killed by the police on 24 October (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 18 October 2025, in Desarmes, Artibonite, members of the Taliban Gang attacked the village and clashed with armed members of the population (self-defense group) and police forces, who managed to resist the gang's offensive. During clashes, several gang members were killed and several civilians were injured. Several houses were burned. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
Looting: On 18 October 2025, in Deschapelles, Artibonite, gang members targeted the Albert Schweitzer Hospital (the nature of the event was not clarified), prompting the police to deploy in the area.

Around 19 October 2025 (as reported), in Lascahobas, Centre, police forces shot and killed several armed group members during clashes in the commune. Clashes erupted as the armed individuals tried to invade and take control of the area. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: Around 19 October 2025 (weekend of), in the Artibonite department (coded Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite), the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang engaged in armed clashes with the Taliban Gang and the 400 Mawozo Gang. Many residents fled their homes. Casualties unknown.

Around 19 October 2025 (weekend of), in Verrettes, Artibonite, gang members clashed with armed members of the population (self-defense group) as residents tried to resist a gang attack. Casualties unknown.

On 19 October 2025, in Janvier, Artibonite, for a second consecutive day, gang members (likely from the Taliban Gang) set fire to the village. Members of this gang carried out a similar attack in the area the day prior (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
Property destruction: On 19 October 2025, near Delogne, Artibonite, gang members set fire to the Moriseaux neighborhood, causing material destruction.

On 19 October 2025, between Liancourt and Desarmes (coded to Liancourt), Artibonite, gang members kidnapped an unspecified high number of farmers after invading several rural areas, including Ti Woche, Makay, Bwa Belanje, Rondo, Titon, and Tapyon. Their whereabouts are unknown.

On 20 October 2025, in Gonaives, Artibonite, armed partisans of the leader of the Former Artibonite Resistance Front, who was killed by the police on 16 September (coded separately), held a demonstration calling for the departure of the government commissioner. Gunshots were heard near the Peace Court building. One source stated that the demonstrators attacked the facility (nature of the assault unclarified). Demonstrations over the same claims have been held in Gonaives since the police killing of the mentioned leader (coded separately).

On 20 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Pacot, Ouest, armed clashes were registered. There is no information on the circumstances of the clashes, although security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) launched several drone strikes. Casualties unknown.

Around 20 October 2025 (as reported), in Montrouis, Artibonite, residents held a protest against the presence of around 30 armed individuals coming from Canaan. These individuals were likely members of the 400 Mawozo Gang and the Taliban Gang, who had invaded the commune on 17 October (coded separately).
On 19 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Turgeau, Ouest, overnight, the Viv Ansanm Gang attacked residents in the neighborhood. Casualties unknown.

Around 20 October 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Pacot, Ouest, gang members assaulted the neighborhood (nature of the assault unclarified). On 20 October, the Task Force police launched several drones in Pacot, likely against these gangsters (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
Around 20 October 2025 (as reported), in Carrefour, Ouest, gang members assaulted the neighborhood (nature of the assault unclarified). Casualties unknown.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: Non-violent activity: On 20 October 2025, in Liancourt, Artibonite, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang installed a new gang leader with the aim of taking control of Liancourt and facilitating the takeover of Verrettes.

On 20 October 2025, in Desarmes, Artibonite, gang members (likely from the Taliban Gang, whose members attacked the village two days prior) carried out an attack and clashed with armed members of the population (self-defense group), who managed to resist the gang offensive. Casualties unknown.

Around 21 October 2025 (week of), in Port-au-Prince - Turgeau, Ouest, unidentified individuals kidnapped an unspecified number of people in the neighborhood. There is no information on the circumstances of the abduction, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

Around 21 October 2025 (week of), in Port-au-Prince - Pacot, Ouest, unidentified individuals kidnapped an unspecified number of people in the neighborhood. There is no information on the circumstances of the abduction, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

Around 21 October 2025 (week of), in Kenscoff, Ouest, unidentified individuals kidnapped an unspecified number of people in the neighborhood. There is no information on the circumstances of the abduction, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

On 21 October 2025, in the Verrettes commune, Artibonite, residents armed with stones, bottles, and machetes took to the streets in search of Taliban Gang members who had carried out attacks against several villages in the commune over the past days (coded separately). Several members of the gang and two self-defense group members were killed. At least 2 fatalities.
On 22 October 2025, in Christian, Artibonite, police forces and self-defense group members clashed with gang members, killing several gangsters. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 22 October 2025, in Desarmes, Artibonite, police forces and armed members of the population (self-defense group) clashed with gang members during a security operation aimed at expelling the criminals from several areas in the Verrettes commune. During clashes, more than 10 gangsters were killed. No casualties were registered among security forces, self-defense groups, and the population. At least 10 fatalities.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Trip Foumi
notes: On 22 October 2025, in Delmas - Maguana, Ouest, gang members kidnapped a Catholic priest and reverend and three of his collaborators as they were moving in a vehicle in Delmas 31. The priest belongs to the Saint Claire de Petite Place Cazeau parish and he is the National Director of the Episcopal Commission for Education (CEEC). The abductors contacted the priest's family asking for the payment of a ransom. He was released on 29 October after the payment of an unclarified sum of money. The whereabouts of the other victims are unknown.

On 23 October 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 75, Ouest, in the morning, several hundreds of students from the Jean-Marie Vincent, Antoine Georges Ismery, and Horacius Laventure high schools took to the streets calling for teachers at classrooms and against poor learning conditions at the school centers. Protesting students demanded the Ministry of Education to restore decent conditions. During the mobilization, the students occupied several private schools' facilities and forced students to leave the premises.

On 23 October 2025, in Piatre, Artibonite, armed members of the population affiliated to a local self-defense group clashed with the Taliban Gang and the 400 Mawozo Gang, whose members had invaded the nearby Montrouis commune on 17 October (coded separately). Between 23 and 24 October, four gang members were killed, two were captured, and around 10 were injured. 4 fatalities split across two events. 2 coded here.
On 23 October 2025, in Montrouis, Artibonite, gang members set fire to several houses, forcing residents to leave their properties. Casualties unknown.

On 23 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Musseau-Delmas 48, Ouest, a group of citizens affiliated to the Conviction for Change movement held a sit-in in front of the Villa D'Accueil building to protest against the Presidential Transitional Council (CPT). Police forces intervened and used tear gas to disperse the crowd, preventing the holding of the protest.

Other: On 24 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, in the morning, unidentified individuals set up barricades of burning tires in the Bourdon neighborhood, blocking the roadway. Gunshots were heard, causing panic among the population. There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblock and the authorship of the gunshots.

On 24 October 2025, in Piatre, Artibonite, for a second consecutive day, armed members of the population affiliated to a local self-defense group clashed with the Taliban Gang and the 400 Mawozo Gang, whose members had invaded the nearby Montrouis commune on 17 October (coded separately). Between 23 and 24 October, four gang members were killed, two were captured, and around 10 were injured. 4 fatalities split across two events. 2 coded here.

On 24 October 2025, in Delmas - Valme, Ouest, according to witnesses, unidentified armed individuals in a moving grey vehicle shot and killed a young vendor man at this business stall along the Delmas 31 Road, close to the Radio Tele Galaxie facilities (Valme neighborhood) (drive-by). Motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 13 October 2025, in Delmas - Maguana, Ouest, a woman, her daughter, and her niece were kidnapped in Delmas 31. A car intercepted the vehicle they were traveling in before the kidnapping occurred. The woman was able to phone her family announcing the kidnapping before they were taken. There is no information on the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

On 13 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, armed clashes were registered likely between police forces and unidentified armed groups as police launched anti-gang drone strikes in Turgeau (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 14 October 2025, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, members of the Savien Gang carried out an attack in the Ondo and Premier Pas localities, setting fire to houses and causing panic among the residents. Casualties unknown.
On 14 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, suspectedly a drone strike was launched (likely by the Task Force coded as Police forces). Casualties unknown.

On 15 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Canape-Vert, Ouest, members of two gangs clashed, resulting in the killing of one of the gang's leader after he threatened to create havoc in the neighborhood. 1 fatality.

actor2: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Alterpresse; Gang Suppression Force in Haiti; Haiti Libre; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 17 October 2025, between Verrettes and Pont Sonde (coded to Liancourt), Artibonite, the police, supported by the Gang Suppression Force (FSG), clashed with members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang during an operation aimed at removing roadblocks on the road between Pont Sonde and Verrettes in order to allow the entry of armored vehicles in Pont Sonde, Petite-Riviere and Liancourt police stations to restore safety for residents in those areas. During the intervention, gang members dug trenches and hid inside buildings to throw Molotov cocktails, but were stopped by the security forces. It is unclear if gangsters were killed during the operation, although no officer was killed despite online information stating the contrary. Casualties unknown.
On 17 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched two drone strikes. Casualties unknown.

On 17 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Turgeau, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched a drone strike. Another version suggests that the drone did not explode in the air, and it remains unclear whether an explosion occurred at all. Casualties unknown.
On 17 October 2025, in Tabarre - Torcelle, Ouest, armed clashes were registered. The circumstances and actors involved are unknown. Heavy gunfire was heard throughout the area Casualties unknown.

This occurred after the gang members had killed two people during an attack on 15 October (coded separately) and had set property on fire on 16 October (coded separately).

On 19 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, armed clashes were registered likely between police forces and unidentified armed groups. Gunshots were heard throughout the area. Casualties unknown.

On 19 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Champs de Mars, Ouest, armed clashes were registered likely between police forces and unidentified armed groups. The mobilization was likely part of a series of ongoing protests where students called for teachers at classrooms and against poor learning conditions at the school centers. Protests were also held in Caradeux and Delmas 75 (coded separately). The motivation of the protest is unknown.

Other: On 24 October 2025, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Carrefour Vincent (Sarthe neighborhood). There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
On 24 October 2025, in Delmas - Musseau, Ouest, people protested. The police intervened using tear gas. The motivation of the protest is unknown.
