On 24 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bois Verna, Ouest, people protested at the displaced persons camp at Marie Jeanne school (likely refugees were involved in the demonstration). The motivation of the protest is unknown.

source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 24 October 2025, in Fond Des Blancs, Sud, police forces shot and killed an armed individual who was wanted in connection with the killing of a police officer on 18 October in the Gousse locality (coded separately). 1 fatality.

source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Trip Foumi
notes: On 25 October 2025, in Desarmes, Artibonite, police forces conducted an anti-gang operation and shot and killed several gang members, including a member of the Taliban Gang. A war rifle was seized. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: PNH: National Police of Haiti; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 26 October 2025, in Desarmes, Artibonite, for a second consecutive day, police forces shot and killed several armed individuals during clashes in the commune. They were likely gang members, with whom they had clashed in Desarmes since the day prior (coded separately). Several self-defense group members who supported the police were injured. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 27 October 2025, in Hinche, Centre, residents from the Mirebalais and Saut-d'Eau communes, among others, held a protest demanding the authorities to intervene to calm the suffering of families living in devastated areas. Protesters demanded the Direction of the Civil Protection (DPC) to access and help these areas.

source: PNH: National Police of Haiti; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 27 October 2025, in Lascahobas, Centre, overnight, police forces and self-defense group members clashed with gang members, killing at least 10. Three self-defense group members were injured. At least 10 fatalities, 3 injured.

source: Amerique Info 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 27 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bourdon, Ouest, in the morning, displaced residents held a demonstration with banners at the so-called Colombie Refugees Camp, in Bourdon, to decry the authorities' slowness in responding to their needs at shelters, including insufficient distribution of food kits. The demonstration was held as the government presidential advisor, Lesly Voltaire, and other authorities were visiting the facilities. Demonstrators shouted insults, threw stones, sticks and sandals against the mentioned representatives.

On 27 October 2025, between Carrefour and Port-au-Prince communes (coded to Port-au-Prince - Martissant), Ouest, police forces engaged in clashes with unidentified armed individuals along the National Road 2 between the Carrefour and Port-au-Prince communes (likely in the Martissant neighborhood, which connects both communes), interrupting road circulation between both areas. Casualties unknown.

On 27 October 2025, in the Cayes-Jacmel commune, Sud-Est, a group of residents held a protest outside the police station of the Sousale locality (in the Gayard 2nd communal section) demanding the release of an arrested man who was in custody for having burned his wife alive the night prior. A mob of residents had been about to lynch the man moments before the police arrested him, but the incident was prevented.

On 28 October 2025, in Kenscoff - Obleon, Ouest, overnight, gang members attacked police positions at the Teleco base, in the Morne Tranchant area, leading to several hours of clashes. During clashes, a police officer and several gangsters were killed. Several houses were burned. Police forces managed to maintain the Teleco base under their control. The gang members were likely from the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition, whose members have attacked the Teleco base and the Morne Tranchant area on several occasions in recent months (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3, including the officer killed.

On 29 October 2025, in Gonaives, Artibonite, hundreds of supporters and partisans of the Conviction for Change (KPC) political party held a protest demanding the departure of the Transitional Presidential Council (CPT).

On 29 October 2025, in Montrouis, Artibonite, in the morning, police forces engaged in clashes with the Viv Ansanm Gang along the National Road 1, blocking road traffic and forcing drivers and road users to turn around. Casualties unknown.

On 29 October 2025, in Kenscoff - Obleon, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, gang members clashed with police forces for several hours as the criminals attacked residential areas and burned houses in the Morne Tranchant area. During clashes, several gangsters were killed. The gang members were likely from the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition, whose members have attacked the Morne Tranchant area on several occasions in recent months (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

Property destruction: On 30 October 2025, in Montrouis, Artibonite, armed members of the Taliban Gang set fire to the house of the Montrouis mayor and that of his mother, causing material damage and destruction. No human casualties were registered.

source: Haiti Standard; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Rezo Nodwes; SG Alert (Whatsapp); Trip Foumi
notes: Around 15 July 2025 (month of), in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, a police officer raped a 16-year-old girl while she was in custody at a police station. As of November 2025, the officer was on the run and actively searched by the authorities for arrest.

Around 15 December 2024 (month of), in the arrondissement of Port-au-Prince (coded to Tabarre - Barbancourt), Ouest, unidentified armed individuals attacked a delivery truck belonging to the Rhum Barbancourt S.A. Company, killing four employees. The company has been the target of armed attacks on several occasions since 2021. 4 fatalities.
Around 15 June 2025 (month of), in the city of Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified individuals kidnapped an employee of the Rhum Barbancourt S.A. Company. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

source: Haiti Progres; PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: Around 30 October 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Bicentenaire, Ouest, police forces engaged in clashes with gang members in the Fort Saintclair area (Bicentenaire) and killed a high ranking member of the Olritch Gang and injured the leader of the gang. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

actor2: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 31 October 2025, in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune, Artibonite, the National Police of Haiti (PNH) and the Suppression Gang Force (FSG) clashed with the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang between the Canal sector, Lanmou, and Dofouno areas. Security forces managed to repel the gang members. Casualties unknown.

Other: On 31 October 2025, between Aquin and Saint-Louis du Sud, Sud, residents set up a roadblock on the Route Nationale #2 in the Morne Saint Georges area. The motivation of the roadblock is unknown.

actor2: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 1 November 2025, in the Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune, Artibonite, for a second consecutive day, the National Police of Haiti (PNH) and the Suppression Gang Force (FSG) clashed with the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang between the Canal sector, Lanmou, and Dofouno areas. Security forces managed to repel the gang members. Casualties unknown.

source: Haiti Progres; Rezo Nodwes; Trip Foumi
notes: Property destruction: On 1 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Pacot, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang set fire to the building hosting the facilities of the Soleil d'Haiti University (in Pacot neighborhood) and that of the Radio television Emancipation FM (in Turgeau neighborhood). Both buildings were the property of a former senator who has been the target of threats by the Viv Ansanm Gang. A journalist at the radio station was also known for being critic with the gang coalition.

Property destruction: On 1 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Turgeau, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang set fire to the building hosting the facilities of the Radio television Emancipation FM (in Turgeau neighborhood) and that of the Soleil d'Haiti University (in Pacot neighborhood). Both buildings were the property of a former senator who has been the target of threats by the Viv Ansanm Gang. A journalist at the radio station was also known for being critic with the gang coalition.

source: Haiti Press Network; Haiti Progres; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 2 November 2025, in Delmas - Pele Simon, Ouest, the National Police of Haiti (PNH) and the Suppression Gang Force (FSG) shot and killed several members of the Djouma Gang, including a high-ranking gangster, and injured an unspecified number of others during clashes in the Pele Simon and Village Solidarite neighborhoods (coded separately). This was part of a PNH and FSG joint operation against gangs that included the use of drones charged with explosives (likely launched by the Task Force coded as Police forces). Casualties among civilians were reported, including an university student who was shot in Village Solidarite (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3, including the killed high-ranking gangster.

source: Haiti Press Network; Haiti Progres; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 2 November 2025, in Delmas - Village Solidarite, Ouest, the National Police of Haiti (PNH) and the Suppression Gang Force (FSG) shot and killed several members of the Djouma Gang, including a high-ranking gangster, and injured an unspecified number of others during clashes in the Village Solidarite and Pele Simon neighborhoods (coded separately). This was part of a PNH and FSG joint operation against gangs that included the use of drones charged with explosives (likely launched by the Task Force coded as Police forces). Casualties among civilians were reported, including an university student who was shot in Village Solidarite. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3, including the killed high-ranking gangster. At least 1 injured.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; SG Alert (Whatsapp); Trip Foumi; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 4 November 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 65, Ouest, armed gang members shot and injured a driver working for the Rhum Barbancourt S.A. Company during a kidnapping attempt in Delmas 65. The victim died in hospital due to his wounds. The gang members fled the scene in a stolen vehicle belonging to the company. Another person was also killed at the scene. 2 fatalities.

On 5 November 2025, in Petion Ville - Feca, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals attacked the Fessard area (in the Feca neighborhood) and another zone known as 'Pyron'. During the attack, police forces supported by members of self-defense groups engaged in clashes with the armed men and managed to expel them from the neighborhood. The gangsters also broke into homes, beat up and kidnapped civilians. The victims' whereabouts are unknown. During the clash, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched drone strikes in the Planchet area, near Grenier and the Thomassin neighborhood, as well as Laboule 12 in Fessard (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 5 November 2025, in Petion Ville - Thomassin, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot and killed at least three people in Laboule 12 (in the Fermathe area of the Thomassin neighborhood) (drive-by). There was a lawyer man and a food street vendor woman among the fatal victims. It is unknown who was the intended target of the attack, although one source stated that the shooting did not seem to be linked to general gang activity. The attack in the area has caused residents to flee. At least 3 fatalities.

On 6 November 2025, in Petion Ville - Feca, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, gunshots were heard in the Fessard area (in the Feca neighborhood) and another zone known as 'Pyron' suspectedly as part of clashes between police forces supported by members of self-defense groups and unidentified armed individuals who started an armed incursion in the area on 5 November (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 1 July 2025, in Mariani, Ouest, gang members abducted a 22-year-old woman from a bus and took her to an area known as 'Pandjanmen' (Gressier commune), where she was held captive for two days before being raped and killed. Her body was found on 3 July. It is known that the victim previously had an altercation with one of the gang members soon before being abducted.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 2 July 2025, in Petion Ville - Thomassin, Ouest, the Grand-Ravine Gang and the Base 5 Secondes Gang attacked residents in the neighborhood, killing three men and injuring another one as they tried to flee their homes or while hiding inside their houses. 3 fatalities, 1 injured.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Around 3 July 2025 (between 2 - 3 July), in Gressier, Ouest, gang members raped and beat up a 22-year-old woman who was held hostage in an area known as 'Pandjanmen' (Gressier commune). The woman had been kidnapped from a bus on 1 July in Mariani (coded separately). She was later shot and killed. Her body was found on 3 July. It is known that the victim had been involved in an altercation with one of the gang members soon before being abducted. 1 fatality.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 18 July 2025, in Petion Ville - Thomassin, Ouest, the Grand-Ravine Gang and the Base 5 Secondes Gang attacked residents in the neighborhood and abducted six men. Their whereabouts are unknown.

source: Haiti Press Network; Le Placentin; Trip Foumi
notes: Around 19 July 2025 (between 17 - 20 July), in Jeremie, Grande-Anse, police forces arrested a journalist man over accusations of participation in acts of vandalism against the office of the government commissioner and the peace court. After the accusations were declared inconsistent and no charges remained against the journalist, he remained in prison for no apparent reason for at least four months. The man is known for his critical stances and community work in the commune. He was released on 13 November.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 19 July 2025, in Cite Soleil - Duviviers, Ouest, members of the Pierre VI Gang shot and injured two truck drivers during a hijacking attempt. A 5-year-old girl was shot and injured by a stray bullet. 3 injured.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Gazette Haiti; Ordre des Defenseurs des Droits Humains (ORDEDH)
notes: On 23 July 2025, in Miragoane, Nippes, police forces under the orders of the Miragoane police commissioner, Ernst Muscadin, killed a man who he claimed had been involved in killings and robberies. The killing seemed an extra judicial execution. The man was armed, although the circumstances of the killing were not clarified. 1 fatality.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 15 August 2025, in Desarmes, Artibonite, members of a self-defense group killed a man and a woman suspected of being informants of the Canaan Gang. It was later known that the victims were residents of Saut-d'Eau who went to Desarmes to buy food at the Desarmes Market. 2 fatalities

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 22 August 2025, in the Croix-des-Bouquets commune, Ouest, members of the 400 Mawozo Gang attacked a man in the Bouzy area. The gang members tied him up from hands and feet with a cable, and beat him up before setting him free. The attack took place after a resident informed the gang that the victim had damaged his radio. There were no fatalities.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Around 13 September 2025 (between 11 - 15 September), in the Cite Soleil commune, Ouest, members of the Simon-Pele Gang and the Terre Noire Gang beat up three 10-year-old children and killed another one during an altercation that happened in the context of a football match. 1 fatality.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 13 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour Feuilles, Ouest, a member of the Grand Ravine Gang beat up and killed a woman accused of having used witchcraft to kill another person. A daughter of the victim was also beaten up and gang members burned her feet before releasing her. The gang member demanded a 300,000 gourdes ransom to the deceased's family to recover the body. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Around 15 September 2025 (month of), in Delmas - Pele Simon, Ouest, four armed gang members raped a 17-year-old girl at her home.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 23 September 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Martissant, Ouest, the leader of the Base 5 Secondes Gang ordered the killing a 14-year-old boy who was also a member of the gang after he was informed that he had raped a girl in Martissant A2 (coded separately). The young boy was held captive at a building, where he was beaten up and condemned to death. He was killed that same day in front of the local population. 1 fatality.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: Around 23 September 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Martissant, Ouest, a 14-year-old boy and member of the Base 5 Seconded Gang raped a 9-year-old girl in Martissant A2. The boy was killed in reprisal by the leader of the gang he belonged (coded separately).

On 31 October 2025, in the Arcahaie commune, Ouest, overnight, armed individuals killed three men in the Dig Mate and Senta area (coded separately). The circumstances or motivation of the attack are unknown. 3 fatalities spread across two events. 2 coded here.

On 31 October 2025, near Robergeau, Ouest, overnight, armed individuals killed three men in the Senta and Dig Mate area (coded separately). The circumstances or motivation of the attack are unknown. 3 fatalities spread across two events. 1 coded here.

On 1 November 2025, in Petion Ville - Laboule, Ouest, three people were kidnapped from their home in the Maroutou area. There is no information on the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

source: Haiti Standard; PNH: National Police of Haiti; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 2 November 2025, in the Artibonite department (coded to Gros-Morne), Ouest, police forces arrested a leader of Ti Bwadom Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition). The arrested gangster was described as the right hand of the gang's leader.

Other: On 2 November 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard near Boyer Square (Petion Ville - Centre Ville (Nord) neighborhood). There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Security measures: On 3 November 2025, in the Grande-Anse department (coded to Jeremie), the government declared a three-month state of emergency (SOE) in the Grande-Anse, Sud-Est, Sud, Nippes, Ouest, and Nord-Ouest departments (coded separately). The motivation of the measure was not clarified, although it is likely related to the handling of gang violence.

Security measures: On 3 November 2025, in the Nippes department (coded to Miragoane), the government declared a three-month state of emergency (SOE) in the Nippes, Grande-Anse, Sud-Est, Sud, Ouest, and Nord-Ouest departments (coded separately). The motivation of the measure was not clarified, although it is likely related to the handling of gang violence.

Security measures: On 3 November 2025, in the Nord-Ouest department (coded to Port-de-Paix), the government declared a three-month state of emergency (SOE) in the Nord-Ouest, Ouest, Grande-Anse, Sud-Est, and Sud departments (coded separately). The motivation of the measure was not clarified, although it is likely related to the handling of gang violence.
Other: On 3 November 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Village Solidarite and Pele Simon. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
On 3 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched drone strikes. Casualties unknown.

Security measures: On 3 November 2025, in the Sud department (coded to Les Cayes), the government declared a three-month state of emergency (SOE) in the Sud, Sud-Est, Grande-Anse, Nippes, Ouest, and Nord-Ouest departments (coded separately). The motivation of the measure was not clarified, although it is likely related to the handling of gang violence.

Security measures: On 3 November 2025, in the Sud-Est department (coded to Jacmel), the government declared a three-month state of emergency (SOE) in the Sud, Sud-Est, Grande-Anse, Nippes, Ouest, and Nord-Ouest departments (coded separately). The motivation of the measure was not clarified, although it is likely related to the handling of gang violence.
Other: On 4 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard on Alert Street. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots are unknown.
Looting: On 5 November 2025, in Cite Soleil - Sarthe, Ouest, armed individuals fired shots as they tried to hijack a truck. There is no further information on the incident.

On 5 November 2025, in Petion Ville - Thomassin, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force Police coded as Police forces) launched drone strikes and engaged in clashes with armed individuals in Thomassin 32. The armed individuals were suspected members of gangs based in the nearby Kenscoff commune Casualties unknown.
Other: On 6 November 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Carrefour Drouillard. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
On 6 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched drone strikes in the area. Casualties unknown.

source: Haiti Standard; Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: Land seizure: Around 8 November 2025 (as reported), in Santo, Ouest, the 400 Mawozo Gang assaulted and took over the facilities of a factory belonging to a businessman (described as a member of the economic elite). A video shared on social media showed the leader of the gang within that space. Marijuana and graves with human remains were seen. There were rumors that this motivated police anti-gang operations in the area between 13 and 14 November (coded separately), although the police later denied it and stated that the operations had been planned weeks before.

On 10 November 2025, in Lacroix-Perisse, Artibonite, police forces, supported by armed members of the population (self-defense groups), engaged in clashes with gang members in Lacroix-Perisse, Pierre Payen, Camp-Marie, and Bois Neuf villages (coded separately). Some residents got trapped in their homes during the clashes, that lasted several hours. Casualties unknown.

On 10 November 2025, in Bois Neuf, Artibonite, police forces, supported by armed members of the population (self-defense groups), engaged in clashes with gang members in Bois Neuf, Lacroix-Perisse, Pierre Payen, and Camp-Marie villages (coded separately). Some residents got trapped in their homes during the clashes, that lasted several hours. Casualties unknown.

On 10 November 2025, in Camp-Marie, Artibonite, police forces, supported by armed members of the population (self-defense groups), engaged in clashes with gang members in Camp-Marie, Lacroix-Perisse, Pierre Payen, and Bois Neuf villages (coded separately). Some residents got trapped in their homes during the clashes, that lasted several hours. Casualties unknown.

On 10 November 2025, in Pierre Payen, Artibonite, police forces, supported by armed members of the population (self-defense groups), engaged in clashes with gang members in Pierre Payen, Lacroix-Perisse, Camp-Marie, and Bois Neuf villages (coded separately). Some residents got trapped in their homes during the clashes, that lasted several hours. Casualties unknown.

On 10 November 2025, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, contractor workers at the National School Canteen Program (PNCS) held a protest and shut down the doors of the institution to demand the payment of 13 months of due salaries.

On 11 November 2025, near Anbas Gros-Morne, Artibonite, residents blocked national road 1 with trees, rocks and tires set on fire to demonstrate against what they consider insufficient action by the authorities against gang violence and insecurity.

On 11 November 2025, in Hinche, Centre, in the morning, residents held a demonstration to demand justice for a man who was killed during the dispersals of a public employees' mobilization the day before (coded separately). Demonstrators also asked for the arrest of the responsible authorities. The demonstrators burned tires along the roadway, paralyzing economic activities around. Members of the Bakop Feray communal militia (self-defense brigade) were seen patrolling the village (coded separately), although no interaction with the demonstrators was mentioned.
Non-violent activity: On 11 November 2025, in Hinche, Centre, members of the Bakop Feray communal militia (self-defense brigade) were seen patrolling the village.

On 11 November 2025, in Marassa, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Carrefour Marassa. This was likely part of clashes between police forces and gang members, who also engaged in clashes in the nearby Pont Tabarre area and along the Sainte-Philomene street, in Tabarre 27 (coded separately). Gunshots were also heard in nearby Carrefour Fleuriot (coded separately). The stray bullets hit residents' properties, forcing some of them to leave the area and preventing others from reaching their homes. Casualties unknown.

source: Gazette Haiti; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 11 November 2025, in Delmas - Terrain Accra (2), Ouest, according to witnesses, armed gang members riding two motorcycles shot and killed two women and a man in front of the Kanaval Market, along the Delmas 33 Road (drive-by). Two of the victims were returning from a bank branch when the attack took place, although the motivation of the shooting was not clarified. The gang members stole the victim's identity documents before fleeing the scene. 3 fatalities.

On 11 November 2025, in Tabarre - Carrefour Fleuriot, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the neighborhood. This was likely part of clashes between police forces and gang members, who also engaged in clashes in the nearby Pont Tabarre area and along the Sainte-Philomene street (coded separately). Gunshots were also heard in nearby Carrefour Marassa (coded separately). The stray bullets hit residents' properties, forcing some of them to leave the area and preventing others from reaching their homes. Casualties unknown.

On 11 November 2025, in Tabarre - Tabarre 27, Ouest, police forces engaged in clashes with gang members in the Pont Tabarre area and along the Sainte-Philomene street (Tabarre 27). The stray bullets hit residents' properties, forcing some of them to leave the area and preventing others from reaching their homes. Gunshots were heard in the nearby Carrefour Fleuriot and Carrefour Marassa zones (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 12 November 2025, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, employees at the National Directorate for Drinking Water and Sanitation (DINEPA) held a protest to demand higher salaries and the payment of bonuses.

source: Alterpresse; El Nacional (Dominican Republic); Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 13 November 2025, in Bon Repos, Ouest, overnight, police forces and the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) engaged in clashes with the 400 Mawozo Gang in the Lilavois area. Between 13 and 14 November, at least seven 400 Mawozo gang members were killed, including a leader, and several others were injured during anti-gang operations in Lilavois, Morne-a-Cabrits, Santo, and Tabarre 27 (coded separately). Police forces used drones and helicopters to fight the gang. A war weapon was seized. There were rumors that the security operation aimed at finding and dismantling the facilities of a factory that the 400 Mawozo Gang had taken over in Santo (coded separately) to use it as an illicit substances production center, although the police later denied it and stated that the operation had been planned weeks before. At least 7 fatalities split across seven events. 1 coded here.

source: Alterpresse; El Nacional (Dominican Republic); Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 13 November 2025, in Santo, Ouest, overnight, police forces and the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) engaged in clashes with the 400 Mawozo Gang. Between 13 and 14 November, at least seven 400 Mawozo gang members were killed, including a leader, and several others were injured during anti-gang operations in Santo, Morne-a-Cabrits, Lilavois, and Tabarre 27 (coded separately). Police forces used drones and helicopters to fight the gang. A war weapon was seized. There were rumors that the security operation aimed at finding and dismantling the facilities of a factory that the 400 Mawozo Gang had taken over in Santo (coded separately) to use it as an illicit substances production center, although the police later denied it and stated that the operation had been planned weeks before. At least 7 fatalities split across seven events. 1 coded here.

On 13 November 2025, in Bois d'Orme, Ouest, police forces and the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) engaged in clashes with the 400 Mawozo Gang in Morne-a-Cabrits. Between 13 and 14 November, at least seven 400 Mawozo gang members were killed, including a leader, and several others were injured during anti-gang operations in Morne-a-Cabrits, Tabarre 27, Lilavois, and Santo (coded separately). Police forces used drones and helicopters to fight the gang. A war weapon was seized. The security operation aimed at finding and dismantling the facilities of a factory that the 400 Mawozo Gang had taken over in Santo (coded separately) to use it as an illicit substances production centre. At least 7 fatalities split across seven events. 1 coded here.

source: Alterpresse; El Nacional (Dominican Republic); Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 13 November 2025, in Tabarre - Tabarre 27, Ouest, overnight, police forces and the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) engaged in clashes with the 400 Mawozo Gang in the Pont Tabarre area. Some properties were hit by the stray bullets. Between 13 and 14 November, at least seven 400 Mawozo gang members were killed, including a leader, and several others were injured during anti-gang operations in Tabarre 27, Santo, Morne-a-Cabrits, and Lilavois (coded separately). Police forces used drones and helicopters to fight the gang. A war weapon was seized. There were rumors that the security operation aimed at finding and dismantling the facilities of a factory that the 400 Mawozo Gang had taken over in Santo (coded separately) to use it as an illicit substances production center, although the police later denied it and stated that the operation had been planned weeks before. At least 7 fatalities split across seven events. 1 coded here.

source: Alterpresse; El Nacional (Dominican Republic); Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); SG Alert (Whatsapp); Trip Foumi; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 14 November 2025, in Bon Repos, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, police forces and the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) engaged in clashes with the 400 Mawozo Gang in the Lilavois, Lizon, and Lathan areas. Between 13 and 14 November, at least seven 400 Mawozo gang members were killed, including a leader, and several others were injured during anti-gang operations in Lilavois, Santo, Morne-a-Cabrits, and Tabarre 27 (coded separately). Police forces used drones and helicopters to fight the gang. One of the helicopters crashed accidentally. A pilot was injured. The police then destroyed the helicopter to prevent gangsters from using it. There were rumors that the security operation aimed at finding and dismantling the facilities of a factory that the 400 Mawozo Gang had taken over in Santo (coded separately) to use it as an illicit substances production center, although the police later denied it and stated that the operation had been planned weeks before. A war weapon was seized. At least 7 fatalities split across seven events. 1 coded here.

On 14 November 2025, in Marassa, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Carrefour Marassa. This was likely part of clashes between police forces and the Gang Suppression Force with the 400 Mawozo Gang. Clashes between these actors were registered on that day in the nearby Tabarre 27, Santo, Morne-a-Cabrits, and Lilavois areas (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

source: El Nacional (Dominican Republic); Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Trip Foumi; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 14 November 2025, in Santo, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, police forces and the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) engaged in clashes with the 400 Mawozo Gang. Between 13 and 14 November, at least seven 400 Mawozo gang members were killed, including a leader, and several others were injured during anti-gang operations in Santo, Tabarre 27, Morne-a-Cabrits, and Lilavois (coded separately). Police forces used drones and helicopters to fight the gang. One of the helicopters crashed accidentally. A pilot was injured. There were rumors that the security operation aimed at finding and dismantling the facilities of a factory that the 400 Mawozo Gang had taken over in Santo (coded separately) to use it as an illicit substances production center, although the police later denied it and stated that the operation had been planned weeks before. A war weapon was seized. At least 7 fatalities split across seven events. 1 coded here.

Non-violent activity: On 14 November 2025, in Santo, Ouest, dozens members of the 400 Mawozo Gang used freight trucks to block streets. The roadblocks were set up to prevent police forces from reaching them. This happened in the context of a police anti-gang operation in the area. Similar roadblocks were erected by the gang members in Croix des Missions (Tabarre) (coded separately).

On 14 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Musseau-Delmas 48, Ouest, a group of citizens led by leaders of the Conviction for Change (KPC) political party held a protest in front of the Villa D'Accueil against the government (specific claims unclarified). Police forces used tear gas to disperse the crowd. According to witnesses, the officers threw tear gas grenades inside a bus transporting political militants. The female Secretary General of the KPC party was injured by a gas canister. Several other protesters were also injured. Several protesters were arrested. A baby died due to suffocation. 1 fatality. At least 2 injured.

Non-violent activity: On 14 November 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, dozens members of the 400 Mawozo Gang used freight trucks to block streets in the Croix des Missions neighborhood. The roadblocks were set up to prevent police forces from reaching them. This happened in the context of a police anti-gang operation in the area. Similar roadblocks were erected by the gang members in Santo (Croix des Bouquets) (coded separately).

source: Alterpresse; El Nacional (Dominican Republic); Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Trip Foumi; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 14 November 2025, in Tabarre - Tabarre 27, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, police forces and the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) engaged in clashes with the 400 Mawozo Gang in the Pont Tabarre area. Gunshots were heard. Some properties were hit by the stray bullets. Between 13 and 14 November, at least seven 400 Mawozo gang members were killed, including a leader, and several others were injured during anti-gang operations in Tabarre 27, Morne-a-Cabrits, Lilavois, and Santo (coded separately). Police forces used drones and helicopters to fight the gang. One of the helicopters crashed accidentally. A pilot was injured. There were rumors that the security operation aimed at finding and dismantling the facilities of a factory that the 400 Mawozo Gang had taken over in Santo (coded separately) to use it as an illicit substances production center, although the police later denied it and stated that the operation had been planned weeks before. A war weapon was seized. At least 7 fatalities split across seven events. 1 coded here.

Land seizure: On 12 October 2025, in Delmas - Puits Blain, Ouest, armed group members pretending to be police officers took over a property belonging to the Congregation and the Methodist College (Protestant Christian group), in Puits-Blain 26. The armed individuals fired shots to intimidate residents around and erected at least four huts inside the property.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 7 November 2025, in Tabarre - Tabarre 27, Ouest, police forces clashed with members of the 400 Mawozo Gang and the Chien Mechant Gang during anti-gang operations in the Pont Tabarre area. Clashes continued on 8 November (coded separately). Between 7 and 8 November, at least three gang members were killed and several others were injured during clashes with the police in Pont Tabarre. The police seized a vehicle and regained control of the nearby zone of Carrefour Marassa. At least 3 fatalities split across two events. 2 coded here.

actor1: Police Forces of Haiti (2024-) Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP)
source: Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Trip Foumi; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 8 November 2025, in Limbe, Nord, a police officer from the Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP), in the company of four other BSAP officers, shot and killed a man riding a motorcycle during an altercation (nature unclarified). The five BSAP agents were arrested. The police killing motivated the burning of public spaces by the population later that day (coded separately). 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces of Haiti (2024-) Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP)
source: Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Trip Foumi; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 8 November 2025, in Limbe, Nord, a mob of residents burned down the city hall, a building hosting the local base of the Protected Areas Security Brigade (BSAP) police, and the facilities of the Directorate General of Taxes (DGI). This was in reprisal for the killing of a motorcycle man by BSAP police agents earlier that day (coded separately).

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 8 November 2025, in Tabarre - Tabarre 27, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, police forces clashed with members of the 400 Mawozo Gang and the Chien Mechant Gang during anti-gang operations in the Pont Tabarre area. Between 7 and 8 November, at least three gang members were killed and several others were injured during clashes with the police in Pont Tabarre. The police seized a vehicle and regained control of the nearby zone of Carrefour Marassa. At least 3 fatalities split across two events. 1 coded here.

On 9 November 2025, Marassa, Ouest, in the morning, police forces clashed with gang members in Carrefour Marassa and Cite Doudoune, killing several gang members and injuring others. Security forces used drones charged with explosives during the operation (likely launched by the Task Force coded as Police forces). The gang members were likely affiliates of the 400 Mawozo Gang and the Chien Mechant Gang. Gunshots were heard along the Sainte-Philomene street (Tabarre 27) and Butte Boyer. Clashes between the police and these gangs were registered since 7 November in Pont Tabarre (coded separately), very close to Carrefour Marassa. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 10 November 2025, in Hinche, Centre, in the morning, public employees from the Ministry of the Interior working at the Departmental Delegation of the Centre, hosted by the so-called administrative complex building, held a sit-in protest to decry the imposition of a measure that ask them for document authentication at workplace. As protesters tried to blocked access to the administrative complex building (methods unspecified), security agents working for the departmental government delegate opened fire to disperse them. A man (described as an university teacher and lawyer) who was crossing the Des Lattes street at the moment of dispersals (not taking part in the mobilization) was shot and killed. A security agent and a another person were shot and injured. This incidents of violence motivated further protests against the repression of protesters in Hinche (coded separately). 1 fatality, 2 injured.

On 16 July 2025, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, overnight, gang members attacked residential areas within the commune, forcing residents to flee their homes. On the same day, the Kokorat San Ras Gang attacked residents in nearby Liancourt (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 10 September 2025, in Petion Ville - Laboule, Ouest, four armed individuals kidnapped two female teenagers, who are also sisters, from their home in Laboule 12. The victims were released on the night of 13-14 October after the payment of a partial ransom.
On 8 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched drone strikes in the area. Casualties unknown.

On 7 November 2025, in Marassa, Ouest, the police killed several armed men in Carrefour Marassa during a surprise operation. The men usually sat guarding the entrance of Cite Doudoune. Unspecified number of casualties coded as 3.

Other: On 9 November 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were fired near the Fessard (Petion Ville - Feca neighborhood) and Pyron areas. The shots were heard from Thomassin 32. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Looting: Around 10 November 2025 (as reported), in Peligre, Centre, gang members looted five electricity substations and pylons of the Peligre hydroelectric station, which affected the provision of electricity in the metropolitan area of Port-au-Prince. The Electricity of Haiti (EDH) was forced to ration power due the incident.

Other: On 11 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard near the INUKA University and the Sacre Coeur School (Turgeau neighborhood). Gang members also took over the INUKA University facilities and were seen on top of the building, although it is unclear if they fired the shots during the incident.
Other: On 11 November 2025, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Carrefour Vincent (Cite Soleil - Sarthe). There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Non-violent activity: On 11 November 2025, in Tabarre - Aeroport Toussaint Louverture, Ouest, the police blocked the Trois Mains Square. The motivation for the roadblock is unknown.

On 11 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bicentenaire, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched drone strikes near the Fort Saint Claire area. Casualties unknown.
Other: On 10 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the - Centre Ville area. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 10 November 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Bas Delmas area. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 9 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Village de Dieu area. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
On 11 November 2025, in Marassa, Ouest, armed clashed were registered, causing residents to flee the neighborhood. The circumstances and actors involved are unknown. Casualties unknown.

On 11 November 2025, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, armed clashed were registered in Cite Doudoune, causing residents to flee the neighborhood. The circumstances and actors involved are unknown. Casualties unknown.

Non-violent activity: On 12 November 2025, between Marassa and Cite Doudoune, Ouest, gang members erected roadblocks. The leader of the 400 Mawozo Gang communicated in a video that the gang would enter Tabarre if the police carried out another operation in the area. He invited residents to leave the area to avoid potential violent situations.

On 12 November 2025, in Hinche, Centre, for the second consecutive day, residents held a protest to demand justice for a man who was killed during the dispersals of a public employees' mobilization the day before (coded separately). The protest paralyzed activities in the city.
Other: On 12 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gang members fired gunshots near the INUKA University (Turgeau neighborhood). There is no information on the circumstances of the gunshots.
On 12 November 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 32, Ouest, a mobilization (likely protest) was registered in the area. There is no information on the circumstances or motivation for the protest.

Other: On 13 November 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, burning tires were erected on the Delmas 32 road. Gunshots were also heard in area. There is no information about the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots. The roadblocks might be related to mobilizations that occurred in the area the previous day (coded separately).

On 12 November 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gang members kidnapped a student of the Saint Louis de Gonzague school. The victim's whereabouts are unknown. This incident was part of ongoing kidnappings in Delmas.

Around 14 November 2025 (as reported), in Delmas, Ouest, gang members kidnapped an unspecified number of civilians. At least five abductions were registered across Delmas and Petionville (coded separately). The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

Around 14 November 2025 (as reported), in Petionville, Ouest, gang members kidnapped an unspecified number of civilians. At least five abductions were registered across Petionville and Delmas (coded separately). The victims' whereabouts are unknown.
Around 14 November 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gang members kidnapped an unspecified number of civilians. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 13 November 2025, in Petion Ville - Montagne Noire, Ouest, members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang shot and killed a man and kidnapped her daughter (a girl). The girl was released on an unspecified date. 1 fatality.

On 19 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Avenue Christophe, Ouest, police forces led an operation to recover the bodies of a police officer and members of a self-defense brigade, who had been killed the day before during clashes with the Viv Ansanm Gang in the Turgeau neighborhood (coded separately). Police forces were deployed between Christophe Avenue and N Avenue, and clashed with gang members (likely the Viv Ansanm Gang) as they worked to secure streets in the area. There were no police casualties during the clashes. It is unknown if casualties were registered among the gangs. The bodies of the deceased were recovered by the police. Casualties unknown.

source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 20 November 2025, in Leveque, Ouest, police forces supported by members of a local self-defense brigade clashed with members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang) and the Taliban Gang as they attacked the Leveque locality. Several gang members were killed and four motorbikes were seized. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 21 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - La Saline, Ouest, unidentified gang members (likely members of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) attacked the National Port Authority (APN). Gang members shot and killed a truck driver, whose truck was then used to break into part of the port's building complex. The APN's security forces (including members of the Haitian Army) clashed with the gang members, and they were able to repel them. Gang members had attacked other trucks that had been transporting port employees earlier in the week. Heavy gunfire was heard in the neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 14 November 2025, in Liancourt, Artibonite, armed individuals carried out an attack in the area, as well as in the Belanger area (coded separately). The incident caused the displacement of over 8,000 people across both areas. Casualties unknown.

On 14 November 2025, in Belanger, Artibonite, armed individuals carried out an attack in the area, as well as in the Liancourt area (coded separately). The incident caused the displacement of over 8,000 people across both areas. Casualties unknown.

On 6 November 2025, in Petion Ville - Thomassin, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, unidentified armed individuals carried out an attack in the Fermathe area of the neighborhood. The attack has caused residents to flee. Casualties unknown.

source: AP; Haiti Press Network; Haiti Standard; Juno 7; PNH: National Police of Haiti; Trip Foumi
notes: On 17 November 2025, in Labodrie, Ouest, a police officer and a self-defense brigade member were killed during an operation. The officer was injured in the head by a bullet while surveilling the activities of an armed gang from an armored vehicle and died in the hospital. Members of the police forces stated that the victim's death was due to negligence as the National Police did not provide an helicopter transfer to a more appropriate medical facility despite several urgent requests. Five civilians were also injured during the incident. 2 fatalities, 5 injured.

source: Alterpresse; PNH: National Police of Haiti; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 16 November 2025, in Delmas - Pele Simon, Ouest, police forces shot and killed two gang members during clashes in the neighborhood during an operation aimed at dismantling gang hot spots, including one in Village Solidarite (coded separately). A drone strike was also suspectedly launched during the incident. Several stolen vehicles were also seized. 2 fatalities spread across two events. 1 coded here.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Press Network; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 18 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Turgeau, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition killed three people in the neighborhood, including a police officer and a self-defense group member (later reports state 2 brigadiers), and set fire to the victims' bodies. Several self-defense brigade members went missing during the attack. 3 fatalities.

Property destruction: On 20 November 2025, in Bercy, Ouest, members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang) and the Taliban Gang set a gas station on fire, as retaliation for the killing of several gang members earlier that day by police (coded separately).

Other: On 18 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the leader of the local self-defense brigade announced the closure of clubs in the Canape-Vert neighborhood as well as the suspension of the public retransmission of a football match to avoid being the target of gang attacks. The measure was issued after the Viv Ansanm Gang carried out an attack in the area, killing three people (coded separately).

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Press Network; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 19 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Turgeau, Ouest, police forces and self-defense brigades engaged in clashes with suspected members of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition in the neighborhood near the Sacre-Coeur school. Stray bullets reached other parts of the neighborhood, including the Jean-Paul II Avenue. Both police officers and self-defense group members were victims in the clash, although the nature and number of casualties was not specified. Casualties unknown.

Non-violent activity: On 17 November 2025, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, the Viv Ansanm Gang blocked access to the Varreux fuel terminal, the country's largest fuel depot, and its surrounding roads, including National Road 1, National Road 9, La Saline Road, Batimat Road. The blockade disrupted the supply of carburant and caused long queues at gas stations across the capital, including in Petionville and Delmas. Access to the fuel terminal was restored on 21 November, while clashes were also recorded that day near the port (coded separately). The blockade occurred while police forces had been intensifying their interventions against gangs in Croix-des-Bouquets and other areas of Port-au-Prince in previous days (coded separately).

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 20 November 2025, in Bercy, Ouest, the Taliban Gang (affiliated to the Viv Ansanm Gang) attacked the area and clashed with members of the local self-defense brigade, who were unable to contain the attack. Several people were shot and injured. The area was takeover by the gang members. Nearby neighborhoods were forced to shut down their activities due to the event. Between 18 November and 1 December, nine civilians were shot and injured during gang attacks in Bercy. Several injured.

On 17 November 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 75, Ouest, the police physically attacked (methods unknown) a journalist of Tripotay Haiti 509 as he recorded on the sidewalk. According to the victim he identified himself as a journalist.

actor2: Military Forces of the United States (2025-) Marine Corps
source: Alterpresse; BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 13 November 2025, in Tabarre - Chateau Blond, Ouest, members of the Kraze Barye Gang (affiliated with the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) opened fire on US Marine Corps officers guarding the premises of the US Embassy, on Boulevard 15 Octobre. The military officers shot back in response, although no injuries were registered. An unspecified number of additional US Marine Corps officers were deployed at the Embassy's premises to protect the diplomatic mission. There were no casualties.

On 15 November 2025, in Marassa, Ouest, police forces conducted a security operation against the 400 Mawozo Gang and killed several of its members in Marassa, Duval, and Raket areas (coded separately). Several other gang members managed to escape. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 15 November 2025, in the Croix-des-Bouquets commune, Ouest, police forces conducted a security operation against the 400 Mawozo Gang and killed several of its members in the Duval and Raket areas. Several gang members were also killed in Marassa (coded separately). Several other gangsters managed to escape. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; PNH: National Police of Haiti
notes: On 16 November 2025, in Delmas - Village Solidarite, Ouest, police forces shot and killed two gang members during clashes in the neighborhood during an operation aimed at dismantling gang hot spots, including in Pele Simon (coded separately). Several stolen vehicles were also seized. 2 fatalities spread across two events. 1 coded here.

source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Trip Foumi
notes: On 16 November 2025, in Delmas - Village W. Lamothe, Ouest, police forces shot and killed two armed individuals as they were about to perpetrate a kidnapping between the Delmas 19 Road and Delmas 29 Street (Village W. Lamothe neighborhood). A third armed individual, who was injured, managed to escape. The kidnapping attempt was thwarted. Two firearms and the motorcycles used by the now deceased were seized. 2 fatalities, 1 injured.

Other: Around 16 November 2025 (weekend of), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the leader of the Viv Ansanm Gang asked the population to stay at home on 17 November and threatened to carry out attacks in Port-au-Prince in reprisal for a police operation against their allies from the 400 Mawozo Gang in Croix des Bouquets and Tabarre several days prior, that left a leader of the gang killed (coded separately). The threats motivated the police to suspend planned meetings and caused the total disruption of regular activities in the downtown.

source: Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: Other: Around 16 November 2025 (weekend of), in Carrefour, Ouest, the leader of the Ti Bwa Gang asked the population to remain at home on 17 November and announced the total suspension of regular activities in the commune. This happened as the leader of the Viv Ansanm Gang threatened to carry out attacks in Port-au-Prince in reprisal for a police operation against their allies from the 400 Mawozo Gang in Croix des Bouquets and Tabarre several days prior, that left a leader of the gang killed (coded separately). Regular activity in Carrefour remained paralyzed for more than a week.

On 16 November 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard as part of fire exchange in the commune. The clash happened after the Viv Ansanm Gang leader asked the population to remain at home due to his intention of carrying attacks in Port-au-Prince in reprisal for a police operation against the 400 Mawozo Gang in Croix des Bouquets and Tabarre several days prior, that left a leader of the gang killed (coded separately).

Around 16 November 2025 (between 15 - 16 November), in Delmas - Maguana, Ouest, unidentified individuals kidnapped an unclarified number of people between Delmas 31 and the Delmas 33 Road (Maguana neighborhood). The mentioned victims were abducted in at least three separate kidnapping events. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

On 17 November 2025, in Miragoane, Nippes, thousands of people marched from the Basquin zone to Carrefour Desruisseaux in support of the Miragoane police commissioner, Ernst Muscadin, and against accusations stating that he has participated in extrajudicial executions. These accusations came from the last United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti (BINUH) report. Protesters, including the lawyer at the Miragoane bar, carried photos of the police commissioner and claimed that the accusations were unfounded. Regular activities were paralyzed due to the mobilization. The police guarded the march.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 17 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, police forces shot and killed several members of the Viv Ansanm Gang. According to witnesses, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) also launched at least three drones charged with explosives. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 17 November 2025, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, in the morning, several dozen residents took to the streets calling for the release of a pastor man who had been arrested in September in relation to the killing of a lawyer man (coded separately). Demonstrators threw stones and bottles in several directions and blocked the roadway with barricades of burning tires and truck carcasses. Two workers at the Industrial Development Company (CODEVI) were injured by the stones when walking towards their workplace. Police forces were deployed to restore order, although no interaction with the demonstrators was mentioned. 2 injured.

On 25 November 2025, in Port-de-Paix, Nord-Ouest, for a second consecutive day, several dozen moto-taxi drivers held a demonstration against a measure imposed by local authorities the day before demanding drivers to wear a mandatory identification vest. The moto-taxi drivers decried the high cost of vests, sold at 5,000 gourdes, and called for the departure of the mayor. Demonstrators set up barricades on burning tires and threw stones and bottle shards against police forces, who used tear gas to disperse the mobilization. Two police agents were injured by projectiles. 2 injured.

On 24 November 2025, in Port-de-Paix, Nord-Ouest, moto-taxi drivers held a protest against a measure imposed by local authorities hours before demanding drivers to wear a mandatory identification vest. The moto-taxi drivers decried the high cost of vests, sold at 5,000 gourdes. They also called for the departure of the mayor.

On 22 November 2025, in the Montrouis commune, Artibonite, members of the Taliban Gang coming from Canaan entered the premises of an orphanage by force in the Fon Gran Maten locality and killed an Evangelical Christian reverend pastor in front of his wife, sons, daughters, and orphan children living at the facilities. The victim was also the head of the orphanage. The gang members set fire to his body after the corpse was eaten by dogs on the street. 1 fatality.

On 22 November 2025, in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, students from the Bas Artibonite Public University (UPBAS), supported by university entities, held a demonstration at the Saint-Marc Public University campus against mismanagement within the institution and calling for the authorities to stop politicizing the university. Demonstrators occupied the premises, burned tires on the main road leading to the campus, and blocked the metal doors giving access to the facilities. The occupation persisted at least until 23 November, when a new rector was installed.

On 26 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Musseau-Delmas 48, Ouest, several dozen former contractor workers at the Social Assistance Fund (CAS) held a sit-in protest in front of the Villa D'Accueil building demanding their reinstatement and to decry mismanagement within the institution by its leaders.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: Around 26 November 2025 (as reported), in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang killed two people and injured several others as they carried out an attack in reprisal for the interception of a young man carrying ammunition for the gang by a self-defense group brigade (coded separately). 2 fatalities, several injured.

Non-violent activity: Around 26 November 2025 (as reported), in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, members of a local self-defense group intercepted a young man carrying ammunition for the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang. His affiliation was not confirmed. The interception motivated a reprisal attack by members of the mentioned gang (coded separately).

source: Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 27 November 2025, in Bercy, Ouest, in the early morning, armed members of the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition invaded the village and set fire to several residents' properties before engaging in clashes with the police and a local self-defense brigade, who managed to expel the criminals. Many residents fled their homes. Between 18 November and 1 December, nine civilians were shot and injured during gang attacks in Bercy. Several injured.

Property destruction: On 25 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Turgeau, Ouest, gang members partially burned the Sacred Heart Institution facilities, located at the intersection between Christophe Avenue and Jean Paul II Avenue.

Property destruction: On 26 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Turgeau, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, gang members set fire to what remained from the Sacred Heart Institution facilities, located at the intersection between Christophe Avenue and Jean Paul II Avenue. The gang members had started to burn the building the day prior (coded separately).

Around 28 November 2025 (as reported), in Petionville, Ouest, four unidentified individuals were shot and killed and their bodies were found scattered on the street near the former cemetery, in the morning of 28 November. There is no information on the perpetrators and the motivation for this attack. 4 fatalities.

Other: On 14 November 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, a roadblock was set up at the intersection of Metellus and Borno streets (Petion Ville - Centre Ville (Nord) neighborhood). There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblock or who set it up.

On 15 November 2025, in Delmas - Carrefour Aeroport/Delmas 13, Ouest, a police officer was shot and killed a man in Delmas 9 while patrolling the area in a unarmored vehicle. The circumstances and other actors involved in the incident are unknown. 1 fatality.

Other: On 16 November 2025, in Delmas, gunshots were heard in Carrefour Drouillard. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots, although they are possibly related to nearby operations in Pele Simon and Village Solidarite (coded separately).
Other: On 17 November 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Fort Jacques. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
Other: On 17 November 2025, in Kenscoff, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Fermathe, and between Viard and Obleon. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 17 November 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard on Jean Gilles street near the Airport Road (Barbancourt neighborhood). There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 17 November 2025, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, two trucks were used to set up a roadblock in Carrefour Vincent (Cite Soleil - Sarthe neighborhood). There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblock or who set it up.
On 17 November 2025, in Moron, Grande-Anse, members of the population protested by erecting roadblocks to demand the resignation of the interim mayors.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2025-) Marine Corps
notes: Movement of forces: Around 17 November 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the U.S. government, in collaboration with the Haitian government, deployed a new group of marine officers (number unspecified) to reinforce their diplomatic personnel and support the local police in their anti-gang efforts.
On 18 November 2025, in Petion Ville - Thomassin, Ouest, an attack was carried out as gunshots were heard in the area. The circumstances of the attack are unknown. Casualties unknown.

source: Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 18 November 2025, in Bercy, Ouest, gang members affiliated with the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition attacked the area and set up a roadblock along the National Road 1. Gunshots were heard. Between 18 November and 1 December, nine civilians were shot and injured during gang attacks in Bercy. Several injured.

On 18 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gang members were involved in a shooting in unspecified circumstances around Grand-Rue and Casernes street. Some gangsters were hit by bullets before retreating to their bases, although it is unclear if they were injured or killed during the incident. Casualties unknown.

Other: On 19 November 2025, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, a roadblock was set up in Carrefour Vincent (Cite Soleil - Sarthe neighborhood), blocking the circulation. The circumstances of the roadblock are unknown. Armed individuals were seen in the area on the Route Nationale #1, although no activity was attributed to them.
Other: On 19 November 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, rocks were placed on the Solon Menos road. There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblock or who set it up.
Other: On 19 November 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, a roadblock was set up to block access to Croix des Missions. There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblock or who set it up.
Other: On 19 November 2025, in Marin, Ouest, a roadblock was set up to block access to the neighborhood. There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblock or who set it up.

Other: On 19 November 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, a roadblock was set up on the Route Nationale #1 near Acierie D'Haiti, on the Batimat Road, as well as the Route Nationale #2. There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblocks or who set them up, although they are likely related to the Viv Ansanm Gang blocking access to the Varreux and Thor fuel terminal since 17 November (coded separately). On 20 November, trucks were still unable to retrieve merchandise at the National Port Authority (APN) due to the blockades. By 21 November, activities at the terminals and the Caribbean Port Services (CPS) had resumed.

On 21 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - La Saline, Ouest, gang members carried out an attack near the National Port Authority (APN). The circumstances of the attack are unknown, although gunshots were heard in the area. Air drone strikes were suspectedly launched in the area (coded separately), although it is unclear if they were aimed at the gangsters. Casualties unknown.

On 21 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - La Saline, Ouest, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched drone strikes near the National Port Authority (APN). Gang attacks were also carried out in the area (coded separately), although it is unclear if the strikes were aimed at them. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 1 November 2025, in Petion Ville - Feca, Ouest, Viv Ansanm Gang members kidnapped a man and a woman in the Fessard area. The victims were freed on 22 November after security forces carried out an anti-gang operation in the Kenscoff commune (coded separately).

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 21 November 2025, in Bercy, Ouest, police forces supported by self-defense group members clashed with the Taliban Gang, whose affiliates had taken control of Bercy the day prior (coded separately). Security forces managed to regain control of the area and expelled the armed individuals. Several civilians and self-defense brigade members were injured. Several houses were burned. Between 18 November and 1 December, nine civilians were shot and injured during gang attacks in Bercy. Several injured.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 22 November 2025, in Kenscoff - Godet, Ouest, police and military forces supported by the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) clashed with gang members as they carried out anti-gang joint operations against the Viv Ansanm Gang in the Godet, Furcy, Belo, Obleon, and Clemansso neighborhoods, as well as in the Viard and Carrefour Konbit areas (coded separately). During clashes, several gang members were killed. Security forces regained control of strategic areas. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 22 November 2025, in Kenscoff - Belo, Ouest, police and military forces supported by the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) clashed with gang members as they carried out anti-gang joint operations against the Viv Ansanm Gang in the Belo, Furcy, Godet, Obleon, and Clemansso neighborhoods, as well as in the Viard and Carrefour Konbit areas (coded separately). During clashes, several gang members were killed and two hostages who had been kidnapped on 1 November (coded separately) were freed. Security forces regained control of strategic areas. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 22 November 2025, in Kenscoff, Ouest, police and military forces supported by the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) clashed with gang members as they carried out anti-gang joint operations against the Viv Ansanm Gang in the Viard and Carrefour Konbit areas, as well as in the Obleon, Furcy, Belo, Godet, and Clemansso neighborhoods (coded separately). During clashes, several gang members were killed. Security forces regained control of strategic areas. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 22 November 2025, in Kenscoff - Obleon, Ouest, police and military forces supported by the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) clashed with gang members as they carried out anti-gang joint operations against the Viv Ansanm Gang in the Teleco area (Obleon neighborhood), as well as in the Viard, Carrefour Konbit, Belo, Godet, Furcy, and Clemansso neighborhoods (coded separately). During clashes, several gang members were killed. Security forces regained control of strategic areas. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 22 November 2025, in Petion Ville - Clemansso, Ouest, police and military forces supported by the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) clashed with gang members as they carried out anti-gang joint operations against the Viv Ansanm Gang in the Clemansso, Belo, Furcy, Godet, and Obleon neighborhoods, as well as in the Viard and Carrefour Konbit areas (coded separately). During clashes, several gang members were killed. Security forces regained control of strategic areas. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 22 November 2025, in Kenscoff - Furcy, Ouest, police and military forces supported by the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) clashed with gang members as they carried out anti-gang joint operations against the Viv Ansanm Gang in the Furcy, Belo, Godet, Obleon, and Clemansso neighborhoods, as well as in the Viard and Carrefour Konbit areas (coded separately). During clashes, several gang members were killed. Security forces regained control of strategic areas. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Le Midi; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 22 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Martissant, Ouest, the Base 5 Secondes Gang engaged in clashes with members of the Grand-Ravine Gang in the Martissant, Village de Dieu (Cite de Dieu), and the Grand Cimetiere neighborhoods (coded separately). During clashes, that lasted for several hours, at least six gang members were killed. Four were identified as members of the Grand-Ravine Gang and two as affiliates of the Base 5 Secondes Gang. Several civilians were killed. The Base 5 Secondes Gang set on fire several spaces under the occupation of the Grand-Ravine Gang. The situation caused panic among the population. Some families fled their homes. At least 6 fatalities split across three events. 2 coded here.

source: Alterpresse; Le Midi; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 22 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Cite de Dieu, Ouest, the Base 5 Secondes Gang engaged in clashes with members of the Grand-Ravine Gang in the Village de Dieu (Cite de Dieu), Martissant, and the Grand Cimetiere neighborhoods (coded separately). During clashes, that lasted for several hours, at least six gang members were killed. Four were identified as members of the Grand-Ravine Gang and two as affiliates of the Base 5 Secondes Gang. Several civilians were killed. The Base 5 Secondes Gang set on fire several spaces under the occupation of the Grand-Ravine Gang. The situation caused panic among the population. Some families fled their homes. At least 6 fatalities split across three events. 2 coded here.

source: Alterpresse; Le Midi; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 22 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Gabelliste/Grand Cimetiere, Ouest, the Base 5 Secondes Gang engaged in clashes with members of the Grand-Ravine Gang in the Grand Cimetiere, Martissant, and Village de Dieu (Cite de Dieu) neighborhoods (coded separately). During clashes, that lasted for several hours, at least six gang members were killed. Four were identified as members of the Grand-Ravine Gang and two as affiliates of the Base 5 Secondes Gang. Several civilians were killed. The Base 5 Secondes Gang set on fire several spaces under the occupation of the Grand-Ravine Gang. The situation caused panic among the population. Some families fled their homes. At least 6 fatalities split across three events. 2 coded here.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 23 November 2025, in Tabarre - Aeroport Toussaint Louverture, Ouest, gang members opened fire on a Sunrise Airways aircraft carrying passengers from Les Cayes when arriving at the Guy Malary Terminal at the Toussaint Louverture International Airport. No human casualties were registered. The Viv Ansanm Gang coalition was suspected to be behind the attack. Members of this gang had been firing in areas around the airport in recent days, suspectedly in reprisal for the latest police operations. The company suspended flights for security reasons after the incident. There were no casualties.

On 3 December 2025, in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, internally displaced residents from Pont Sonde took to the streets calling for the dismantling of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang. Police forces intervened to disperse the crowd, injuring a young protester to the head (methods unclarified).

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 3 December 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, for a fifth consecutive day, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang attacked the local population at the so-called Pon Fifi area and engaged in clashes with police forces, who were supported by Kenyan agents from the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) and by a local self-defense brigade. The brigade was likely part of the Jean-Denis Gang (a.k.a. Coalition des Revolutionnaires por Sauver l'Artibonite or Jean Denis Coalition), whose members had clashed with the gang since 29 November (coded separately). The gang members were forced to leave an area that they had controlled since 29 November. Casualties unknown.

On 1 December 2025, in Des Granges, Nord-Ouest, overnight, according to witnessing residents, heavily armed individuals fired shots during an attack that lasted for several hours in the Site Vitalyen sector. A man, later identified as a local producer and vendor of alcoholic beverage, was captured and then killed. His body was found decapitated the morning after. The head was found at a different location. 1 fatality.

Agreement: Around 30 November 2025 (weekend of), in Lascahobas, Centre, the local authorities and the Taliban Gang from Canaan reached an agreement that resulted in the leaving of Lascahobas by the gang members, who returned to their bases in Canaan and Mirebalais. The terms of the agreement were not clarified.

On 2 December 2025, in L'Estere, Artibonite, in the morning, the Kokorat San Ras Gang attacked residents, killing at least five people. Around 50 houses were burned down. The gang members targeted the commune since 1 December (coded separately) in reprisal against the Jean-Denis Gang (a.k.a. Coalition des Revolutionnaires por Sauver l'Artibonite or Jean Denis Coalition) for the beating of a moto taxi driver working for the Kokorat San Ras Gang days before (coded separately). At least 5 fatalities.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: Around 30 November 2025 (weekend of), in Liancourt, Artibonite, according to residents, gang members attacked the local population. This was likely the authorship of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang, whose members also attacked the population in nearby Pont Sonde on that day (coded separately). Police forces regained control of the area around 4 December, although clashes with the gangsters were not confirmed. Casualties unknown.

On 4 December 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 33, Ouest, in the morning, according to witnesses, unidentified individuals wearing uniforms pretending to be police officers kidnapped a woman near the facilities of Chapelle Paradis, located along the Delmas 31 Road and near the Nathan School. The victim tried to resist, although the abductors managed to capture her and fled in a vehicle.
