There is no information on the identity of the abductors, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

On 4 December 2025, in Delmas - Zone Predailler/Charbonnie, Ouest, unidentified individuals kidnapped three civilians near the Delmas City Hall. There is no information on the identity of the abductors, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

On 3 December 2025, in Bercy, Ouest, Viv Ansanm gang members attacked the population, killing five civilians. According to the former mayor, there was a police officer among the fatal victims. The gangsters burned down heavy machinery that members of a self-defense brigade had mobilized to resist the gang attack, and threw Molotov cocktails at the person who was operating it, killing him. 6 fatalities.

Around 30 November 2025 (weekend of), in Lascahobas, Centre, members of the Bakop Feray self-defense group supported by agents from the BSAP police clashed with the Taliban Gang, whose members wanted to gain control over the commune. After the Taliban Gang efforts failed, both parts reached an agreement and the criminals left the area (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 26 November 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 75, Ouest, a group of police officers beat up a journalist man from Radio Uni FM media for no apparent reason after intercepting him working on the street. There were no fatalities.

Other: On 24 November 2025, in Cite Soleil, Ouest, roadblocks were erected on the National Road 1 in Carrefour Vincent (up to Cazeau) and Hubert street (Sarthe neighborhood). There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblocks or who set them up.

Other: On 24 November 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, roadblocks were erected near Batimat (Carrefour Drouillard/Parc Industriel neighborhood). There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblocks or who set them up.
On 26 November 2025, in Petion Ville - Laboule, Ouest, gang members fired shots at a sand mine in Laboule 12, forcing truck drivers to abandon the location. There were no casualties.
Around 15 April 2025 (month of), in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, six armed individuals broke into a woman's home and raped her.

On 4 December 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 33, Ouest, a person was kidnapped in the area. There is no information on the identity of the abductors, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

actor2: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: Weapons seizure: Around 25 November 2025 (as reported), in Descordes, Artibonite, members of a local self-defense brigade seized ammunition valued at 7.5 million gourdes being transported by a motorcycle rider for the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang. After the seizure, members of the gang gave an ultimatum of two days to return the firearms. In the absence of return, the gangsters attacked residents in Pont Sonde between 28 November and 1 December (coded separately).

On 1 December 2025, in L'Estere, Artibonite, members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang opened fire in several neighborhoods near the downtown, including at the Catholic church of the commune, where an employee was killed and the vehicles parked at the temple's premises were destroyed. The priest was rescued by the police, who intervened with the support of a self-defense group and clashed with the gang members as they tried to resist the attack. At least three people were killed in total and several others were injured. Several houses were burned down. The attack was a reprisal against the Jean-Denis Gang (a.k.a. Coalition des Revolutionnaires por Sauver l'Artibonite or Jean Denis Coalition) for the beating of a moto taxi driver working for the Kokorat San Ras Gang days before (coded separately). At least 3 fatalities, several injured.

On 2 December 2025, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, two armed individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed a woman at the pharmacy she run and owned, located on the 2F street (drive-by). The attackers shot at her six times before leaving the scene. The motivation remains unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 2 December 2025 (as reported), in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Este, BSAP police agents, showing their firearms, held a motorcade protest demanding that the authorities pay due remuneration. Protesters marched on their motorcycles and off-road vehicles from the BSAP base, located on Espagnole Street.

On 20 November 2025, in the Montrouis commune, Artibonite, members of a local self-defense group engaged in clashes with the Taliban Gang in the Kay Piat mountainous rural area, which was under gang attack. A self-defense group member was killed. 1 fatality.

Around 2 December 2025 (as reported), in Bois Neuf, Artibonite, members of the Taliban Gang coming from Canaan attacked an area known as 'Kamari'. According to human rights defenders, the gang assault caused panic among the population. No further information on the nature of the attack was mentioned. Casualties unknown.

Around 1 December 2025 (as reported), in L'Estere, Artibonite, members of the Jean-Denis Gang (a.k.a. Coalition des Revolutionnaires por Sauver l'Artibonite or Jean Denis Coalition) beat up a moto taxi driver working for the Kokorat San Ras Gang (likely gang member). The beating motivated a reprisal by the Kokorat San Ras Gang leader against residents in L'Estere on 1 December (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; SG Alert (Whatsapp); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 2 December 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, for a fourth consecutive day, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang attacked the local population and killed three young men. The gang members placed the bodies of the victims in the street to serve as barricades against police forces. They shared a video online claiming responsibility for the killings and addressing the Jean-Denis Gang (a.k.a. Coalition des Revolutionnaires pour Sauver l'Artibonite or Jean Denis Coalition). According to residents, police forces intervened and engaged in clashes with the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang, whose members had targeted Pont Sonde since 28 November (coded separately). Hundreds of residents fled Pont Sonde and took refuge in Saint-Marc after their houses, vehicles, and plantations were burned. 3 fatalities.

On 26 November 2025, in Delmas - Catalpa/Delmas 75, Ouest, according to several witnesses, unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a female police officer on the Cassagnol street, near her home. There is no further information on the attack, although the witnesses claimed that the officer was directly targeted while on the street. 1 fatality.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 28 November 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, overnight, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang attacked residents' properties by setting them on fire. Human casualties were suspected as civilians were likely trapped inside the houses, although confirmation was still pending. The gang offensive was a reprisal for the seizure of ammunition belonging to the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang by a local self-defense group in Descordes several day prior (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; AP; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Rezo Nodwes; Trip Foumi; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 29 November 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, overnight, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang attacked the local population and engaged in clashes with members of the Jean-Denis Gang (a.k.a. Coalition des Revolutionnaires por Sauver l'Artibonite or Jean Denis Coalition) and the police, who intervened with three armored vehicles to repel the attack. Between 29 and 30 November, more than 25 people were killed and more than 30 were injured. Scores of houses were burned with residents trapped inside, including children and elderly people. Authorities suspect that the number of fatalities is higher than known. Some businesses were looted. There were six employees from the Organization for the Development of the Artibonite Valley (ODVA), businessmen, and a local government employee among the fatal victims. Hundreds of residents fled Pont Sonde and took refuge in Saint-Marc after their houses, vehicles, and plantations were burned. The gang offensive was a reprisal for the seizure of ammunition belonging to the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang by a local self-defense group in Descordes several days prior (coded separately). At least 25 fatalities split across two events. 12 coded here.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; AP; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Rezo Nodwes; Trip Foumi; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 30 November 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, for a second consecutive day, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang attacked the local population and engaged in clashes with members of the Jean-Denis Gang (a.k.a. Coalition des Revolutionnaires por Sauver l'Artibonite or Jean Denis Coalition) and the police, who intervened with three armored vehicles to repel the attack. Between 29 and 30 November, more than 25 people were killed and more than 30 were injured. Scores of houses were burned with residents trapped inside, including children and elderly people. Authorities suspect that the number of fatalities is higher than known. Some businesses were looted. There were six employees from the Organization for the Development of the Artibonite Valley (ODVA), businessmen, and a local government employee among the fatal victims. Hundreds of residents fled Pont Sonde and took refuge in Saint-Marc after their houses, vehicles, and plantations were burned. The gang offensive was a reprisal for the seizure of ammunition belonging to the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang by a local self-defense group in Descordes several days prior (coded separately). At least 25 fatalities split across two events. 13 coded here.

Other: Around 30 November 2025 (weekend of), in the Lascahobas commune, Centre, gang members invaded and occupied several localities at the entrance of the commune. They left the area after negotiations with several Mirebalais personalities.

Around 30 November 2025 (weekend of), in Bercy, Ouest, gang members affiliated with the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition attacked residents in the area, killing at least three people and injuring at least two by gunshots. Some houses were burned. At least 3 fatalities, at least 2 injured.

Around 30 November 2025 (weekend of), near Kenscoff - Vieux Lacour, Ouest, gang members attacked residents in the Nouvelle Touraine locality (near Vieux Lacour neighborhood), killing at least three and injuring several others. Several houses were set on fire. At least 3 fatalities, several injured.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
notes: On 1 December 2025, in Carrefour Paye, Artibonite, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang engaged in clashes with police forces as these ones tried to expel the criminals from the area. Casualties unknown.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Alterpresse; Amerique Info 7; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 1 December 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, for a third consecutive day, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang engaged in clashes with police forces and a local self-defense group (likely the Jean-Denis Gang, a.k.a. Coalition des Revolutionnaires por Sauver l'Artibonite or Jean Denis Coalition) as these ones tried to expel the criminals from the village. The gang members had targeted Pont Sonde since 28 November (coded separately) in reprisal for the seizure of ammunition belonging to the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang by a local self-defense group in Descordes several day prior (coded separately). Hundreds of residents fled Pont Sonde and took refuge in Saint-Marc after their houses, vehicles, and plantations were burned. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Press Network; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 1 December 2025, in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, since the morning, hundreds of internally displaced residents from Pont Sonde, local members of political organizations, students, and the Federation of Lower Artibonite Organizations (FEOBA) held a demonstration along the National Road 1 and through the streets to demand an intervention by the authorities against the violence of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang. The demonstration turned violent when the internally displaced demonstrators holding stones assaulted the city hall, the Peace Court, and the Palace of Justice, and looted the National Insurance Office (ONA). Several school centers were closed after demonstrators entered the facilities, forcing parents to pick up their children. The mobilization was held following gang attacks in Pont Sonde and clashes with the police from 28 November to 1 December (coded separately).

On 12 November 2025, in Petion Ville - Montagne Noire, Ouest, unidentified individuals attempted to abduct an unspecified number of people. During the abduction attempt, two people were killed in unspecified circumstances. 2 fatalities.

On 1 December 2025, in Petion Ville - Centre Ville (Sud), Ouest, unidentified individuals kidnapped a 13-year-old girl in front of the National High School. A 50 000 gourdes ransom was requested for her release. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown.

source: Infos Partage; SG Alert (Whatsapp); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 1 December 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 40b, Ouest, at least four people were abducted as they were traveling towards the Delmas 40b neighbourhood. There is no information on the identity of the abductors, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.
Other: On 5 December 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, in the morning, gunshots were heard in the Cazeau neighbourhood. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.
On 6 December 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Turgeau, Ouest, in the morning, armed clashes were recorded near the INUKA university and the Sacre Coeur church. Casualties unknown.

Around 7 December 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Bel Air, Ouest, overnight, a faction of the Belair Gang operating on Perpetuel and Tiremasse streets killed a gangster from another Belair Gang faction operating in the Morne Marinette area, known as 'Base Demeple'. The killed gangster was also the brother of the Base Demeple faction leader (known as 'Ti Jamesly'). The killing motivated clashes between the mentioned gangs on 8 December (coded separately). 1 fatality.

source: Infos Partage; SG Alert (Whatsapp); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 7 December 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 83, Ouest, unidentified individuals kidnapped a person in Delmas 77. There is no information on the identity of the abductors, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

source: Infos Partage; SG Alert (Whatsapp); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 7 December 2025, in Delmas - Maguana, Ouest, unidentified individuals kidnapped two people on Maguana Street (Delmas 31 neighbourhood). There is no information on the identity of the abductors, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

source: Amerique Info 7; AP; BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Haiti Libre; Haiti Standard; Metropole; Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 8 December 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bel Air, Ouest, overnight, two gang factions from the Belair Gang (both affiliated with the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) engaged in clashes. 19 gang members (including three high-ranking gangsters), 10 children forcibly enlisted, and an elderly man were killed. One of the notorious gang members was decapitated, while the Belair gang leader was injured. One source reported him killed by the Viv Ansanm Gang hours later after refusing to release some kidnapped victims. However, no other media corroborated this information. One version stated that clashes erupted after the Belair Gang faction operating on Perpetuel and Tiremasse streets had killed a gangster from another Belair Gang faction operating in the Morne Marinette area, known as 'Base Demeple' (coded separately). Another theory stated that clashes stemmed from rivalries over territorial disputes, while another stated misunderstandings over the handling of kidnappings. A different media identified the clashing gangs as members of the Belair Gang and the Base Project La Saline Gang, although this was not supported by other sources. After clashes, it was reported that the leader of the Belair Gang, Sanon Kempes, had been replaced by new leaders, known as 'Ti Gason' and 'Jamesly'. According to BINUH, the clashes involved the Base Krache Dife and Tokyo gangs on the one hand, and the Belair Gang (a.k.a. Les Argentins), on the other. Between 8 and 9 December, at least 86 people (63 gang members and 23 members of the population) were killed during gang clashes in Bel Air. 86 split across two events. 43 coded here.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Press Network; Le Facteur Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Rezo Nodwes; SG Alert (Whatsapp); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 8 December 2025, in the Mirebalais commune, Centre, police forces conducted a security operation in the Zocofra locality and clashed with members of the Taliban and the 400 Mawozo gangs (both affiliated with the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition). A police officer was shot and killed, several gang members were killed, and several others were injured. Some of the injured criminals were evacuated by their accomplices during their retreat. The police regained control of the area. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3, including the killed police officer.
On 8 December 2025, in Fer A Cheval, Centre, gang members (likely members of the Viv Ansanm Gang, who attacked the city of Mirebalais on the same day) clashed with police forces. Casualties unknown.

Other: On 8 December 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, in the evening, gunshots were heard in the Delmas 32 and Delmas 40 B neighborhoods. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

source: Haiti Libre; Radio Tele Galaxie; SG Alert (Whatsapp); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 8 December 2025, in Carrefour - Fontamara, Ouest, members of the Ti Bwa Gang kidnapped seventeen technicians from the State Electric Company after intercepting them in a pick-up truck while working on the reparation of a power circuit. The leader of the Ti Bwa Gang claimed responsibility for the abduction, which aimed at forcing the regular supply of electricity in areas under the control of the Ti Bwa Gang. The victims were released the following day. As reported, parts of the Fontamara, Martissant and Grand-Ravine neighborhoods received electricity for the first time in almost a year.

source: AP; BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Rezo Nodwes
notes: Around 9 December 2025 (between 8 - 10 December), in Port-au-Prince - Bel Air, Ouest, the Base Krache Dife killed 19 women identified as partners of Belair gang members (whom the Krache Dife Gang was suspected to have an alliance with). The victims were targeted while looking for care for gang members who had been injured during clashes between rival factions of the Belair Gang on 8 December (coded separately). Between 8 and 9 December, at least 86 people (63 gang members and 23 members of the population) were killed during gang clashes in Bel Air. According to BINUH, the clashes involved the Base Krache Dife and Tokyo gangs on the one hand, and the Belair Gang (a.k.a. Les Argentins), on the other. 86 split across two events. 43 coded here.

Other: On 9 December 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, in the evening, gunshots were heard in the Delmas 32 and Delmas 40 B neighborhoods. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

source: Alterpresse; El Nacional (Dominican Republic); Le Nouvelliste (Haiti)
notes: On 10 December 2025, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, hundreds of Haitian citizens and several civil society organizations held a march with banners from the Dajabon border post to the Ouanaminthe Peace Court demanding respect for human rights, notably women's and migrants' human rights. Protesters also called for justice for a Haitian girl who died in unclarified circumstances during a school trip in the Dominican Republic. The march was led by the Jesuit Migrant Service (SJM-Haiti), the Northeast Gender Platform (PGNE), the Ouanaminthe Women's Gathering (RFEO) and, UN Women. It was held on the occasion of the International Day of Human Rights.

On 11 December 2025, in the Leogane commune, Ouest, overnight, armed group members attacked residents in the Okap communal section (Leogane's 7th communal section) and killed at least two civilians. One was identified as a public official of the Councils of Administration of the Communal Sections (CASEC). The attackers looted and burned down several houses. Some residents fled their homes. At least 2 fatalities.

On 11 December 2025, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, for the second consecutive day, a group of Haitian citizens held a protest with banners at the Dajabon border post demanding justice for a Haitian girl who died in unclarified circumstances during a school trip in the Dominican Republic.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Libre; Haiti Standard; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: Looting: On 12 December 2025, in Petion Ville - Juvenat, Ouest, in the morning, the judiciary police carried out an operation at the residence of the Port-au-Prince's mayor and seized several firearms, a drone, and cartridges. During the intervention, a dog was shot and killed for unknown reasons, while a gardener and a security guard were arrested. The main barrier of the mayor's residence was destroyed. Material damages were also registered at the property located right next to it, which belongs to an artist man. It was not clear whether the operation aimed at checking the mayor's house or the artist's property.

Other: On 12 December 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, in the morning, gunshots were heard near the OAVCT office on October 15 Boulevard. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

Other: On 12 December 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, tires were set on fire in the middle of the road leading to the center of Port-au-Prince. There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblock or who set them up.

source: Alterpresse; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Vant Bef Info
notes: Movement of forces: On 8 December 2025, in Tabarre - Aeroport Toussaint Louverture, Ouest, 230 Kenyan police officers were deployed to join the Gang Suppression Force (FSG), backed by the United Nations to fight gang violence in the country.

source: Gazette Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 6 December 2025, in Tibi, Sud, overnight, unidentified gang members entered a property by force and shot and killed two young women (18-year-old and 20-year-old) and injured their aunt (this one described as the widow of a known businessman and former owner of the 'La Difference Borlette' company, whom the house belonged to). The motivation for the attack was not clarified, although four individuals were later arrested in connection with it. A businessman and another individual known as 'Patchouco' are wanted. A total of eight individuals were arrested by 12 December. 2 fatalities, 1 injured.

On 8 December 2025, in Port-de-Paix, Nord-Ouest, unidentified individuals smeared the facade of the city hall with fecal matter. This was the suspected authorship of protesting citizens calling for the departure of the mayor for mismanagement and corruption, among other accusations.

Around 3 December 2025 (as reported), in Port-de-Paix, Nord-Ouest, several dozen citizens held a protest calling for the departure of the mayor. Protesting citizens decried corruption and the increasing unsanitary conditions in the commune.

On 12 October 2025, in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, a police officer beat up a journalist man with his firearm on several occasions and punched him during an altercation at a march being held a the Gymnase Benjamin B Vincent. The police use of force was described as disproportionate. There were no fatalities.

On 19 December 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, hundreds of residents from Pont Sonde, Liancourt, Montrouis, and Jean Denis held a protest with banners from the Pat-Chwal police station and along the National Road 1 demanding the police to dismantle Kokorat San Ras and the Gran Grif gangs.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Libre; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Vant Bef Info
notes: On 23 December 2025, in Piatre, Artibonite, in the morning, members of the Taliban Gang coming from the Canaan area attacked and injured at least 13 residents as they set fire to civilian and farmers' properties. In response, local self-defense group members intervened and clashed with the criminals. According to witnesses, there were casualties among the gang members, although the count is unknown. At least 13 injured.

source: Haiti Libre; Haiti Progres; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: Around 24 December 2025 (as reported), between Saint-Marc and L'Estere (coded to Pont Sonde), Artibonite, residents and members of local organizations mostly integrated by farmers and workers held a protest and blocked the National Road 1 between Pont Sonde and L'Estere demanding the police to dismantle Kokorat San Ras, Gran Grif, and the Taliban gangs. Protesting residents also demanded for the establishment of a security operations center with drone units to combat gangs. Protesters were supported by members of self-defense groups, including the Coalition of Revolutionaries to Save the Artibonite (a.k.a. Jean-Denis Gang), and associations like the Union of Visionary Planters for the Development of Artibonite (SPVDA). The National Road 1 remained blocked for several days.

source: Echo Journal; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: Around 27 December 2025 (as reported), in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, members of the Timepri Gang attacked residents in the K-Maya and Kan-Mari neighborhoods. They also set up roadblock in Kan-Mari and Villa, as well as in Pont Sonde (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 30 December 2025, in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, in the morning, internally displaced residents from Pont Sonde held a protest in front of the Saint-Marc customs administration building to demand local authorities to restore security, fight gang violence, and provide better living conditions for the displaced population. Protesters blocked access to the communal market and used a truck to interrupt road traffic. The protest was held after the mayor had ordered the forced evacuation of displaced residents from the city hall, where they had been taking refuge temporarily.

actor1: Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang
source: Gazette Haiti; Haiti Libre; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: Around 15 December 2025 (between 15 - 16 December), in the Liancourt commune, Artibonite, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang attacked residents in Bois Belanger (a.k.a. Bwa Belanje), Marecage, Ti Woch, and several other localities of Liancourt. During the attack in Bois Belanger, at least six people were shot and killed, while more than 12 were injured, and several were kidnapped. Their whereabouts are unknown. The gang members opened fire inside a church, killing a person. A pregnant woman was wounded. Several houses were looted and burned down. The police and a local self-defense brigade intervened and clashed with the criminals, who, according to witnesses, wanted to impose a gang leader in Deschapelles. Other residents claimed that the attack was linked to recurrent clashes between rival gangs. At least 6 fatalities, at least 12 injured.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Libre; Haiti Progres; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 20 December 2025, in Beaumont, Grande-Anse, a mob of residents lynched to death and set fire to the bodies of two women and a man in Carrefour Castor. One of the women was a voodoo priest. She was accused of using witchcraft to kill a man. Among the mobsters, two brothers were identified as the masterminds of the attack. They were the sons of the mentioned man. Some relatives and residents were also beaten up and intimidated after the lynching. On 26 December, the police arrested a suspect who had been seen in a video carrying the body of one victim. 3 fatalities.

source: Le Facteur Haiti; Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 27 December 2025, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, a police officer and two municipal agents of the Cap-Haitien mayor's team physically aggressed two journalists near Rue 6. The victims claimed that the aggression was a reprisal for the statements they had made moments before during a radio emission on Souvenir FM radio station. According to local authorities, the aggression took place after someone threw stones at the municipal agents during the removal of wrongly-parked vehicles. There were no fatalities.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Libre; Le Facteur Haiti; PNH: National Police of Haiti; Vant Bef Info
notes: Weapons seizure: On 29 December 2025, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, police forces and customs officers seized three firearms, including two pistols and an AK-47 rifle, eight chargers, and 36 boxes of ammunition (with 1,800 cartridges), among other items, at the Cap-Haitien port. A man was arrested in connection with the seizure. The weapons were intercepted in a container coming from the US.

source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 16 December 2025, in Bercy, Ouest, police forces and members of a self-defense group engaged in clashes with the Taliban Gang (affiliated with the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) as the criminals set fire to several houses and more than 10 public transport vehicles. Other sources stated that the burned vehicles were a tanker truck and cargo trucks. During clashes, at least six gang members were shot and killed. A police officer and three self-defense group members were injured. It is unknown if there were civilian casualties. At least 6 fatalities, 4 injured.

On 23 December 2025, in Bercy, Ouest, police forces engaged in clashes with members of an unidentified gang. During clashes, several people who were nearby were injured by the stray bullets. Several injured.

On 24 December 2025, in Lafiteau, Ouest, overnight, security forces (likely the Task Force Police coded as Police forces) launched drone strikes against gang targets during an operation in the Minoterie sector. According to witnesses, the drones charged with explosives hit members of the Bel Bos Gang taking part in a celebration, killing several dozens. At least 20 fatalities.
On 28 December 2025, in Bercy, Ouest, police forces engaged in clashes with armed individuals along the National Road 1. Road traffic was interrupted due to the clashes. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 17 December 2025, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, overnight, security forces (likely the Task Force coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched drone strikes in the border of the commune, were explosions were heard. This was part of anti-gang operations conducted by police forces and the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) against suspected members of the Kraze Barye Gang. Casualties unknown.

source: Gazette Haiti; Haiti Libre; Haiti Progres; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Trip Foumi; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 19 December 2025, near Bon Repos, Ouest, armed gang members abducted two police officers from the Intervention and Law Enforcement Corps (CIMO) from a public bus in the Canaan area. According to witnesses, the abductors got in a bus from the 'Sans Souci' company, identified the officers, and forced them out of the vehicle. The victims were taken to an unknown location. Their whereabouts are unknown.

On 19 December 2025, in Carrefour, Ouest, in the morning, unidentified armed individuals kidnapped the leader of the Revolutionary Party for Organization and Progress (PROP) at his home. The victim was also a lawyer and a member of the so-called 'Kafou Leve Mache' organization. The abductors opened fire as they were kidnapping the victim and left the property in two vehicles they had stolen from the parking of the house. It is unknown whether the abduction was motivated by the political affiliation of the victim. His whereabouts are unknown.

Non-violent activity: Around 6 October 2025 (as reported), in Cite Soleil - Waaf Jeremie, Ouest, the leader of the Micanord Gang was seen distributing envelopes with cash and school kits among the population.
On 13 December 2025, in Delmas - Gerald Bataille, Ouest, vendors blocked roads near Dumornay Market to protest against the destruction of the market by a fire between 10-11 December overnight.

source: Haiti Libre; Juno 7; Le Facteur Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 22 December 2025, in Delmas - Village W. Lamothe, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a security guard as they tried to kidnap a person at the intersection of Catherie Flon and Ardouin streets, next to the Delmas 31 Road. The security guard was working for a commercial business in the area. Police forces intervened and engaged in clashes with the armed men, killing one. The accomplices managed to escape. The kidnapping was thwarted. The police seized a firearm. 2 fatalities.

Around 29 December 2025 (between 28 - 29 December), in Delmas - Delmas 17, Ouest, three young men were shot and killed and their bodies were found burned along the Delmas 19 Road at the height of the Mere Delia institution (Delmas 17), on 29 December. The victims were seen on 28 December for the last time. Their relatives had been informed that police officers took them in a patrol from workplace (mechanical workshop) in Delmas 31 to Delmas 19, where the bodies were found. Relatives claimed that the victims were not involved in criminal activities and that they were carrying their identity cards with them. 3 fatalities.

source: Haiti Libre; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 23 December 2025, off the Coast of Gressier, Ouest, coast guards from the National Police of Haiti engaged in clashes with armed gang members on board of five vessels as they attacked a convoy of 13 merchant sailing boats whose final destination was the Gonave island. During clashes, several gang members and a civilian crew member were killed. There were no casualties among the coast guards. One gang vessel was destroyed. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3, including the killed civilian.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Libre; Haiti Progres; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Trip Foumi
notes: On 26 December 2025, near Kenscoff - Godet, Ouest, armed gang members shot and killed several civilians and injured others as they attacked the Obissa Bourette and Mahotiere Bourette areas, in the zone of Nan Galet (near Godet). Multiple properties were looted and destroyed. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Libre; Haiti Progres; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Trip Foumi
notes: On 27 December 2025, near Kenscoff - Godet, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, armed gang members shot and killed several civilians and injured others as they attacked Obissa Bourette and Mahotiere Bourette areas, in the zone of Nan Galet (near Godet). Multiple properties were looted and destroyed. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Libre; Haiti Standard; Juno 7; Le Facteur Haiti; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 30 December 2025, in Kenscoff - Fermathe, Ouest, overnight, an armed man shot and killed a police officer in front of the Sheeshee's Food Club, near the Lotin sub-police station (in Fermathe, near the Fort-Jacques area), where he was on-duty. The officer was a police inspector and the leader of a self-defense group from Fort-Jacques. He was known for his engagement in resistance against the Kraze Barye Gang. The attacker was later identified as the owner of the club. The police arrested the brother-in-law of the suspect. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 17 December 2025, in Petion Ville - Belvil, Ouest, overnight, police forces supported by the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) engaged in clashes with suspected members of the Kraze Barye Gang as part of anti-gang operations in the neighborhood. During the intervention, that lasted until the morning of 18 December, gunshots and the explosion of drones charged with explosives (likely launched by the Task Force Police) were heard along the Freres Road. Casualties unknown.

On 17 December 2025, in Petion Ville - Pernier, Ouest, overnight, police forces supported by the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) engaged in clashes with suspected members of the Kraze Barye Gang as part of anti-gang operations in the neighborhood. During the intervention, that lasted until the morning of 18 December, gunshots and the explosion of drones charged with explosives (likely launched by the Task Force Police) were heard. Casualties unknown.

On 17 December 2025, in Petion Ville - Vivy Mitchell, Ouest, overnight, police forces supported by the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) engaged in clashes with suspected members of the Kraze Barye Gang as part of anti-gang operations in the neighborhood. During the intervention, that lasted until the morning of 18 December, gunshots and the explosion of drones charged with explosives (likely launched by the Task Force Police) were heard along the Freres Road. Casualties unknown.

source: Juno 7; Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 29 December 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, hundreds of political militants and citizens called by the Movement for Reconciliation and National Reconstruction (MORN) (political movement) held a sit-in protest with banners along the Panamerican road demanding the departure of the Transitional Presidential Council (CPT) and calling for a political transition. The police intervened (methods unclarified) and dispersed the protest.

Security measures: Around 23 December 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces imposed a ban on carrying firearms and white arms, including machetes and knives, in public events and mass gatherings, including sport-related events and fairs. The measure was declared for the Christmas period.

On 28 December 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bourdon, Ouest, unidentified individuals kidnapped a DJ man in the neighborhood. One source stated that the abductors asked for the payment of a ransom. There is no further information on the kidnapping, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victim was released on 30 December.

source: Haiti Libre; Le Facteur Haiti; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 30 December 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bel Air, Ouest, in the morning, according to witnesses, police forces supported by the Task Force Police shot and killed several members of the Jamesley Gang (a faction of the Belair Gang) during security operations in the Bel Air, Sans Fil, Centre Ville, and Portail Leogane neighborhoods (coded separately). Several explosions of drones charged with explosives were heard. The police intervention also involved the seizure of war firearms (several pistols, assault weapons, and shotguns), a drone, and ammunition. The residence of the gang leader, known as 'Jamesley', was destroyed. He managed to escape. An unspecified number of casualties were registered. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 30 December 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bicentenaire, Ouest, police forces supported by the Task Force Police shot and killed several gang members (likely from the Jamesley Gang, a faction of the Belair Gang) during security operations in the Fort St Claire area (Bicentenaire). Several explosions of drones charged with explosives were heard. Similar police operations on that day killed members of that gang in Bel Air, Sans Fil, Centre Ville, and Portail Leogane neighborhoods (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Haiti Libre; Juno 7; Le Facteur Haiti
notes: On 30 December 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville, Ouest, police forces supported by the Task Force Police shot and killed several members of the Jamesley Gang (a faction of the Belair Gang) during security operations on Rue des Casernes (Centre Ville), Portail Leogane, Sans Fil, Centre Ville, and Bel Air neighborhoods (coded separately). Several explosions of drones charged with explosives were heard. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

source: Haiti Libre; Juno 7; Le Facteur Haiti
notes: On 30 December 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Portail Leogane/Cite Louverture, Ouest, police forces supported by the Task Force Police shot and killed several members of the Jamesley Gang (a faction of the Belair Gang) during security operations in the Portail Leogane, Sans Fil, Centre Ville, and Bel Air neighborhoods (coded separately). A public bus coming from Carrefour was hit by the stray bullets. Several explosions of drones charged with explosives were heard. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 30 December 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Sans Fil, Ouest, police forces supported by the Task Force Police shot and killed several members of the Jamesley Gang (a faction of the Belair Gang) during security operations in the Sans Fil, Bel Air, Centre Ville, and Portail Leogane neighborhoods (coded separately). Several explosions of drones charged with explosives were heard. In Sans Fil, at least four corpses were left on the streets after the operation. At least 4 fatalities.

On 14 December 2025, around Tabarre - Aeroport Toussaint Louverture, Ouest, a Dominican aircraft with five passengers onboard was hit by gunshots (authorship unknown) after taken off from the airport towards Cap-Haitien. The pilot and the passengers escaped unharmed. There were no casualties.
Other: On 15 December 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Cazeau. There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots.

source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 17 December 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, overnight, police forces supported by the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) engaged in clashes with suspected members of the Kraze Barye Gang as part of anti-gang operations in the Timoulin area. During the intervention, that lasted until the morning of 18 December, gunshots and the explosion of drones charged with explosives (likely launched by the Task Force Police) were heard. At least seven drone explosions were heard in Tabarre. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Juno 7; Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); Metropole; Rezo Nodwes; Vant Bef Info
notes: On 17 December 2025, in Tabarre - Torcelle, Ouest, overnight, police forces supported by the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) engaged in clashes with suspected members of the Kraze Barye Gang as part of anti-gang operations in the Eddy One sector. During the intervention, that lasted until the morning of 18 December, gunshots and the explosion of drones charged with explosives (likely launched by the Task Force Police) were heard. At least seven drone explosions were heard in Tabarre. Casualties unknown.

source: Le Nouvelliste (Haiti); PNH: National Police of Haiti; Vant Bef Info
notes: Defusal: On 25 December 2025, in Tabarre - Clercine II/Carrefour Clercine, Ouest, overnight, police forces intercepted and seized a set of explosives that had been placed at the Tabarre public market by unknown individuals. Unidentified individuals had planted the explosives as part of a planned operation aimed at causing panic among the population and destroying and burning the market during the New Year festivities.

On 9 December 2025, in Montrouis, Artibonite, members of the Taliban Gang (affiliated with the Viv Ansanm Gang coalition) shot and killed three civilians after intercepting them driving a vehicle along the National Road 1. One of the victims was a female civil employee from the National Police of Haiti. Their bodies and the vehicle were set on fire. 3 fatalities.

Movement of forces: Around 15 December 2025 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, 25 military and police officers from the Jamaica Defense Force (JDF) and the Jamaica Constabulary Force (JCF) were deployed and joined the Gang Suppression Force (FSG) to fight gang violence.

On 17 December 2025, in Delmas - Carrefour Drouillard/Parc Industriel, Ouest, overnight, security forces (likely the Task Force Police coded as Police forces) suspectedly launched drone strikes near Acierie d'Haiti on Route Nationale #1. The circumstances of the launches are unknown, although they might be related to a series of clashes and strikes in several areas (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

Other: On 18 December 2025, in Petionville, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Delmas 95 and Jacquet Toto. Other noises were also heard in the area. There is no information on the authorship of the gunshots and noises, although they might be related to clashes and explosions that happened in other areas of the commune overnight (coded separately).

On 19 December 2025, in Delmas - Maguana, Ouest, an unknown number of people were kidnapped in Delmas 31. Although there is no information about the identity of the perpetrators, they wore National Police uniforms during the abduction and latest reports suggest most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victim(s) are unknown.
Other: On 19 December 2025, in Tabarre, Ouest, burning tires were erected in Carrefour Fleuriot. There is no information on the circumstances of the tires or who set them up.
Other: On 22 December 2025, in Bercy, Ouest, in Bercy, Ouest, a roadblock was set up on the Route Nationale #1. There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblock or who set it up.

Other: On 22 December 2025, in Delmas, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Puits Blain 19. The gunshots were heard after discussions between the police and members of the population, although the specific circumstances and authorship of the gunshots were not specified.

source: Alterpresse; Haiti Libre; Juno 7; SG Alert (Whatsapp)
notes: On 23 December 2025, in Deluge, Artibonite, unidentified armed individuals engaged in an armed clash. The identity and affiliation of those involved in clashes were not clarified. Casualties unknown.

On 24 December 2025, in Deluge, Artibonite, for a second consecutive day, unidentified armed individuals engaged in an armed clash. The identity and affiliation of those involved in clashes were not clarified. Casualties unknown.

On 25 December 2025, in Deluge, Artibonite, for a third consecutive day, unidentified armed individuals engaged in an armed clash. The identity and affiliation of those involved in clashes were not clarified. Casualties unknown.

Non-violent activity: On 27 December 2025, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, members of the Timepri gang set up a roadblock in the Desoulye area. They also set up a roadblock in the Kan-Mari area after carrying out an attack in the neighborhood (coded separately).
On 29 December 2025, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, members of the Viv Ansanm Gang opened fire on a plane and a helicopter in Lilavois. It is unclear if they were hit. Casualties unknown.
Other: On 31 December 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, barricades of burning tires were erected on the Bourdon road. There is no information on the circumstances of the roadblocks or who set them up.

Weapons seizure: On 30 December 2025, in Petion Ville - Pernier, Ouest, police force seized several firearms and over 4,000 rounds of ammunition during operations in the Pernier and Torcelle neighborhoods (coded separately).

Weapons seizure: On 30 December 2025, in Tabarre - Torcelle, Ouest, police force seized several firearms and over 4,000 rounds of ammunition during operations in the Torcelle and Pernier neighborhoods (coded separately).

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti; Mag Haiti
notes: On 14 November 2025, in Lascahobas, Centre, police forces engaged in clashes with gang members. A police officer was shot and injured during the clashes. He died later that day in hospital. 1 fatality.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 5 December 2025, in the Liancourt commune, Artibonite, gang members attacked residents in the Morne Casse, Ondo, and Tienda areas. 25 people were killed and seven were injured. 25 fatalities, 7 injured.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 13 October 2025, in Mirebalais, Centre, the Canaan Gang abducted a woman and asked her family for the payment of a 20,000 gourdes ransom. She was killed a day later (coded separately).

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 12 October 2025, in the Mirebalais commune, Centre, the 400 Mawozo Gang and the Canaan Gang attacked residents in the Piton Laville locality. At least a man was killed. At least 1 fatality.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 13 October 2025, in Mirebalais, Centre, gang members armed with machetes killed five civilians, including four from the same family, as they tried to return to their homes in Mirebalais downtown. The mentioned five victims died during two separate gang attacks on 13 October and 26 November (coded separately). 5 fatalities split across two events. 3 coded here.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 14 October 2025, in Mirebalais, Centre, the Canaan Gang shot and killed a woman before burning her body. The execution was shared live with her family through a video call. The victim, who had been kidnapped on 13 October, was killed after her family was unable to pay a 20,000 gourdes ransom. 1 fatality.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 26 November 2025, in Mirebalais, Centre, gang members armed with machetes killed five civilians, including four from the same family, as they tried to return to their homes in Mirebalais downtown. The mentioned five victims died during two separate gang attacks on 26 November and 13 October (coded separately). 5 fatalities split across two events. 2 coded here.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 2 October 2025, around Santo, Ouest, the 400 Mawozo Gang and the Chien Mechant Gang engaged in armed clashes over the control of an illegally-established checkpoint. During clashes in Lilavois 38, a civilian was shot and injured by a stray bullet. 1 injured.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 10 December 2025, in the Leogane commune, Ouest, the Ti Bwa Gang and the 103 Zombies Gang attacked residents in the Bosejou, Gran Plas, Kafoujan and Sisil localities. The criminals opened indiscriminate fire, killing at least seven civilians (four men, two women, and a girl). Two people were injured (a man and a woman). The gang members also set fire to five houses and kidnapped three people. Their whereabouts are unknown. At least 7 fatalities, 2 injured.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 19 November 2025, in Carrefour - Cote Plage, Ouest, members of the Ti Bwa Gang abducted a vendor woman and her minor son at their home, in Waney 89 (Cote Plage neighborhood). They were shot and killed near the Jerusalem neighborhood. The attack was a reprisal for having disobeyed orders of the gang leader, who had asked the population to remain at home and not to open their business as of 16 November (coded separately). The woman was a vendor who had attended the Brochette market for work. 2 fatalities.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 30 December 2025, in Cite Soleil - Drouillard, Ouest, members of the Terre Noire Gang stabbed a man and a woman to death after they refused to let their bags stolen. 2 fatalities.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 5 October 2025, in Delmas - Delmas 19/Mackandal, Ouest, gang members killed and decapitated a medicinal vendor woman in Delmas 19. The attack was a punishment for suspicions that she was collaborating with the police. She was known for publicly denouncing the presence of gangs. She used to sell her products at the Seradote market (Turgeau). 1 fatality.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 21 October 2025, in the Gressier commune, Ouest, members of the local population armed with machetes beat up and stoned a woman to death in an isolated area of the Sousson neighborhood (near the sea front) before burning her body with gasoline. The mobsters accused her of being an informant to the 103 Zombies Gang. 1 fatality.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 28 October 2025, in the Gressier commune Ouest, three members of the 103 Zombies Gang raped a woman in the Pandjanmen area before killing her with machetes over accusations that she had not been faithful to his partner (a gang member too). 1 fatality.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 20 November 2025, in Petion Ville - Cargo, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang shot and killed several members of a self-defense group. A total of three self-defense brigade members were killed during clashes with the Kraze Barye Gang in Cargo on 20 November and in Diegue on 3 December (coded separately). 3 fatalities split across two events. 2 coded here.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 3 December 2025, in Petion Ville - Diegue, Ouest, the Kraze Barye Gang shot and killed several members of a self-defense group. A total of three self-defense brigade members were killed during clashes with the Kraze Barye Gang in Diegue on 3 December and in Cargo on 20 November (coded separately). 3 fatalities split across two events. 1 coded here.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 19 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang) opened fire on a public transport vehicle in the Port-au-Prince downtown as they were chased by police forces and wanted to disrupt the operation. During the attack, nine passengers were injured, including six men and three women. 9 injured.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 10 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Bicentenaire, Ouest, members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang raped four street vendors women and robbed them from their belongings at gang-controlled checkpoints in the Fort Saint Clair area (Bicentenaire neighborhood), and in Portail Leogane and (coded separately).

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 15 October 2025, in Port-au-Prince - La Saline, Ouest, gang members killed and decapitated a resident at a voodoo temple to use the victim as a 'sacrifice' during a voodoo ceremony. 1 fatality.

source: BINUH: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
notes: On 7 November 2025, in Port-au-Prince - Portail Leogane/Cite Louverture, Ouest, members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang raped four street vendors women and robbed them from their belongings at gang-controlled checkpoints in Portail Leogane and the Fort Saint Clair area, in Bicentenaire (coded separately).
